original: 175 / mthe bo dag dang mthe'u chung sbyar ba padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs gung mo dag ni brkyang ba dang // mdzub mo gnyis ni zla ba phyed pa ming med 'og tu bskum pa rang gi lag mthil son gyur pa //
analyzed: 175 / mthe bo dag dang mthe'u chung sbyar ba padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs gung mo dag ni brkyang ba dang // mdzub mo gnyis ni zla ba phyed pa ming med 'og tu bskum pa rang gi lag mthil son gyur pa //
translated: The thumbs and little fingers joined, the middle fingers extended like lotus petals, the two forefingers half-moon shaped, the name fingers bent under the ring fingers, resting in the palm of the hand,

original: phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje can gyi rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje can gyi rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: this mudra becomes the five-pronged vajra of the vajra-holders, and should be displayed.

original: rtsibs kyi rnam pa sor mo rnams te lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du mthe bo la sogs mtha' dag rnams /
analyzed: rtsibs kyi rnam pa sor mo rnams te lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du mthe bo la sogs mtha' dag rnams /
translated: The fingers are in the shape of spokes, and the thumbs and all the others in both palms,

original: 176 / lag pa gnyis ni rdo rje bcings pa rdo rjer 'gyur te rdo rje khu tshur dag gis dril bur bcas //
analyzed: 176 / lag pa gnyis ni rdo rje bcings pa rdo rjer 'gyur te rdo rje khu tshur dag gis dril bur bcas //
translated: the two hands vajra-bound, become the vajra, with the two vajra fists holding the bell.

original: khu tshur phyed pa mdzub mo dang ni gung mo mda' dang mtshungs pa dag kyang ral gri rnon por 'gyur //
analyzed: khu tshur phyed pa mdzub mo dang ni gung mo mda' dang mtshungs pa dag kyang ral gri rnon por 'gyur //
translated: The half-fist with the forefinger and middle finger like an arrow becomes the sharp sword.

original: mdzub mo la sogs rtse gsum slar yang bkram pa dag ste khu tshur phyed pa yis ni rtse gsum la //
analyzed: mdzub mo la sogs rtse gsum slar yang bkram pa dag ste khu tshur phyed pa yis ni rtse gsum la //
translated: The forefinger and so forth are the three points, again extended, with the half-fist the three points,

original: dpal ldan gri gug khu tshur bcings shing @54b dpal ldan mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa 'jigs pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: dpal ldan gri gug khu tshur bcings shing @54b dpal ldan mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa 'jigs pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: The glorious curved knife is made by clenching the fist and raising the glorious little finger like a half-moon.

original: 177 / rna ba'i steng du khu tshur bcings shing mthe bong gung mo'i steng du 'gyur te mda' yi mchog la'o //üîΩkhu tshur bcings shing mdzub mo shin tu 'khyog por 'gyur ro mi bdag de bzhin nyid du lcags kyu la'o //üîΩrtsa bar mdzub mo ming med du 'gyur mda' dang mtshungs pa'i steng du gung mo yang ni mdung la ste //
analyzed: 177 / rna ba'i steng du khu tshur bcings shing mthe bong gung mo'i steng du 'gyur te mda' yi mchog la'o // khu tshur bcings shing mdzub mo shin tu 'khyog por 'gyur ro mi bdag de bzhin nyid du lcags kyu la'o // rtsa bar mdzub mo ming med du 'gyur mda' dang mtshungs pa'i steng du gung mo yang ni mdung la ste //
translated: The arrow is made by clenching the fist and raising the thumb and ring finger.üîΩThe goad is made by clenching the fist and bending the index finger.üîΩThe spear is made by bending the index finger and little finger and raising the middle finger.

original: thad kar khu tshur dbyug pa la'o lag mthil shin tu mnyam la mthe bo brkyang ba dgra sta la /
analyzed: thad kar khu tshur dbyug pa la'o lag mthil shin tu mnyam la mthe bo brkyang ba dgra sta la /
translated: The club is made by clenching the fist straight up. The axe is made by flattening the palm and raising the thumb.

original: 178 / steng du khu tshur gnyis dang mdzub mor 'gyur te lha min bdag po glang chen pags pa dag la'o //
analyzed: 178 / steng du khu tshur gnyis dang mdzub mor 'gyur te lha min bdag po glang chen pags pa dag la'o //
translated: The elephant skin of the lord of the asuras is made by raising two fists and index fingers.

original: mche ba la ni lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du khu tshur bcings shing mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa'o //
analyzed: mche ba la ni lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du khu tshur bcings shing mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa'o //
translated: For the tusk, the two palms are clenched into fists, with the little fingers half-moon shaped.

original: khe ta ka la dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang zhing lag pa'i mthil ni steng du son par 'gyur //
analyzed: khe ta ka la dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang zhing lag pa'i mthil ni steng du son par 'gyur //
translated: For the goad, the left arm is extended, with the palm of the hand turned upward.

original: kha tv'am ga la khu tshur bug par 'gyur te nges pa nyid du phrag par mthe'u chung brkyang ba'o /
analyzed: kha tv'am ga la khu tshur bug par 'gyur te nges pa nyid du phrag par mthe'u chung brkyang ba'o /
translated: For the goad, the fist is hollow, with the little finger extended over the shoulder.

original: 179 / sor mo bug pa med pa'i lag pa pad 'dab lta bu steng du byas pa dpal ldan thod pa la //
analyzed: 179 / sor mo bug pa med pa'i lag pa pad 'dab lta bu steng du byas pa dpal ldan thod pa la //
translated: For the glorious skull, the hand is palm-up like a lotus leaf, with no fingers in the holes.

original: gzhu la lag pa gan rkyal khu tshur du 'gyur nges par dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang ba'o //üîΩgung mo dag ni mdzub mo 'khyog po kun du brten par 'gyur te nges par rdo rje zhags pa la //
analyzed: gzhu la lag pa gan rkyal khu tshur du 'gyur nges par dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang ba'o // gung mo dag ni mdzub mo 'khyog po kun du brten par 'gyur te nges par rdo rje zhags pa la //
translated: For the bow, the hand is supine, a fist, with the left arm extended.üîΩFor the vajra noose, the middle fingers are bent and touch, with the index fingers extended.

original: rin chen la ni sbyar ba'i sor mor 'gyur te mi bdag de dag rnam par phye ba padma la /
analyzed: rin chen la ni sbyar ba'i sor mor 'gyur te mi bdag de dag rnam par phye ba padma la /
translated: For the jewel, the fingers are joined, and for the lotus, the fingers are spread.

original: 180 / chu na rgyu ba la ni mdzub mo mthe bo sbyar bar 'gyur te mthe bo'i 'og tu khu tshur ro //
analyzed: 180 / chu na rgyu ba la ni mdzub mo mthe bo sbyar bar 'gyur te mthe bo'i 'og tu khu tshur ro //
translated: The fingers are bent in the shape of a hook, with the thumb and forefinger joined, and the fist below the thumb.

original: me long la ni shin tu mnyam pa'i lag mthil sor mo bug med dang bcas mngon du phyogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: me long la ni shin tu mnyam pa'i lag mthil sor mo bug med dang bcas mngon du phyogs par 'gyur //
translated: In the mirror, the palm of the hand is completely flat, with the fingers straight and the fist below.

original: mthe bo la ni mdzub mo la sogs steng du 'khyog po rim par yongs su bkod pa lcags sgrog la'o //
analyzed: mthe bo la ni mdzub mo la sogs steng du 'khyog po rim par yongs su bkod pa lcags sgrog la'o //
translated: In the chain, the thumb and the other fingers are bent in order, with the forefinger on top.

original: mgo po la ni mthe bo la sogs bzhi po gdong dang mtshungs shing 'og tu mthe'u chung bskum pa'o /
analyzed: mgo po la ni mthe bo la sogs bzhi po gdong dang mtshungs shing 'og tu mthe'u chung bskum pa'o /
translated: In the head, the four fingers, beginning with the thumb, are bent like the face, with the little finger bent below.

original: 181 / cod pan la ni lag pa dag gis dung gi phyag rgya mdzub mo gnyis po sbyar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 181 / cod pan la ni lag pa dag gis dung gi phyag rgya mdzub mo gnyis po sbyar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: In the turban, the hands form the conch mudra, with the two forefingers joined.

original: lag mthil dag gi rgyab tu sor mo lnga po rnams ni gcig tu sbyar ba dag kyang rna rgyan la //
analyzed: lag mthil dag gi rgyab tu sor mo lnga po rnams ni gcig tu sbyar ba dag kyang rna rgyan la //
translated: In the earrings, the five fingers are joined together on the back of the hand.

original: lag pa'i rgyab tu sor mo rnams ni rim par yongs su bkod cing bcings pa mgul ba'i rgyan la ste //
analyzed: lag pa'i rgyab tu sor mo rnams ni rim par yongs su bkod cing bcings pa mgul ba'i rgyan la ste //
translated: In the necklace, the fingers are arranged in order on the back of the hand, with the fist below.

original: lag pa gnyi ga'i sor mo gsum ni phan tshun sbyar cing thog @55a * //
analyzed: lag pa gnyi ga'i sor mo gsum ni phan tshun sbyar cing thog @55a * //
translated: The three fingers of both hands are joined together,

original: mtha' bskum pa dag ni ska rags la /
analyzed: mtha' bskum pa dag ni ska rags la /
translated: the tips bent.

original: 182 / khu tshur bcings nas mthe bong dag dang gung mo gnyis po zlum skor lta bur byas pa rkang gdub la //
analyzed: 182 / khu tshur bcings nas mthe bong dag dang gung mo gnyis po zlum skor lta bur byas pa rkang gdub la //
translated: The fists are clenched, and the thumbs and index fingers are in a circle, like anklets.

original: de bzhin du ni dpung rgyan zung dang gdu bu la yang mdzub mo phan tshun sbyar ba dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dpung rgyan zung dang gdu bu la yang mdzub mo phan tshun sbyar ba dag tu 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, the bracelets and armlets are formed by the mutual joining of the index fingers.

original: mthe bo mkha' 'gro ma rnams dag gi mchog gi rigs su 'gyur te mdzub mo gsang ba pa rnams kyi //
analyzed: mthe bo mkha' 'gro ma rnams dag gi mchog gi rigs su 'gyur te mdzub mo gsang ba pa rnams kyi //
translated: The thumbs are the supreme family of the dakinis, and the index fingers are of the Guhyakas.

original: dri za rnams dang gdengs can rnams kyi gung mo ming med dag ni rim par yongs su bkod pa'o /
analyzed: dri za rnams dang gdengs can rnams kyi gung mo ming med dag ni rim par yongs su bkod pa'o /
translated: The middle fingers and little fingers of the Gandharvas and Nagas are arranged in order.

original: 183 /'byung po rnams kyi dpal ldan mthe'u chung rab mchog lag pa'i mthil ni srin po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur //
analyzed: 183 /'byung po rnams kyi dpal ldan mthe'u chung rab mchog lag pa'i mthil ni srin po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur //
translated: The glorious little fingers are of the bhutas, and the palms of the hands are the family of the rakshasas.

original: grub pa rnams kyi khu tshur bcings pa mchog gi rigs te tshigs kyi mchams  ni lha rnams  ngag gi'o //
analyzed: grub pa rnams kyi khu tshur bcings pa mchog gi rigs te tshigs kyi mchams  ni lha rnams  ngag gi'o //
translated: The clenched fists are the supreme family of the siddhas, and the joints are of the gods.

original: lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du sor mo lnga po phyed 'khyog rigs kyi phyag rgya sder mo can rnams kyi //
analyzed: lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du sor mo lnga po phyed 'khyog rigs kyi phyag rgya sder mo can rnams kyi //
translated: On the palms of both hands are the five fingers, half-bent, with the claws of the species.

original: khu tshur bcings las mdzub mo gnyis po phyed 'khyog nges par mgo bor son pa rva can rnams kyi'o /
analyzed: khu tshur bcings las mdzub mo gnyis po phyed 'khyog nges par mgo bor son pa rva can rnams kyi'o /
translated: The two index fingers, half-bent, are definitely on the head, in the form of horns, of the species of the clenched fist.

original: 184 / mi mnyam lag pa'i mthil la mthe'u chung phan tshun bcings shing gshog pa sbyar ba sgong skyes rnams kyi ste //
analyzed: 184 / mi mnyam lag pa'i mthil la mthe'u chung phan tshun bcings shing gshog pa sbyar ba sgong skyes rnams kyi ste //
translated: On the uneven palm of the hand, the two little fingers are crossed and the wings are joined, of the species of the egg-born.

original: sor mo lnga po rtse mo 'khyog pa gdengs can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //üîΩnyin zhag so so'i gtor ma la ni mdzub mo'i mtha' rnams rab brkyang gzhan pa 'og tu sbyar byas pa //
analyzed: sor mo lnga po rtse mo 'khyog pa gdengs can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya khyad par 'phags par 'gyur // nyin zhag so so'i gtor ma la ni mdzub mo'i mtha' rnams rab brkyang gzhan pa 'og tu sbyar byas pa //
translated: The five fingers, with the tips bent, are of the species of the snake.üîΩIn the daily bali offering, the tips of the index fingers are extended, the others joined below.

original: 'bar ba dag la mthe bo sbyar te mchog gi lag mthil dag gi mdzub mo brkyang ba gzhan pa'o /
analyzed: 'bar ba dag la mthe bo sbyar te mchog gi lag mthil dag gi mdzub mo brkyang ba gzhan pa'o /
translated: In the blazing, the thumbs are joined, the others extended in the supreme palm of the hand.

original: 185 / mdzub mo bstan na legs par 'ongs sam dag kyang nges par brjod par 'gyur te rnal 'byor pa la yang //
analyzed: 185 / mdzub mo bstan na legs par 'ongs sam dag kyang nges par brjod par 'gyur te rnal 'byor pa la yang //
translated: If she points with her finger, it is to say ‚ÄúWelcome!‚Äù If she clasps her hands, it is to say ‚ÄúGood fortune!‚Äù

original: gnyis kyis shin tu legs par 'ongs dang skal  bzangs dge ba mthe bo bcings pas rab tu brjod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis kyis shin tu legs par 'ongs dang skal  bzangs dge ba mthe bo bcings pas rab tu brjod par 'gyur //
translated: If she clasps her hands with her thumbs together, it is to say ‚ÄúVery good!‚Äù

original: sor mo'i se gol rdebs pa khyod ni 'di ru sngags pa mchog ces nges par brjod par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: sor mo'i se gol rdebs pa khyod ni 'di ru sngags pa mchog ces nges par brjod par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: If she snaps her fingers, it is to say ‚ÄúYou are the best of magicians here!‚Äù

original: mthe bo dang ni ming med dag gis dam tshig bcas pa'i chang gis khyod ni tshim par byed pa'o /
analyzed: mthe bo dang ni ming med dag gis dam tshig bcas pa'i chang gis khyod ni tshim par byed pa'o /
translated: If she clasps her hands with her thumb and little finger, it is to say ‚ÄúI will satisfy you with the pledge-beer.‚Äù

original: 186 / sor mo thams cad rtse mo brkyang bas skal  bzangs legs par 'ongs pa brjod 'gyur rnal 'byor pa la yang //
analyzed: 186 / sor mo thams cad rtse mo brkyang bas skal  bzangs legs par 'ongs pa brjod 'gyur rnal 'byor pa la yang //
translated: If she extends the tips of all her fingers, it is to say ‚ÄúWelcome, good fortune!‚Äù

original: g-yon gyi yan lag reg pas rtag tu khyod ni bdag gi gnyen gcig pu dag rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: g-yon gyi yan lag reg pas rtag tu khyod ni bdag gi gnyen gcig pu dag rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: If she touches her left arm, it is to say ‚ÄúYou are my only friend.‚Äù

original: skye gnas @55b dag la reg pas gtso bo mchu dang nu ma zung dang nges par sen mo 'debs pas kyang //
analyzed: skye gnas @55b dag la reg pas gtso bo mchu dang nu ma zung dang nges par sen mo 'debs pas kyang //
translated: If she touches her breasts and bites her lower lip, it is to say ‚ÄúI am yours.‚Äù

original: sor mo phan tshun bcings shing gung mo dang ni mthe bo brkyang bas dam tshig rjod par byed pa yin /
analyzed: sor mo phan tshun bcings shing gung mo dang ni mthe bo brkyang bas dam tshig rjod par byed pa yin /
translated: The fingers interlocked, the middle finger and the thumb extended, is the sign for pledge.

original: 187 / mchu dang smin ma mig dag yo zhing mgo la 'phrug par byed na shin tu rmongs pa brjod par byed ;
analyzed: 187 / mchu dang smin ma mig dag yo zhing mgo la 'phrug par byed na shin tu rmongs pa brjod par byed ;
translated: The lips, the eyebrows, the eyes distorted, the head shaken, is the sign for very confused.

original: / mche ba'i dbus su mthe chung dang ni snying ga kha ru mdzub mo 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: / mche ba'i dbus su mthe chung dang ni snying ga kha ru mdzub mo 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: The little finger in the middle of the teeth, the index finger at the heart, is the sign for fear.

original: mthe bo khu tshur bcings pa dang ni lag pa rkang pa sa la rdebs na nga yis bza' bar bya //
analyzed: mthe bo khu tshur bcings pa dang ni lag pa rkang pa sa la rdebs na nga yis bza' bar bya //
translated: The fist with the thumb enclosed, the hand and foot beating the ground, is the sign for I will eat.

original: lce la reg na zos pa dang ni lto dang so la bsnun pa dag gis ma zos pa nyid do /
analyzed: lce la reg na zos pa dang ni lto dang so la bsnun pa dag gis ma zos pa nyid do /
translated: The tongue touched, is the sign for I have eaten, and the stomach and teeth struck, is the sign for I have not eaten.üîΩ The back of the hand, is the sign for kill, and the palm, is the sign for speak clearly.

original: 188 / lag pa'i rgyab kyis sod cig nges par rab tu brjod de mngon du phyogs pas 'dug cig 'dug cig go //
analyzed: 188 / lag pa'i rgyab kyis sod cig nges par rab tu brjod de mngon du phyogs pas 'dug cig 'dug cig go //
translated: The thigh struck, is the sign for sit, and the thigh rubbed, is the sign for sit down, sit down.

original: byin pa brla la nyed  na skal  bzangs khyod ni de ring kho na ngal so nges par rjod par byed //
analyzed: byin pa brla la nyed  na skal  bzangs khyod ni de ring kho na ngal so nges par rjod par byed //
translated: The knee struck, is the sign for good fortune, and the knee rubbed, is the sign for rest today.üîΩ The buttocks struck, is the sign for come, and the buttocks rubbed, is the sign for go.üîΩ The ankle struck, is the sign for good, and the ankle rubbed, is the sign for bad.üîΩ The foot struck, is the sign for come here, and the foot rubbed, is the sign for go away.üîΩ The foot struck with the heel, is the sign for quickly, and the foot rubbed with the heel, is the sign for slowly.üîΩ The foot struck with the toe, is the sign for come here, and the foot rubbed with the toe, is the sign for go away.üîΩ The foot struck with the sole, is the sign for quickly, and the foot rubbed with the sole, is the sign for slowly.üîΩ The foot struck with the knee, is the sign for come here, and the foot rubbed with the knee, is the sign for go away.üîΩ The foot struck with the thigh, is the sign for quickly, and the foot rubbed with the thigh, is the sign for slowly.üîΩ The foot struck with the hand, is the sign for come here, and the foot rubbed with the hand, is the sign for go away.

original: rkang pa rab tu rkyong bas gnyid dang pus mo zung dag rkyong ba bdag la shin tu dga'  ba gyis //
analyzed: rkang pa rab tu rkyong bas gnyid dang pus mo zung dag rkyong ba bdag la shin tu dga'  ba gyis //
translated: With the legs stretched out, one should sleep with the knees drawn up to the chest.

original: yan lag kun la reg par byed cing kha ru lag pa gnas pa bdag la 'dus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag kun la reg par byed cing kha ru lag pa gnas pa bdag la 'dus pa med pa'o //
translated: With the hands placed in the mouth, one should not be too familiar with oneself.

original: 189 / phan tshun lag pa bcings pas bdag gi khyim du de ring 'khor lo 'dus pa dag ni rjod par byed //
analyzed: 189 / phan tshun lag pa bcings pas bdag gi khyim du de ring 'khor lo 'dus pa dag ni rjod par byed //
translated: With the hands crossed, one should today proclaim the assembly of the wheel in one‚Äôs house.

original: mthe bo ming med rtse mo dag gis rnam mang dam tshig rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya /
analyzed: mthe bo ming med rtse mo dag gis rnam mang dam tshig rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya /
translated: With the tips of the thumb and little finger, one should worship with the many pledges as one wishes.

original: rkang pa la ni 'phrug par byed na de bzhin du ni phyi rol 'dus pa dag la 'gro ba yang //
analyzed: rkang pa la ni 'phrug par byed na de bzhin du ni phyi rol 'dus pa dag la 'gro ba yang //
translated: If one scratches the feet, one should go in that way to the external assembly.

original: mdzub mo phan tshun bcings na rdo rje'i grogs po khyod ni  di ring 'jigs pa 'phrog par byed pa'o /
analyzed: mdzub mo phan tshun bcings na rdo rje'i grogs po khyod ni  di ring 'jigs pa 'phrog par byed pa'o /
translated: If one crosses the fingers, one‚Äôs vajra friend today will take away one‚Äôs fear.

original: 190 / skra ni rang gi so yis gcod na mi yi phyugs khyod 'dir ni ltung bar bya ba rjod par byed //
analyzed: 190 / skra ni rang gi so yis gcod na mi yi phyugs khyod 'dir ni ltung bar bya ba rjod par byed //
translated: If one cuts one‚Äôs hair with one‚Äôs teeth, one should declare one‚Äôs fall here, O man-animal.

original: so ni phan tshun 'dar bar byed na khyod kyi sha ni 'di dag bdag gis  di ring bza' bar bya //
analyzed: so ni phan tshun 'dar bar byed na khyod kyi sha ni 'di dag bdag gis  di ring bza' bar bya //
translated: If you gnash your teeth, I will eat your flesh today.

original: lce mchu g-yo bar byed na khyod kyi lus las khrag ni btung bar bya'o nges par rjod par byed //
analyzed: lce mchu g-yo bar byed na khyod kyi lus las khrag ni btung bar bya'o nges par rjod par byed //
translated: If you move your tongue and lips, I will drink your blood from your body.

original: mchu la so ni 'debs par byed na khyod kyi rgyu ma lto bar gnas 'di bdag gis bza' bar bya /
analyzed: mchu la so ni 'debs par byed na khyod kyi rgyu ma lto bar gnas 'di bdag gis bza' bar bya /
translated: If you bite your lips with your teeth, I will eat your intestines in your belly.

original: 191 / sgeg pa'i sbyor ba yis ni sgeg par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bzhad pa'i sbyor bas bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: 191 / sgeg pa'i sbyor ba yis ni sgeg par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bzhad pa'i sbyor bas bzhad pa'o //
translated: By the application of flirtation, there is flirtation. By the application of laughter, there is laughter.

original: gar gyi sbyor ba yis ni gar du 'gyur te rnam pa mang po'i rol mo'i sbyor bas rol mo'o //
analyzed: gar gyi sbyor ba yis ni gar du 'gyur te rnam pa mang po'i rol mo'i sbyor bas rol mo'o //
translated: By the application of dance, there is dance. By the application of various musical instruments, there is music.

original: glu yi sbyor ba yis ni @56a * //
analyzed: glu yi sbyor ba yis ni @56a * //
translated: By the application of singing, there is singing.

original: glu ste mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dri yi sbyor ba dag gis dri //
analyzed: glu ste mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dri yi sbyor ba dag gis dri //
translated: By the application of various supreme qualities, there is fragrance.

original: phreng ba'i sbyor ba yis ni phreng bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis spos kyi sbyor bdag gis spos /
analyzed: phreng ba'i sbyor ba yis ni phreng bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis spos kyi sbyor bdag gis spos /
translated: By the application of garlands, there are garlands. By the application of incense, there is incense.

original: 192 / mar me'i rnam pas mar me nges par mun pa bcom pa dang ni snod kyi phyag rgya bdud rtsir 'gyur //
analyzed: 192 / mar me'i rnam pas mar me nges par mun pa bcom pa dang ni snod kyi phyag rgya bdud rtsir 'gyur //
translated: The lamp-form, the lamp, the destruction of darkness, and the vessel-mudra become nectar.

original: zhes pa de ltar phyag rgya thams cad slar yang de nas lnga yi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar phyag rgya thams cad slar yang de nas lnga yi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
translated: Thus all the mudras are again divided by the division into five.

original: gzhan pa phyag rgya mtha' yas rnams kyang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
analyzed: gzhan pa phyag rgya mtha' yas rnams kyang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
translated: The yogi should know that all the infinite mudras are located in the body.

original: gang gang dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur sa yi steng du de yi rang bzhin dag kyang phyag rgya rnams /
analyzed: gang gang dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur sa yi steng du de yi rang bzhin dag kyang phyag rgya rnams /
translated: Whatever is the nature of things on the surface of the earth, those natures are the mudras.

original: 193 / pho nya mo ni 'phred la lta bas khyod ni gang zhig nas 'ongs skal pa bzang la rjod par byed //
analyzed: 193 / pho nya mo ni 'phred la lta bas khyod ni gang zhig nas 'ongs skal pa bzang la rjod par byed //
translated: The messenger looks sideways and says to the fortunate one, ‚ÄúFrom where have you come?‚Äù

original: mgo bor lag bzhag de yi phyogs su nges par bltas pa rnal 'byor pa yis lan ni smras par 'gyur //
analyzed: mgo bor lag bzhag de yi phyogs su nges par bltas pa rnal 'byor pa yis lan ni smras par 'gyur //
translated: Placing her hand on her head, she looks in that direction, and the yogi replies.

original: steng du lta bas khyod ni dge 'am sa yi steng du gnas pas khyod ni 'dug la ngal so cig / yon por lta bas khyod song chags pa'i lta bas pho nya mo ni shin tu dga' ba rjod par byed /
analyzed: steng du lta bas khyod ni dge 'am sa yi steng du gnas pas khyod ni 'dug la ngal so cig / yon por lta bas khyod song chags pa'i lta bas pho nya mo ni shin tu dga' ba rjod par byed /
translated: If you look askance, you are gone, and if you look with passion, you are the messenger, and so very much pleased.

original: 194 / zhi ba'i lta bas bdag gi grogs po khro gnyer khro bo'i lta bas 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: 194 / zhi ba'i lta bas bdag gi grogs po khro gnyer khro bo'i lta bas 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: If you look with a peaceful expression, you are my friend, and if you look with a frown, you are angry, and so very clear.

original: skra la lta bas bdag ni ma rungs par brjod skal  bzangs la ni rang gi rang bzhin zur gyis so //
analyzed: skra la lta bas bdag ni ma rungs par brjod skal  bzangs la ni rang gi rang bzhin zur gyis so //
translated: If you look at your hair, you are wicked, and if you look at your forehead, you are fortunate, and so naturally.

original: mdzod spur lta bas bdag mchog rnal 'byor ma ni sna la lta bas yon tan rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: mdzod spur lta bas bdag mchog rnal 'byor ma ni sna la lta bas yon tan rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: If you look at your eyebrows, you are supreme, and if you look at your nose, you are a yoginƒ´, and so very clear.

original: mchu la lta bas skal pa bzang ste nu ma zung la lta na bdag ni phyag rgya bzang mor brjod /
analyzed: mchu la lta bas skal pa bzang ste nu ma zung la lta na bdag ni phyag rgya bzang mor brjod /
translated: If you look at your lips, you are fortunate, and if you look at your breasts, you are a good seal, and so I am a good seal.

original: 195 / snying gar lta bas bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid lag pa zung la lta na bdag ni rab tu gtum mor brjod //
analyzed: 195 / snying gar lta bas bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid lag pa zung la lta na bdag ni rab tu gtum mor brjod //
translated: If you look at your heart, you are meditative, and if you look at your hands, you are fierce, and so I am very fierce.

original: phrag par lta bas bdag ni nus ma sen mo dang bcas lag pa'i mthil la lta na srin mo'o //
analyzed: phrag par lta bas bdag ni nus ma sen mo dang bcas lag pa'i mthil la lta na srin mo'o //
translated: Looking at the shoulders, I am the goddess of power, and looking at the palm of the hand, I am the demoness.

original: rgyab tu lta na lag 'gro ma ste lte bar lta bas mi yi dbang po bdag ni dam tshig can //
analyzed: rgyab tu lta na lag 'gro ma ste lte bar lta bas mi yi dbang po bdag ni dam tshig can //
translated: Looking at the back, I am the goddess of the serpent race, and looking at the navel, I am the lord of men, and I am the one who is faithful.

original: gsang bar lta bas bdag ni dag pa brla la lta bas bdag ni shin tu dga' la gdul bar dka'/
analyzed: gsang bar lta bas bdag ni dag pa brla la lta bas bdag ni shin tu dga' la gdul bar dka'/
translated: Looking at the secret part, I am the pure one, and looking at the thigh, I am the one who is very pleased and difficult to tame.

original: 196 / pus mor lta bas bdag ni grub pa nges par rjod byed rkang par lta bas rdzu 'phrul sbyin pa mo //
analyzed: 196 / pus mor lta bas bdag ni grub pa nges par rjod byed rkang par lta bas rdzu 'phrul sbyin pa mo //
translated: Looking at the knee, I am the one who is accomplished and speaks with certainty, and looking at the foot, I am the one who bestows magical powers.üîΩLooking at the toe of the foot, I am the one who is in the vajra body of existence, and I am the solitary heroine.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bo nges par lta na bdag ni srid par rdo rje'i sku ste dpa' mo gcig pu dang // sor mo @56b kun gyi rtse mor lta bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su kun tu 'gro ma sna tshogs yum //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bo nges par lta na bdag ni srid par rdo rje'i sku ste dpa' mo gcig pu dang // sor mo @56b kun gyi rtse mor lta bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su kun tu 'gro ma sna tshogs yum //
translated: Looking at the tip of all the fingers, I am the one who goes everywhere in the three worlds, and I am the variegated mother.

original: pho nya mo rnams lta stangs nyid ni sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya /
analyzed: pho nya mo rnams lta stangs nyid ni sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya /
translated: The yogin should know that the messengers‚Äô way of looking is the place on the surface of the earth.

original: 197 / drug cha lus kyi nang nas lag pa rkang pa lus dag gi ni yan lag mchog kyang sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: 197 / drug cha lus kyi nang nas lag pa rkang pa lus dag gi ni yan lag mchog kyang sbyin pa ste /
translated: The hand and foot are the best of the limbs of the body, and the gift of them is the best of gifts.

original: las kyi dbang po rnams kyi ngag dang dbang po rnams kyi nang na yon tan dang bcas yid dag kyang //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po rnams kyi ngag dang dbang po rnams kyi nang na yon tan dang bcas yid dag kyang //
translated: The speech is the best of the organs of action, and the mind is the best of the organs of sense.

original: khams kyi cha shas khams kyi nang na rkang gnyis pa dang phyugs kyi tshogs kyi de nyid cha yis gzhan //
analyzed: khams kyi cha shas khams kyi nang na rkang gnyis pa dang phyugs kyi tshogs kyi de nyid cha yis gzhan //
translated: The two feet are the best of the parts of the body, and the two eyes are the best of the parts of the head.

original: mchog gi phyag rgya rjes su rig pa slob dpon la ni rab tu phul na bde ba'i gnas su 'gro /
analyzed: mchog gi phyag rgya rjes su rig pa slob dpon la ni rab tu phul na bde ba'i gnas su 'gro /
translated: The best of all gifts is the gift of the consort, who is the seal of the supreme knowledge.

original: 198 / sems can gang dag rnam gsum srid par gnas rnams 'jig rten khams las ye shes rdo rje lcags kyu yis //
analyzed: 198 / sems can gang dag rnam gsum srid par gnas rnams 'jig rten khams las ye shes rdo rje lcags kyu yis //
translated: The beings who dwell in the three worlds are summoned from the world systems by the hook of the vajra of knowledge.

original: bkug ste de dag mtha' dag mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni sangs rgyas rnams dang rdo rje yi //
analyzed: bkug ste de dag mtha' dag mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni sangs rgyas rnams dang rdo rje yi //
translated: Having been summoned, they are consecrated with the supreme compassion of the Buddhas and the vajra nectar in the mandala.

original: bdud rtsi mngon par dbang bskur nas ni dri med ri bong can lus rdo rje can gyi lam thob pa //
analyzed: bdud rtsi mngon par dbang bskur nas ni dri med ri bong can lus rdo rje can gyi lam thob pa //
translated: Then, having attained the path of the vajra body, which is the stainless moon,

original: dri ma rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas rnams rang gi gnas su gtang bar bya /
analyzed: dri ma rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas rnams rang gi gnas su gtang bar bya /
translated: Those who are free from stains and who abide in the conduct of awakening should be sent to their own places.

original: 199 / rdzas rnams med pa'i mngon par dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis kun spangs la ni sbyin par bya //
analyzed: 199 / rdzas rnams med pa'i mngon par dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis kun spangs la ni sbyin par bya //
translated: The consecration of the absence of substances, the command of the lord of victors, is given to the renunciant.

original: de bzhin du bal sogs lam dang mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rtsa yi rnal 'byor ldan pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du bal sogs lam dang mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rtsa yi rnal 'byor ldan pa ste //
translated: Likewise, wool and so on, the path and all, are the treasure of qualities, the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ yoga.

original: bstan pa'i don du lag pa'i phyag rgya rang gi snying gi dbang son skyon rnams kun las rnam par grol //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don du lag pa'i phyag rgya rang gi snying gi dbang son skyon rnams kun las rnam par grol //
translated: For the sake of the teaching, the mudra of the hand, which reaches the heart, is free from all faults.

original: gzhan rnams la ni rgyal ba mchog gi snying po yum gyi mchod pa rnam dman sbyin pa nyid mi bya ;
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni rgyal ba mchog gi snying po yum gyi mchod pa rnam dman sbyin pa nyid mi bya ;
translated: To others, the supreme victor‚Äôs essence, the worship of the mother, should not be given.

original: 200 / dbang gi mthar ni dpal ldan bum pa rnams kyi 'jam zhing lus la bde ster stod kor gos zung dag / dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la sbyin bya gzhan yang de bzhin stod kor dang ni gos zung dag / sgo na gnas pa rnams
analyzed: 200 / dbang gi mthar ni dpal ldan bum pa rnams kyi 'jam zhing lus la bde ster stod kor gos zung dag / dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la sbyin bya gzhan yang de bzhin stod kor dang ni gos zung dag / sgo na gnas pa rnams
translated: At the end of the empowerment, one should give to the glorious yoginis soft upper garments and lower garments that bring bliss to the body, and likewise to others, upper garments and lower garments.

original: la rab sbyin mtha' dag yon tan rigs la bdag nyid nus pas de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: la rab sbyin mtha' dag yon tan rigs la bdag nyid nus pas de bzhin gzhan //
translated: To those who stand at the door, one should give everything according to one's ability and lineage.

original: mthar ni sbyin sreg byas nas rang gi snying ga'i padmar ye shes sems dpa' rab tu gzhug bya ste /
analyzed: mthar ni sbyin sreg byas nas rang gi snying ga'i padmar ye shes sems dpa' rab tu gzhug bya ste /
translated: At the end, having performed the fire sacrifice, one should induct the gnosis being into one's heart lotus.

original: 201 /'jig rten pa rnams rang gi gnas su mtha' dag rdul tshon dag kyang dag pa'i klung la spyan drang bya //üîΩt'am b'u la dang dri @57a * //
analyzed: 201 /'jig rten pa rnams rang gi gnas su mtha' dag rdul tshon dag kyang dag pa'i klung la spyan drang bya // t'am b'u la dang dri @57a * //
translated: The worldly ones should be dismissed to their own places, and all the colored powders should be carried to a pure river.üîΩOne should give to the young girls campaka flowers, incense,

original: spos me tog 'bras bur bcas dang ras yug dag ni gzhon nu ma rnams la //
analyzed: spos me tog 'bras bur bcas dang ras yug dag ni gzhon nu ma rnams la //
translated: flowers, fruits, and cloth.

original: byin nas slob dpon slob mar bcas pas mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni ji ltar 'dod par mchod byas te //
analyzed: byin nas slob dpon slob mar bcas pas mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni ji ltar 'dod par mchod byas te //
translated: Having made offerings to the entire assembly of the master and disciples as one wishes,

original: slob ma la ni gnang ba rab byin rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: slob ma la ni gnang ba rab byin rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol /
translated: The disciples are given permission, and the supreme assembly of the family is requested to return to their own places.üîΩThe dangers of enemies, lions, elephants, fire, serpents, thieves, and bondage by a noose,üîΩthe disturbance of the waters, the fear of death by a pi≈õƒÅca, the inner and outer dangers of the senses,

original: 202 / dgra dang seng ge glang chen dbang po me dang lto 'phye'i bdag po chom rkun zhags pas 'ching ba dang // chu gter 'khrugs pa dang ni sha za 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed nang dang dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe ba dang // dbul dang bud med bral dang mi bdag 'khrug pa'i 'jigs pa dang ni rdo rje ltung dang don nyams pa //
analyzed: 202 / dgra dang seng ge glang chen dbang po me dang lto 'phye'i bdag po chom rkun zhags pas 'ching ba dang // chu gter 'khrugs pa dang ni sha za 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed nang dang dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe ba dang // dbul dang bud med bral dang mi bdag 'khrug pa'i 'jigs pa dang ni rdo rje ltung dang don nyams pa //
translated: poverty, separation from a woman, the danger of the king, the danger of falling like a vajra, and the loss of wealth,

original: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni nyin zhag so sor dran byed de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni nyin zhag so sor dran byed de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur /
translated: for one who remembers the feet of the yoginƒ´s every day, there is no danger.

original: 203 / dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba'i dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: 203 / dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba'i dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the consecration, the third in the glorious Ca·πá·∏ça¬≠mahƒÅ¬≠ro·π£a·πáa tantra.

original: // / rgyal ba skyed mdzad bdag gis dbang bskur bdun po rnams dang bum pa dang ni gsang ba'i dbang dag dang // shes rab ye shes dbang bskur srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya bzhi pa thob //
analyzed: // / rgyal ba skyed mdzad bdag gis dbang bskur bdun po rnams dang bum pa dang ni gsang ba'i dbang dag dang // shes rab ye shes dbang bskur srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya bzhi pa thob //
translated: and the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, which conquers the fears of existence, and the fourth, which is to be attained by the yogis.

original: slar yang rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sna tshogs gtso bo'i sgrub thabs yang dag par ni bdag zhu'o //
analyzed: slar yang rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sna tshogs gtso bo'i sgrub thabs yang dag par ni bdag zhu'o //
translated: Again, I request the perfect method of accomplishing the supreme Victorious Ones and the various lords.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos rdo rje can dag gi yang sgrub thabs gsungs /
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos rdo rje can dag gi yang sgrub thabs gsungs /
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the lord of the Victorious Ones taught the method of accomplishing the vajra holders.

original: 1 / zla ba'i sku dang zung gi zhabs te me yi mgrin pa chu gter dpal ldan zhal ni sna tshogs mdog / phrag pa drug dang nyi ma'i dpung pa rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma stong pa drug dang me yi tshigs //
analyzed: 1 / zla ba'i sku dang zung gi zhabs te me yi mgrin pa chu gter dpal ldan zhal ni sna tshogs mdog / phrag pa drug dang nyi ma'i dpung pa rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma stong pa drug dang me yi tshigs //
translated: The moon body, the feet of the pair, the throat of fire, the ocean, the glorious face of various colors, the six shoulders, the sun arms, the thousand lotus hands of the Victorious One, the six fire joints,

original: zhabs dag gis ni zla ba nyi ma bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor dag la bdud dang drag po skrag bzhin pa //
analyzed: zhabs dag gis ni zla ba nyi ma bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor dag la bdud dang drag po skrag bzhin pa //
translated: With his feet he frightens Mara and Rudra on the circles of the moon, sun, and fire.

original: rol pas mnan pa'i srid med srid pa mnyam pa dus kyi 'khor lo gcig pu de ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: rol pas mnan pa'i srid med srid pa mnyam pa dus kyi 'khor lo gcig pu de ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: That one, the Wheel of Time, is to be accomplished, the one who is not in existence, who is the same as existence, who is the sole one, who is the one to be worshipped.

original: 2 / skyed mos tshal lam ri bo dang ni rgyal ba mchog gi gnas dang lha yi gnas ni stong pa dang // grub pa'i gnas dang dur khrod dang ni mtsho dang bzang po'i gnas dang de bzhin nyid du sbas pa'i sa //
analyzed: 2 / skyed mos tshal lam ri bo dang ni rgyal ba mchog gi gnas dang lha yi gnas ni stong pa dang // grub pa'i gnas dang dur khrod dang ni mtsho dang bzang po'i gnas dang de bzhin nyid du sbas pa'i sa //
translated: In a garden, on a mountain, in the abode of the supreme Victor, in an empty abode of the gods, in a place of accomplishment, in a charnel ground, on a lake, in a good abode, and in a hidden place,

original: gang du sems ni rab tu tshim par 'gyur ba der ni bsgrub par @57b bya'o mi yi bdag po kye //
analyzed: gang du sems ni rab tu tshim par 'gyur ba der ni bsgrub par @57b bya'o mi yi bdag po kye //
translated: in whatever place the mind is satisfied, there, O lord of men, one should accomplish.

original: nges par 'jam pa'i mal stan dag dang gdan la nye bar 'dug nas sngar brjod bsrung ba byas nas ni /
analyzed: nges par 'jam pa'i mal stan dag dang gdan la nye bar 'dug nas sngar brjod bsrung ba byas nas ni /
translated: Having sat down on a soft bed and seat, having performed the protection as previously stated,

original: 3 / dang por snying gar zla ba'i dbus su de nyid 'od zer sna tshogs rnams ni phyogs bcur bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 3 / dang por snying gar zla ba'i dbus su de nyid 'od zer sna tshogs rnams ni phyogs bcur bsgom par bya //
translated: first, in the center of the moon at the heart, one should meditate on the light rays in the ten directions.

original: kha la sogs pa dag pa byas nas slar yang nam mkha' dag la spros pa'i rgyal ba rnams la ni //
analyzed: kha la sogs pa dag pa byas nas slar yang nam mkha' dag la spros pa'i rgyal ba rnams la ni //
translated: Having purified the mouth and so forth, again in the sky one should make various offerings to the Victorious Ones who have been emanated.

original: mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas sdig pa rnam pa mang po bsags pa dag ni bshags byas te //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas sdig pa rnam pa mang po bsags pa dag ni bshags byas te //
translated: Having made various offerings, one should confess the many sins that have been accumulated.

original: sgrub pa po yis lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dag pa yis ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya /
analyzed: sgrub pa po yis lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dag pa yis ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya /
translated: The practitioner, with a pure body, speech, and mind, should go for refuge to the Three.

original: 4 / rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rnam mang dge ba gang byas pa //
analyzed: 4 / rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rnam mang dge ba gang byas pa //
translated: Whatever virtues have been made by the perfect Buddhas, the Bodhisattvas, and the hosts of Aryas,

original: de dag mtha' dag la ni sdig pa rnam grol byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pas rjes yi rang //
analyzed: de dag mtha' dag la ni sdig pa rnam grol byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pas rjes yi rang //
translated: all of them, being liberated from sin, I rejoice in them, abiding in the practice of enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog la yang byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog la yang byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, the protectors from the dangers of existence, until I attain enlightenment.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas su bdag gyur cig ces 'dir ni smon lam sems can don gyi slad du bdag bgyid do /
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas su bdag gyur cig ces 'dir ni smon lam sems can don gyi slad du bdag bgyid do /
translated: I make this aspiration prayer here, ‚ÄúMay I become a perfect Buddha,‚Äù for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 5 / stong pa dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin 'gro ba mtha' dag 'di ni dngos po dag gis rnam par dman //
analyzed: 5 / stong pa dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin 'gro ba mtha' dag 'di ni dngos po dag gis rnam par dman //
translated: 5. Emptiness is the nature of the essence of things, and all beings are not inferior to the Buddhas in this.

original: de las sangs rgyas byang chub med cing gzhan phan snying rje dag dang mtshan ma'i dam bca' med pa ste //
analyzed: de las sangs rgyas byang chub med cing gzhan phan snying rje dag dang mtshan ma'i dam bca' med pa ste //
translated: There is no Buddhahood apart from this, nor any vow of compassion and of signs.

original: mtha' dag de ltar shes nas de lta na yang mi yi bdag po sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
analyzed: mtha' dag de ltar shes nas de lta na yang mi yi bdag po sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
translated: 6. Knowing this, the Lord of men should meditate on the Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind,

original: dpag med yon tan dkyil 'khor dbang po dkyil 'khor la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: dpag med yon tan dkyil 'khor dbang po dkyil 'khor la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya /
translated: which is the mandala of the infinite good qualities, the mandala of the senses.

original: 6 / chu yis me ni rnam par nyams pa dang por 'dir ni lus kyi dbus su sdom brtson dag gis bya //üîΩphyi nas 'dzin ma dag ni chu ru 'gyur te lan tshva bzhin du chu yi dbus su rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: 6 / chu yis me ni rnam par nyams pa dang por 'dir ni lus kyi dbus su sdom brtson dag gis bya // phyi nas 'dzin ma dag ni chu ru 'gyur te lan tshva bzhin du chu yi dbus su rab tu zhugs //
translated: 7. The ascetic should first dry up the fire by the water in the middle of the body.üîΩThen the water becomes the earth, and dissolves into the water like salt.

original: rlung ni chu bo de dag bskams nas nam mkha' la ni snang ba min par myur du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rlung ni chu bo de dag bskams nas nam mkha' la ni snang ba min par myur du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: 8. The wind dries up the water and the river, and quickly goes into space, invisible.

original: sems ni me dang mun pa'i mtha' ma yul dang rnam par bral ba dbus kyis la gzhag par bya /
analyzed: sems ni me dang mun pa'i mtha' ma yul dang rnam par bral ba dbus kyis la gzhag par bya /
translated: The mind is to be placed in the center, free from objects, like the end of fire and darkness.

original: 7 / stong pa rlung me chu dang sa dang lha yi ri bo chu skyes zla ba nyi ma me rnams ni //
analyzed: 7 / stong pa rlung me chu dang sa dang lha yi ri bo chu skyes zla ba nyi ma me rnams ni //
translated: The void is the wind, fire, water, earth, and the mountain of gods, the lotus, moon, sun, and fire.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa kun nas dri med 'od zer 'phro ba 'am ni rdo rje las skyes gur dag go //üîΩde yi dbus su rdo rje'i sa la nor bu'i 'od @58a * //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa kun nas dri med 'od zer 'phro ba 'am ni rdo rje las skyes gur dag go // de yi dbus su rdo rje'i sa la nor bu'i 'od @58a * //
translated: The palace is completely pure, radiating stainless light rays, or born from the vajra, a tent.

original: zer tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'phro ba ste //
analyzed: zer tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'phro ba ste //
translated: In its center, on the vajra ground, is the ma·πá·∏çala of the assembly of the light rays of the jewel,üîΩradiating.

original: aom yig ye shes las skyes rgyal ba mchog gi padma zla ba dang ni nyi ma dag gi gdan /
analyzed: aom yig ye shes las skyes rgyal ba mchog gi padma zla ba dang ni nyi ma dag gi gdan /
translated: The seat of the supreme victor born from the syllable o·πÉ is a lotus, moon, and sun.

original: 8 / phyi rol du ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor nor bu padma 'di ni zla ba nyi mas rnam par dman //
analyzed: 8 / phyi rol du ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor nor bu padma 'di ni zla ba nyi mas rnam par dman //
translated: Outside is the ma·πá·∏çala of speech, the jewel and lotus, surpassed by the moon and sun.

original: phyi rol phyogs dang zur gyi char ni nyin mor byed pa'i padma sgo yi dbus su shing rta rnams //
analyzed: phyi rol phyogs dang zur gyi char ni nyin mor byed pa'i padma sgo yi dbus su shing rta rnams //
translated: Outside, in the directions and corners, are the chariots in the center of the gates, the lotuses of the sun.

original: nyi ma'i sgo rnams su ni rgyal po nor bu gser gyi rang bzhin rta babs rnams dang dur khrod dang // snying por brgyad gnyis ka ba rdo rje'i rang bzhin shin tu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo rgyal ba yi /
analyzed: nyi ma'i sgo rnams su ni rgyal po nor bu gser gyi rang bzhin rta babs rnams dang dur khrod dang // snying por brgyad gnyis ka ba rdo rje'i rang bzhin shin tu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo rgyal ba yi /
translated: in the center, the eight and two, all of vajra nature, the wheel of perfect enjoyment, of the Victor.

original: 9 / zla ba nyi ma la yang aa sogs ka sogs rdo rje dang bcas me long la sogs lnga rnams kyis //
analyzed: 9 / zla ba nyi ma la yang aa sogs ka sogs rdo rje dang bcas me long la sogs lnga rnams kyis //
translated: On the moon and sun are the vowels and consonants with the vajras, the five beginning with the mirror.

original: 'od zer lnga rnams 'gyed par byed cing dri ma med pa'i zer 'phro dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga rnams 'gyed par byed cing dri ma med pa'i zer 'phro dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: Meditate on KƒÅlacakra, radiating five-colored light rays, with stainless rays.

original: rdo rje'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i lus dang rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma nyi ma'i dpung pa dus kyi zhal //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i lus dang rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma nyi ma'i dpung pa dus kyi zhal //
translated: With a body adorned with vajras, the lotus and sun hands of the Victor, the arm of KƒÅla, the face of Candra,

original: mgrin pa gsum dang nyi ma'i spyan te rnam par rgyas pa'i zhal yang mche ba phyed ni gtsigs pa'o /
analyzed: mgrin pa gsum dang nyi ma'i spyan te rnam par rgyas pa'i zhal yang mche ba phyed ni gtsigs pa'o /
translated: three necks, sun eyes, and a fully expanded face, with half-fangs bared.

original: 10 / dpal ldan aom yig las skyes rgyal ba'i bdag po'i padmar zla ba nyi ma me yi steng du ni //
analyzed: 10 / dpal ldan aom yig las skyes rgyal ba'i bdag po'i padmar zla ba nyi ma me yi steng du ni //
translated: In the lotus of the Lord of Victors, arisen from the glorious letter O·πÉ, on the moon, sun, and fire,

original: drag po lus med gnyis kyi snying gar rgyal ba'i dbang po shin tu rol pa'i zhabs ni g-yas brkyang stabs //
analyzed: drag po lus med gnyis kyi snying gar rgyal ba'i dbang po shin tu rol pa'i zhabs ni g-yas brkyang stabs //
translated: At the heart of the two fierce ones, the bodiless, is the foot of the lord of victors, who is in a dancing posture, with the right leg extended.

original: g-yas pa dmar po'i mchog gi zhabs kyi 'og tu bdud de dkar po g-yon par yang ni drag po'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dmar po'i mchog gi zhabs kyi 'og tu bdud de dkar po g-yon par yang ni drag po'o //
translated: Under the supreme right red foot is the white demon, and under the left is the fierce one.

original: dbus dang g-yas dang g-yas min mgrin pa dag kyang bung ba nyi ma dang mtshungs zla ba dag gi mdog 11 / phrag pa sngon po dang ni dmar dang ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar g-yas pa dang ni g-yon du yang //
analyzed: dbus dang g-yas dang g-yas min mgrin pa dag kyang bung ba nyi ma dang mtshungs zla ba dag gi mdog 11 / phrag pa sngon po dang ni dmar dang ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar g-yas pa dang ni g-yon du yang //
translated: The middle, right, and left necks are the color of a bee, the sun, and the moon, respectively. The right and left shoulders are blue, red, and white like the moon.

original: g-yas dang g-yas min dpung pa gnyis gnyis dag ni gnag dang nyi ma'i lus dang zla ba'i mdog rnams te //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yas min dpung pa gnyis gnyis dag ni gnag dang nyi ma'i lus dang zla ba'i mdog rnams te //
translated: The two right and left arms are black, the color of the sun's body, and the color of the moon, respectively.

original: de bzhin nges par mtshon cha dag dang bcas pa'i phyag rnams dag kyang brgyad gsum gyis ni rim pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin nges par mtshon cha dag dang bcas pa'i phyag rnams dag kyang brgyad gsum gyis ni rim pas so //
translated: Likewise, the eight hands, which definitely hold weapons, are in three stages.

original: phyag gi padma ri bong can la tshigs gsum sor mo lnga po rnams ni kha dog lnga rnams 'phro /
analyzed: phyag gi padma ri bong can la tshigs gsum sor mo lnga po rnams ni kha dog lnga rnams 'phro /
translated: The lotus of the hand, which is the moon, has three joints and five fingers, which are the five colors.

original: 12 / gnag dang dmar dang dkar ba'i rab mchog phyag gi mthil du mtshon cha'i tshogs ni yang dag gnas pa yang /
analyzed: 12 / gnag dang dmar dang dkar ba'i rab mchog phyag gi mthil du mtshon cha'i tshogs ni yang dag gnas pa yang /
translated: The supreme black, red, and white [faces] are marked with weapons in the palms of the hands.

original: rdo rje ral gri dag dang rtse gsum pa dang srid pa 'jigs byed gri gug dang ni me yi mda' //
analyzed: rdo rje ral gri dag dang rtse gsum pa dang srid pa 'jigs byed gri gug dang ni me yi mda' //
translated: The vajra, sword, trident, and the skull of Bhairava of existence, and the fire arrow,

original: de nas rdo rje lcags kyu @58b nges par sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru dang tho ba 'khor lo nyid //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje lcags kyu @58b nges par sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru dang tho ba 'khor lo nyid //
translated: Then the vajra hook, the definitely sounding damaru, the hammer, and the wheel,

original: mdung dang dbyug pa dgra sta rnams ni rdo rje can gyi nyi ma'i phyag gi padma g-yas la'o /
analyzed: mdung dang dbyug pa dgra sta rnams ni rdo rje can gyi nyi ma'i phyag gi padma g-yas la'o /
translated: The spear, club, and battle-ax‚Äîthese are in the right lotus hands of the sun-like Vajra.üîΩThe bell, flag, kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga, the skull filled with blood and flesh, the bow, noose, jewel, lotus, and the mirror, and the chain,

original: 13 / dril bu phub dang kha tv'am ga ni rnam par rgyas pa'i kha dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa dang // gzhu dang zhags pa rin chen padma chun rgyu ba dag dang me long dang ni lcags sgrog dang // tshangs pa'i mgo bo padmas brgyan pa rig byed gdong ldan gang yin rgyal ba'i g-yon gyi phyag na'o //
analyzed: 13 / dril bu phub dang kha tv'am ga ni rnam par rgyas pa'i kha dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa dang // gzhu dang zhags pa rin chen padma chun rgyu ba dag dang me long dang ni lcags sgrog dang // tshangs pa'i mgo bo padmas brgyan pa rig byed gdong ldan gang yin rgyal ba'i g-yon gyi phyag na'o //
translated: The head of BrahmƒÅ adorned with a lotus, and the Veda-faced [face]‚Äîthese are in the left hands of the Victor.

original: bdud dang drag po'i lha mo dag ni zhabs kyi mthil la 'dzin cing gdong ni dman pa dag tu byed /
analyzed: bdud dang drag po'i lha mo dag ni zhabs kyi mthil la 'dzin cing gdong ni dman pa dag tu byed /
translated: The demons and the fierce goddess hold his feet, and their faces are turned downward.

original: 14 / gser mdog rig byed zhal ldan nor gyi phyag gi padmas 'khyud pa dag ni sna tshogs yum yin te //
analyzed: 14 / gser mdog rig byed zhal ldan nor gyi phyag gi padmas 'khyud pa dag ni sna tshogs yum yin te //
translated: Golden-colored, with the Vedas in his face, embraced by the lotus hand of Lakshmi, he is Visvamata.

original: g-yas na gri gug lcags kyu nges par sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru dang bgrang phreng rim pas so //
analyzed: g-yas na gri gug lcags kyu nges par sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru dang bgrang phreng rim pas so //
translated: On his right are the flaying knife, the goad, the damaru with sound, and the rosary, in order.

original: g-yon na thod pa zhags pa dang ni 'dab ma brgya pa'i padma mchog gi rin chen de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: g-yon na thod pa zhags pa dang ni 'dab ma brgya pa'i padma mchog gi rin chen de bzhin nyid //
translated: On his left are the skull cup, the noose, and the lotus with a hundred petals, the supreme jewel, just as it is.

original: g-yon brkyang nyi ma'i spyan dang rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan phyag rgya rnams kyis rgya yis btab pa'o /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang nyi ma'i spyan dang rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan phyag rgya rnams kyis rgya yis btab pa'o /
translated: With his left leg extended, with the sun for an eye, and with the crown of the lord of the victors, he is sealed with the mudras.

original: 15 /'dab brgyad la ni lha mo brgyad rnams nor gyi phyag gi padma rig byed zhal dang nyi ma'i spyan //
analyzed: 15 /'dab brgyad la ni lha mo brgyad rnams nor gyi phyag gi padma rig byed zhal dang nyi ma'i spyan //
translated: On the eight petals are the eight goddesses, with the lotus hand of Lakshmi, with the Vedas in their faces, and with the sun for an eye.

original: de dag rnams las bzhi ni sprul gyi rnga yab 'dzin te zur du rgyal ba'i zhal gyi dbye bas so ;
analyzed: de dag rnams las bzhi ni sprul gyi rnga yab 'dzin te zur du rgyal ba'i zhal gyi dbye bas so ;
translated: Four of them hold serpent whisks, distinguished by the face of the victor in the corner.

original: / dbang ldan bden bral dang ni rtse mo can dang rlung gi zur du chos kyi dung dang ga nd'i dang // de bzhin yid bzhin nor bur 'gyur te nges par de bzhin du ni dpag bsam shing du rim pas 'gyur /
analyzed: / dbang ldan bden bral dang ni rtse mo can dang rlung gi zur du chos kyi dung dang ga nd'i dang // de bzhin yid bzhin nor bur 'gyur te nges par de bzhin du ni dpag bsam shing du rim pas 'gyur /
translated: In the northeast, the Dharma conch, the sugarcane, and likewise the wish-fulfilling gem; in the same way, in order, the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: 16 / nag mo yis ni dang po'i phyag gi mthil na spos kyi snod dang gnyis pa dag na bsil ba'i snod //
analyzed: 16 / nag mo yis ni dang po'i phyag gi mthil na spos kyi snod dang gnyis pa dag na bsil ba'i snod //
translated: In the first hand of the black one is a perfume vessel; in the second, a cooling vessel;

original: dmar po sbyar ba gsum pa na ste myos byed dang bcas ri bong 'dzin pa g-yas kyi phyag bzhi na //
analyzed: dmar po sbyar ba gsum pa na ste myos byed dang bcas ri bong 'dzin pa g-yas kyi phyag bzhi na //
translated: in the third, a red mixture; in the fourth right hand, the moon with wine;

original: g-yon na dril bu padma lha yi shing gi me tog dang ni me tog phreng ba rim pas so //
analyzed: g-yon na dril bu padma lha yi shing gi me tog dang ni me tog phreng ba rim pas so //
translated: in the left, a bell, a lotus, a divine tree flower, and a garland, in order.

original: dmar mo'i g-yas na mar me do shal dag dang cod pan dang bcas gdu bu rnams te phyag g-yon na /
analyzed: dmar mo'i g-yas na mar me do shal dag dang cod pan dang bcas gdu bu rnams te phyag g-yon na /
translated: In the right of the red one, a lamp, a necklace, a crown, and bracelets; in the left,

original: 17 / gos dang ska rags dang ni dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba'i rna rgyan dang ni rkang gdub bo //
analyzed: 17 / gos dang ska rags dang ni dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba'i rna rgyan dang ni rkang gdub bo //
translated: a garment, a belt, and earrings radiating stainless light, and anklets.

original: ser mo'i g-yas kyi phyag na dung dang gling bu nor bu dang bcas da ma ru ni rim pas te //
analyzed: ser mo'i g-yas kyi phyag na dung dang gling bu nor bu dang bcas da ma ru ni rim pas te //
translated: In the right hands of the yellow goddesses are a conch, a flute, a jewel, and a damaru drum, respectively.

original: g-yon na rgyud mangs dang ni rnga dang sil sil rab tu @59a * //üîΩsgrogs pa'i 'khar ba dag dang zangs dung ngo //
analyzed: g-yon na rgyud mangs dang ni rnga dang sil sil rab tu @59a * // sgrogs pa'i 'khar ba dag dang zangs dung ngo //
translated: In the left hands are a lute, a drum, a small drum, and a bell.

original: 'o ma chu dang sman dang chang dang bdud rtsi ro dang 'bras bu zan gyi snod ni dkar mo yi /
analyzed: 'o ma chu dang sman dang chang dang bdud rtsi ro dang 'bras bu zan gyi snod ni dkar mo yi /
translated: In the right hands of the white goddesses are a vessel of milk, a vessel of water, a vessel of medicine, a vessel of beer, a vessel of nectar, a vessel of fruit, a vessel of cooked rice, and a vessel of curd.üîΩIn the lotus petals of the directions are the four Buddhas, definitely having nine faces, fire-colored, and with four hands,

original: 18 / phyogs kyi padmar chu gter sangs rgyas rnams ni nges par spyan dgu me yi zhal dang dus kyi phyag / zur du sgrol ma la sogs lha mo rnams dang slar yang de dag mtshams brgyad du ni bum pa brgyad //
analyzed: 18 / phyogs kyi padmar chu gter sangs rgyas rnams ni nges par spyan dgu me yi zhal dang dus kyi phyag / zur du sgrol ma la sogs lha mo rnams dang slar yang de dag mtshams brgyad du ni bum pa brgyad //
translated: and in the intermediate directions are the eight goddesses beginning with Tara, and again the eight vases.

original: lha dang lha mo gnag dang dmar dang ser ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa lta bur dkar ba ste //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo gnag dang dmar dang ser ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa lta bur dkar ba ste //
translated: The gods and goddesses are black, red, yellow, and white like the moon.

original: nag po dkar po zla ba'i steng du yang na phyogs bral du gnas dmar po ser po nyi ma'i ste /
analyzed: nag po dkar po zla ba'i steng du yang na phyogs bral du gnas dmar po ser po nyi ma'i ste /
translated: The black and white ones are on the moon, and the red and yellow ones are on the sun.

original: 19 / mkha' snying la sogs rtsig pa la ni phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas reg bya rdo rje ma la sogs //
analyzed: 19 / mkha' snying la sogs rtsig pa la ni phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas reg bya rdo rje ma la sogs //
translated: Akashagarbha and so on are on the wall, in the cardinal and intermediate directions, Sparshavajra and so on.

original: shar dang phyogs gzhan gyi ni g-yas dang g-yas min padma dag la kun tu bzang po de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: shar dang phyogs gzhan gyi ni g-yas dang g-yas min padma dag la kun tu bzang po de bzhin nyid //
translated: Samantabhadra and Tathagata are on the lotuses to the right and left of the east and other directions.

original: dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje nges par sgra yi rdo rje ma dang chos kyi dbyings ni rim pas so //
analyzed: dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje nges par sgra yi rdo rje ma dang chos kyi dbyings ni rim pas so //
translated: Sambara and Vajrapani are on the lotuses of the southeast and northeast, Shabdavajra and Dharmadhatva, in order.

original: rmugs byed rengs byed khengs byed dag ste shin tu stobs shes gang yin sgo skyong de ni shar du'o /
analyzed: rmugs byed rengs byed khengs byed dag ste shin tu stobs shes gang yin sgo skyong de ni shar du'o /
translated: Stambhana, mohana, and unmattabhairava, and the one who is known as Mahabala, are the gate guardians in the east.

original: 20 / shes rab phang bar thabs ni ri bong 'dzin pa'i padma la ste lha rnams kyi yang lha mo'o //
analyzed: 20 / shes rab phang bar thabs ni ri bong 'dzin pa'i padma la ste lha rnams kyi yang lha mo'o //
translated: Upana is on the lotus of the rabbit-holder, embraced by Prajna, the goddess of the gods.

original: gnyis po dag ni rang gi phyag gi chu skyes rang rang mtshan mas mtshan pa dag gis phan tshun 'khyud //
analyzed: gnyis po dag ni rang gi phyag gi chu skyes rang rang mtshan mas mtshan pa dag gis phan tshun 'khyud //
translated: The two are embraced by each other with their own lotuses marked with their own signs.

original: mtshan ma gang zhig gang gi g-yas kyi dang po'i phyag mthil na ste de yi phyag rgya chu skyes dman //
analyzed: mtshan ma gang zhig gang gi g-yas kyi dang po'i phyag mthil na ste de yi phyag rgya chu skyes dman //
translated: The sign of which is on the palm of the first right hand, that is the inferior lotus of that hand.

original: shes rab thabs kyis 'khor lo mchog gi bde bar gnas pa padma dang ni rdo rje'i gdan gyis bzhugs /
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyis 'khor lo mchog gi bde bar gnas pa padma dang ni rdo rje'i gdan gyis bzhugs /
translated: The one who abides in the bliss of the supreme wheel through wisdom and means sits on a seat of lotus and vajra.

original: 21 / nag po rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag na ral gri gri gug dag dang srid pa 'jigs byed rtse gsum ste //üîΩg-yon pa'i phyag gi mthil du phub dang thod pa dag dang kha tv'am ga ni dkar po nyid du 'gyur //üîΩmda' dang rdo rje lcags kyu sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru ni g-yas kyi phyag na rim pa yis //
analyzed: 21 / nag po rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag na ral gri gri gug dag dang srid pa 'jigs byed rtse gsum ste // g-yon pa'i phyag gi mthil du phub dang thod pa dag dang kha tv'am ga ni dkar po nyid du 'gyur // mda' dang rdo rje lcags kyu sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru ni g-yas kyi phyag na rim pa yis //
translated: The right hands of the black ones hold a sword, flaying knife, and trident of Bhairava;üîΩin the left hands are a skull and a khatvanga staff. The white ones hold a bow, lasso, and a radiant red jewel in their right hands;

original: gzhu dang zhags pa dag dang dri med 'phro ba'i nor bu dmar po rnams kyi g-yon na de bzhin nyid /üîΩ22 / ser po rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag na 'khor lo dbyug pa dang ni 'jigs byed rdo rje rim pas te //
analyzed: gzhu dang zhags pa dag dang dri med 'phro ba'i nor bu dmar po rnams kyi g-yon na de bzhin nyid / 22 / ser po rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag na 'khor lo dbyug pa dang ni 'jigs byed rdo rje rim pas te //
translated: in their left hands are a skull, flaying knife, and a damaru with a sound of ‚Äúhi hi.‚ÄùüîΩThe right hands of the yellow ones hold a wheel, club, and vajra of Bhairava;

original: g-yon du dpal ldan dung dang lcags sgrog dang ni nges par sgra dang bcas pa'i rdo rje dril bur 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yon du dpal ldan dung dang lcags sgrog dang ni nges par sgra dang bcas pa'i rdo rje dril bur 'gyur //
translated: in the left hands are a glorious conch, iron chain, and a resounding vajra bell.

original: ri bong 'dzin pa lta bur dkar ba rnams kyi g-yas na dpal @59b ldan tho ba mdung dang rtse gsum ste //
analyzed: ri bong 'dzin pa lta bur dkar ba rnams kyi g-yas na dpal @59b ldan tho ba mdung dang rtse gsum ste //
translated: The white ones, like the moon, hold on the right a glorious hammer, a spear, and a trident,

original: g-yon na padma dkar po 'dab ma brgya dang ldan pa dag dang me long dang ni bgrang phreng ngo /
analyzed: g-yon na padma dkar po 'dab ma brgya dang ldan pa dag dang me long dang ni bgrang phreng ngo /
translated: and on the left a white lotus with a hundred petals, a mirror, and a rosary.

original: 23 / ljang gu rnams kyi g-yas su rdo rje gri gug dang ni dgra star rim pas rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: 23 / ljang gu rnams kyi g-yas su rdo rje gri gug dang ni dgra star rim pas rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The green ones hold on the right a vajra-knife and a battle-axe,

original: g-yon du dril bu dang ni thod pa mtha' dag yon tan gter dang tshangs pa'i gdong pa de nyid do //

analyzed: bse dang dom dang seng ge g-yag ni khyi gdong ma la sogs pa yi ste phyogs su rab tu 'gyur //
translated: are the directions of the rhinoceros, the bear, the lion, the yak, the dog, and so on.üîΩThe eight verses of the vajra eye are:

analyzed: rdo rje mig gi rkang pa brgyad pas yi shing rta la gnas mkha' la sngon mo'i shing rta yi //

analyzed: 41 /'od zer can dang tsu nd'a lcags sgrog ma dang khro gnyer can gyi shing rta rnams la phag dang ni //
translated: The chariots of Marici, CundƒÅ, PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, and Bh·πõku·π≠ƒ´ are the numbers of the pig,

original: rta dang glang po seng ge bdun gyi grangs su 'gyur te lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang du'o //
analyzed: rta dang glang po seng ge bdun gyi grangs su 'gyur te lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang du'o //
translated: the horse, the elephant, and the lion, respectively, in the directions of the gods, Yama, water, and the north.

original: shar du dri dang phreng ba ma ste gshin rje chu la gnas pa spros ma mar me sgeg mo dang // bzhad ma'o gar ma rol mo ma ni nor sbyin sa gzhi la ste mkha' la glu ma 'dod ma'o /
analyzed: shar du dri dang phreng ba ma ste gshin rje chu la gnas pa spros ma mar me sgeg mo dang // bzhad ma'o gar ma rol mo ma ni nor sbyin sa gzhi la ste mkha' la glu ma 'dod ma'o /
translated: In the southeast is Gƒ´tƒÅ, in the southwest is LƒÅsya, in the northwest is VƒÅdya, and in the northeast is Dh≈´pƒÅ.

original: 42 / snying por brgyad ni kha khyer la ste mkha' dang 'og na gnas pa rta babs 'og tu nges par sbyar //
analyzed: 42 / snying por brgyad ni kha khyer la ste mkha' dang 'og na gnas pa rta babs 'og tu nges par sbyar //

analyzed: gzungs ma rnams ni snam bu la ste gdengs can rigs dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod ma rnams kha khyer la //

original: dbye ba dang ni bskyod pa 'dod mar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po de bzhin rgyas dang rengs 'dod ma //
analyzed: dbye ba dang ni bskyod pa 'dod mar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po de bzhin rgyas dang rengs 'dod ma //
translated: The goddesses of division and shaking are kƒÅmadhenus, and likewise, O lord of men, the goddesses of expansion and paralysis are kƒÅmadhenus.

original: lha mo sgrol ma la sogs dag pa yis te srid gsum skyed ma gsod pa dang ni skyed 'dod ma /
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma la sogs dag pa yis te srid gsum skyed ma gsod pa dang ni skyed 'dod ma /
translated: The goddesses TƒÅrƒÅ and so forth are pure, and the goddesses of killing and giving birth are the mothers of the three worlds.

analyzed: 43 / rol mo 'dod ma dang ni rgyan 'dod mar 'gyur mi yi bdag po zas 'dod ma dang de bzhin nyid //
translated: The goddesses of music and ornaments are kƒÅmadhenus, and the goddesses of food and likewise of drink are kƒÅmadhenus, O lord of men.

analyzed: dri 'dod ma dang @61b gos ni 'dod mar 'gyur te nges par 'khrig pa 'dod ma dag ni drug pa'o // lus la 'phrug 'dod ma dang kha na gnas pa'i mchil ma 'dor dang lus kyi dri ma 'dod ma dang // gar 'dod ma dang stan 'dod ma dang chu dang mal stan dag la rkyal dang bsnyes par 'dod ma dang / 44 / ts'a mu nd'a sogs brgyad kyi bya ba rnams te de bzhin sa la khro skyes rnams kyi 'dod ma yang //
translated: The six who are desirous of sex are the one who is desirous of smell, the one who is desirous of clothing, the one who is desirous of kissing, the one who is desirous of embracing, the one who is desirous of scratching, and the one who is desirous of sex.üîΩThe eight who are desirous of action are the one who is desirous of scratching the body, the one who is desirous of spitting on the mouth, the one who is desirous of the body‚Äôs impurities, the one who is desirous of dancing, the one who is desirous of a seat, the one who is desirous of bathing and reclining on water and bedding, and the one who is desirous of the eight actions such as cƒÅmu·πá·∏çƒÅ.

original: kun tu gdung dang 'ching 'dod ma dang nges par 'jam por smra ba dang ni skems dang skrod 'dod ma //
analyzed: kun tu gdung dang 'ching 'dod ma dang nges par 'jam por smra ba dang ni skems dang skrod 'dod ma //
translated: The eight who are desirous of the earth are the one who is desirous of burning, the one who is desirous of binding, the one who is desirous of speaking gently, the one who is desirous of drying, the one who is desirous of driving away,

original: reg dang dgug pa dag dang 'ching dang mi yi bdag po phur bu 'debs dang rgyug pa 'dod mar 'gyur /
analyzed: reg dang dgug pa dag dang 'ching dang mi yi bdag po phur bu 'debs dang rgyug pa 'dod mar 'gyur /
translated: the one who is desirous of touching, the one who is desirous of summoning, the one who is desirous of binding, the one who is desirous of driving in a kƒ´la, and the one who is desirous of running.

original: yan lag thams cad bskyod par 'dod ma rab tu gsal zhing nges par bshang gci zag par 'dod ma dang / 45 / sems can rnams la slu 'dod ma dang nges par rtsod pa mang po lnga pa lhag ma za ba dang // g-yul 'dod ma dang sbrul 'ching ma dang byis pa khro bar 'dod ma rnams ni lha min rigs la 'gyur //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad bskyod par 'dod ma rab tu gsal zhing nges par bshang gci zag par 'dod ma dang / 45 / sems can rnams la slu 'dod ma dang nges par rtsod pa mang po lnga pa lhag ma za ba dang // g-yul 'dod ma dang sbrul 'ching ma dang byis pa khro bar 'dod ma rnams ni lha min rigs la 'gyur //
translated: The desire to move all limbs, the desire for complete clarity, the desire for complete defecation and urination, the desire to deceive sentient beings, the desire for complete conflict, the desire to eat the remainder, the desire for battle, the desire to bind serpents, and the desire for a child to be angry‚Äîthese are in the class of the demigods.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun phyir 'dod ma rnams slar yang de nas phyi rol dkyil 'khor dag gi kha khyer la //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun phyir 'dod ma rnams slar yang de nas phyi rol dkyil 'khor dag gi kha khyer la //
translated: The thirty-seven external desires are again on the outer rim of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig cung zad sems can bya ba rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba 'dir /
analyzed: nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig cung zad sems can bya ba rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba 'dir /
translated: In the time of each day, whatever is the activity of sentient beings is the activity of the yoginƒ´s here.

original: 46 / zhes pa de ltar rdo rje can gyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang dkyil 'khor rnam par gsungs //
analyzed: 46 / zhes pa de ltar rdo rje can gyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang dkyil 'khor rnam par gsungs //
translated: Thus, the possessor of the vajra has declared all of the three existences to be the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang ni spro dang sdud pa dag la dngos po'i skye ba yang dag gnas //
analyzed: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang ni spro dang sdud pa dag la dngos po'i skye ba yang dag gnas //
translated: Expansion and withdrawal are in the external, the body, and the other, and the arising of entities is real.

original: de la rtag pa mkha' yi rdo rje rnam gsum srid pa la gnas mi rtag nyid du 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de la rtag pa mkha' yi rdo rje rnam gsum srid pa la gnas mi rtag nyid du 'gyur ma yin //
translated: The eternal, the sky-vajra, is not subject to the three kinds of impermanence.

original: 'byung po'i tshogs ni rtag pa min par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mig 'phrul ji bzhin nyid du'o /
analyzed: 'byung po'i tshogs ni rtag pa min par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mig 'phrul ji bzhin nyid du'o /
translated: The host of elements is not eternal, O King, but is like a magical illusion.

original: 47 / rtag dang mi rtag mthong ste de lta na yang blun po'i blo can sems ni dag pa'i don slad du //
analyzed: 47 / rtag dang mi rtag mthong ste de lta na yang blun po'i blo can sems ni dag pa'i don slad du //
translated: The wise see both the eternal and the non-eternal, but the foolish, for the sake of purifying their minds,

original: sgrub thabs dag ni brjod par bya ste snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba med //
analyzed: sgrub thabs dag ni brjod par bya ste snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba med //

analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub bya sgrub pa po de 'khrul pa zhes pa rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang //
translated: The one who is to be attained and the one who attains‚Äîthis is the error, says the Vajra-holder, of all the means of attainment.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag ni dkyil 'khor dbang por rab tu bya /
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag ni dkyil 'khor dbang por rab tu bya /
translated: Therefore, O King, purify your mind of stains, and you will become the lord of the ma·πá·∏çala.

analyzed: 48 / dpal ldan rdo rje can ni thugs kyi rdo rje 'gyur te mi bdag dkyil 'khor sku yi rdo rje'o //
translated: The glorious Vajra-holder becomes the vajra of mind, and you, O King, become the vajra of the body, the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: lha rnams 'khor lo a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes gsung @62a * //
analyzed: lha rnams 'khor lo a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes gsung @62a * //
translated: The gods are born in the family of the wheel of Alikali,

original: gi rdo rje zla ba nyi ma'i steng du'o //
analyzed: gi rdo rje zla ba nyi ma'i steng du'o //
translated: Vajra Speech, on the moon and sun.

original: rtsa ba sdong bu dag ni aa yig 'dab ma dang ni de bzhin ge sar rnams kyang au yig go //
analyzed: rtsa ba sdong bu dag ni aa yig 'dab ma dang ni de bzhin ge sar rnams kyang au yig go //

original: dbus su dpal ldan lte ba dang ni zla ba nyi ma rnam gnyis rkang pa'i gnas dag ma yig go /
analyzed: dbus su dpal ldan lte ba dang ni zla ba nyi ma rnam gnyis rkang pa'i gnas dag ma yig go /

analyzed: 49 / ho yig thog ma tha ma'i snying po bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ste //

original: de ni shes rab chags pas zhu ba khyab bdag rdo rje can yang ri bong 'dzin pa bzhin bltas nas //
analyzed: de ni shes rab chags pas zhu ba khyab bdag rdo rje can yang ri bong 'dzin pa bzhin bltas nas //
translated: That is melted by the passion of wisdom, and the all-pervading lord, the Vajra Holder, is seen to be like the moon.üîΩThe goddesses sing:

analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis glu dag mdzad de bcom ldan khyod ni sems can kun la phan par mdzad pa po //

analyzed: bdag cag srungs shig lha mi'i bla ma rdo rje ldan pa 'dod pa don gnyer rnams la 'dod pa mdzod /

analyzed: 50 / rdo rje can des glu dag gsan nas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang mig 'phrul lta bur ni //

analyzed: gzigs nas skyed pa mdzad de dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba rang gi mtshan ma spros byas nas //

original: rdo rje'i rgyan dang ldan /

analyzed: shes rab thabs kyis rgyal po slar yang dkyil 'khor ma lus pa ni rab tu spro ba dag kyang ngo /
translated: the king of Wisdom and Means again emanated all the ma·πá·∏çalas.üîΩThe body of the terrible blue light, with a laughing face and half-bared fangs,

analyzed: shes rab thabs la rab byung mtshon cha rnams dang bcas pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta dag la gnas //
translated: Wisdom and means, the weapons, are mounted on the chariot of the eight limbs.

original: rgyal ba'i dgra ni 'joms par byed pa rdo rje shugs te ye shes 'khor lo'i slad du bskul bar bya /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dgra ni 'joms par byed pa rdo rje shugs te ye shes 'khor lo'i slad du bskul bar bya /
translated: The enemy of the Victorious Ones is destroyed by the vajra speed, and the wheel of wisdom is set in motion.

analyzed: 52 / dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes 'khor lo'i dbang phyug dag ni lte bar lcags kyus bsnun byas shing //

analyzed: phyag rnams rang gi rdo rje gdengs can dag gis de bzhin rab bcings mtshon cha rnams kyis 'jigs byas te //

original: mtha' dag bsgrub byar byas shing 'khor lo bzang po bskyod par byas nas 'di ni slar yang 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: mtha' dag bsgrub byar byas shing 'khor lo bzang po bskyod par byas nas 'di ni slar yang 'gro ba ste //

analyzed: gzhug dang bcing dang mnyes pa dang ni ro mnyam byed pa dag ni rmugs byed la sogs rnams kyis byed /

analyzed: 53 / rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor dag la sems ni nam mkha' dang bcas snying po'i padmar me yi steng du 'gyur //
