original: sa 'og tu ni rna ba sgra ru 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lho yi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
analyzed: sa 'og tu ni rna ba sgra ru 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lho yi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
translated: In the southwest is fire, and in the northwest is perception together with fire.üîΩIn the northeast is water

original: nam mkha' la ni nges par sems dang chos kyi dbyings su 'gyur te shar gyi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni nges par sems dang chos kyi dbyings su 'gyur te shar gyi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
translated: In the sky, one should definitely place Mind and the Element of Dharma in the left of the eastern door.

original: dang por thabs ni drug po dag kyang rgyal ba'i dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi ni lhag pa'i lha ru 'gyur /
analyzed: dang por thabs ni drug po dag kyang rgyal ba'i dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi ni lhag pa'i lha ru 'gyur /
translated: First, the six methods are the special deities of the mandala of the Lord of Conquerors.

original: 57 / phyi nas shes rab la sogs drug ni rab tu gsal bar bdag po rang rang padma'i gdan la'o //
analyzed: 57 / phyi nas shes rab la sogs drug ni rab tu gsal bar bdag po rang rang padma'i gdan la'o //
translated: Then, the six of wisdom and so forth are clearly the individual lords on their lotus seats.

original: shar gyi sgor ni rab gtum ral gri 'dzin pa shin tu stobs te de yi phyag rgya rengs byed ma'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor ni rab gtum ral gri 'dzin pa shin tu stobs te de yi phyag rgya rengs byed ma'o //
translated: In the eastern door is Pracha·πá·∏ça, holding a sword, very powerful, and his consort is Stambhinƒ´.

original: g-yas su rmugs byed dang ni nga rgyal mar 'gyur nor sbyin du yang khengs byed dang ni rmugs byed ma //
analyzed: g-yas su rmugs byed dang ni nga rgyal mar 'gyur nor sbyin du yang khengs byed dang ni rmugs byed ma //
translated: To the right are Stambhana and MƒÅnavikƒÅ, and to the west are Stambhana and MƒÅnavikƒÅ.

original: chu ru rengs byed dang ni mtha' yas brtson 'grus mar 'gyur sgo yi dbus na gnas pa padma la'o /
analyzed: chu ru rengs byed dang ni mtha' yas brtson 'grus mar 'gyur sgo yi dbus na gnas pa padma la'o /
translated: In the water is Stambhinƒ´ and Anantamati, abiding in the center of the door on a lotus.

original: 58 / dbyug sngon 'od zer can dang mi g-yo zhes dang khro gnyer can ma brtson 'grus mtha' yas lcags sgrog ma //
analyzed: 58 / dbyug sngon 'od zer can dang mi g-yo zhes dang khro gnyer can ma brtson 'grus mtha' yas lcags sgrog ma //
translated: Nƒ´lada·πá·∏ça, MƒÅmakƒ´, AcalƒÅ, and Bh·πõku·π≠ƒ´ are Anantamati and PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´.

original: 'dod pa tsu nd'a shing rta la gnas lha dang nor sbyin gzhan dang lho yi sgo yi dbus su ste //üîΩgnod mdzes drag @63a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsu nd'a shing rta la gnas lha dang nor sbyin gzhan dang lho yi sgo yi dbus su ste // gnod mdzes drag @63a * //
translated: In the desire (ca·πá·∏çƒÅla) chariot, in the middle of the southern door, is the god Kubera, and another.

original: spyan ma ni 'og tu 'gyur zhing mkha' la gtsug tor dang ni shin tu sngon mo nyid //
analyzed: spyan ma ni 'og tu 'gyur zhing mkha' la gtsug tor dang ni shin tu sngon mo nyid //
translated: Ugra-ugra-netra is below, and in the sky is U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a and K·πõ·π£·πáƒÅ.

original: shar gyi sgo yi steng dang gzhan du yang ni nges par 'gyur te gnyis pa dag gi shing rta yang /
analyzed: shar gyi sgo yi steng dang gzhan du yang ni nges par 'gyur te gnyis pa dag gi shing rta yang /
translated: In the eastern door above, and in the other place, there is the second chariot.

original: 59 / gsung las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni nor gyi phyogs su 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi gdan du 'gyur //üîΩshar du ts'a mu nd'a dang dbang por 'gyur te rtse mo can du khyab 'jug ma dang rig byed gdong //
analyzed: 59 / gsung las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni nor gyi phyogs su 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi gdan du 'gyur // shar du ts'a mu nd'a dang dbang por 'gyur te rtse mo can du khyab 'jug ma dang rig byed gdong //
translated: In the ma·πá·∏çala born from speech, in the direction of wealth, the seat of the beings is born.üîΩIn the east is Ca·πá·∏çƒÅla, and in Indra is ≈öakra. In the peak is Vi·π£·πáu, and in the Veda is Mukha.

original: gshin rjer phag mo drag por 'gyur te lha min bdag por gdong drug ma dang bgegs kyi mgon po'o //
analyzed: gshin rjer phag mo drag por 'gyur te lha min bdag por gdong drug ma dang bgegs kyi mgon po'o //
translated: In Yama is VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, and in Ugra is Ca·πá·∏ça. In the lord of the asuras is ·π¢a·πámukha, and in the lord of the obstacles is VinƒÅyaka.

original: nub tu dbang mo bden bral du 'gyur rlung du nges par dus kyi gdong ma dang ni khyab 'jug nyid /
analyzed: nub tu dbang mo bden bral du 'gyur rlung du nges par dus kyi gdong ma dang ni khyab 'jug nyid /
translated: In the west is IndrƒÅ·πáƒ´, and in Varuna is Varu·πáa. In the wind is certainly KƒÅlarƒÅtri, and in Vi·π£·πáu is Vi·π£·πáu.

original: 60 / gnod sbyin du ni drag mo gshin rjer 'gyur te phyugs kyi bdag por dpal mo nyid dang gdong drug pa //
analyzed: 60 / gnod sbyin du ni drag mo gshin rjer 'gyur te phyugs kyi bdag por dpal mo nyid dang gdong drug pa //
translated: In the Yakshas, she is Draupadi, in the Yamas, she is Shri, in the Pashupati, she is Shri herself, and in the Shakra, she is the six-faced one.

original: phyi rol gyi ni dbang po'i sgo yi g-yas su lha min bdag dang de yi phyag rgya srin mor 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni dbang po'i sgo yi g-yas su lha min bdag dang de yi phyag rgya srin mor 'gyur //
translated: In the external doors of the senses, on the right, she is the lord of the Asuras, and on the left, she is the Rakshasi, his seal.

original: me ni rlung dang rab gtum ma ste me dang chu lha mo yang lho yi sgo yi g-yas su'o //
analyzed: me ni rlung dang rab gtum ma ste me dang chu lha mo yang lho yi sgo yi g-yas su'o //
translated: In the fire, she is the wind, and in the fierce one, she is the goddess of the fire and water. She is also on the right of the southern door.

original: lha min bdag por dpal ldan gdong drug pa dang dpal mor 'gyur te nub tu dbang po rlung lha mo /
analyzed: lha min bdag por dpal ldan gdong drug pa dang dpal mor 'gyur te nub tu dbang po rlung lha mo /
translated: In the Asuras, she is the glorious six-faced one, and in the Shri, she is the lord of the wind in the west.

original: 61 / rlung du tshangs pa dang ni glog mar 'gyur te nor sbyin du yang rgya mtsho dang ni phag mo'o //
analyzed: 61 / rlung du tshangs pa dang ni glog mar 'gyur te nor sbyin du yang rgya mtsho dang ni phag mo'o //
translated: In the wind, she is Brahma, and in the lightning, she is the goddess of wealth, and in the Kubera, she is the ocean, and in the Varahi, she is the pig.

original: dbang ldan du ni tshogs kyi dbang po gzhon nu ma ste nor sbyin gshin rje'i sgo yi g-yon gyi char //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ni tshogs kyi dbang po gzhon nu ma ste nor sbyin gshin rje'i sgo yi g-yon gyi char //
translated: In the Ishana, she is the lord of the Ganas, and in the Kubera, she is the goddess of wealth, on the left of the door of the Yama.

original: drag po dus te khyab 'jug dang ni nor sbyin zhes pa lho dang nub kyi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
analyzed: drag po dus te khyab 'jug dang ni nor sbyin zhes pa lho dang nub kyi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
translated: In the Rudra, she is the time, and in the Vishnu, she is the goddess of wealth, on the left of the southern and western doors.

original: de dag rnams kyi phyag rgyar rab grags ri sras gshin rje ma dang dpal mo nor gyi dbang mor 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi phyag rgyar rab grags ri sras gshin rje ma dang dpal mo nor gyi dbang mor 'gyur /
translated: The mudras of those are well known as the daughters of the mountain, Yama, and Sri Lakshmi.

original: 62 / phyi rol du ni lha dang gshin rje nor sbyin nub kyi kha khyer dag la klu rnams mtha' dag ste //üîΩpadma dang ni stobs kyi rgyu dag g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nor rgyas bu dang dung skyong ni //
analyzed: 62 / phyi rol du ni lha dang gshin rje nor sbyin nub kyi kha khyer dag la klu rnams mtha' dag ste // padma dang ni stobs kyi rgyu dag g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nor rgyas bu dang dung skyong ni //
translated: Outside, the gods, Yama, Kubera, and all the nagas are on the western ledge.

original: me la gnas pa dag ste chu yi steng du rigs ldan mtha' yas klur ni rab tu grags par 'gyur //
analyzed: me la gnas pa dag ste chu yi steng du rigs ldan mtha' yas klur ni rab tu grags par 'gyur //
translated: Padma and Takshaka are on the moving mandala, Vasanta and Shankhapala are on the fire mandala, and Kulika and Ananta are well known as nagas on the water mandala.

original: de bzhin sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas rigs kyi dbang gis 'jog po dang ni padma chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas rigs kyi dbang gis 'jog po dang ni padma chen por 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, on the mandala of the earth, Kulika and Mahapadma are placed by the power of the family.

original: 63 / de rnams shes rab rab gtum ma rnams dur khrod sa la gnas pa khyi gdong ma la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: 63 / de rnams shes rab rab gtum ma rnams dur khrod sa la gnas pa khyi gdong ma la sogs pa ste //
translated: Those are the prajnas, the fierce ones, residing in the charnel grounds, such as SvanamukhI.

original: de rnams thabs ni padma la sogs gzhan gyi rigs kyi dbang gis bde ba dam pa'i don du 'gyur //
analyzed: de rnams thabs ni padma la sogs gzhan gyi rigs kyi dbang gis bde ba dam pa'i don du 'gyur //
translated: Their method is Padma and so on, by the power of the other families, for the sake of supreme bliss.

original: shar gyi 'khor lor @63b rtse mos 'bigs pa'i dur khrod du ni g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas khyi gdong ma //
analyzed: shar gyi 'khor lor @63b rtse mos 'bigs pa'i dur khrod du ni g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas khyi gdong ma //
translated: In the charnel ground of the eastern wheel, piercing with the peak, is the face of the dog, standing in the mandala of motion.

original: gshin rje dag tu nges par ro ni bsreg par phag gi gdong ma byang du rul pa dang bcas par /
analyzed: gshin rje dag tu nges par ro ni bsreg par phag gi gdong ma byang du rul pa dang bcas par /
translated: In the charnel ground of Yama, the face of the pig is in the cremation ground, in the north, with the corpse.

original: 64 / stag gdong ma ste chu ru rnag gi drir ni de bzhin nyid du ce spyang dag gi gdong mar 'gyur //
analyzed: 64 / stag gdong ma ste chu ru rnag gi drir ni de bzhin nyid du ce spyang dag gi gdong mar 'gyur //
translated: The face of the tigress is in the charnel ground of the waters, with the smell of pus, and the face of the jackal is in the charnel ground of the same.

original: me dang lha min bdag por lhag ma dang ni mi bzad g-yul du bya rog gdong ma bya rgod bcas //
analyzed: me dang lha min bdag por lhag ma dang ni mi bzad g-yul du bya rog gdong ma bya rgod bcas //
translated: The face of the crow is in the charnel ground of Agni and the lord of the demigods, with the corpse, in the terrible battle.

original: rlung du sbrul gyis zos par mkha' 'gro'i bdag po'i gdong ma dbang ldan du yang byis pa shi bar ni //
analyzed: rlung du sbrul gyis zos par mkha' 'gro'i bdag po'i gdong ma dbang ldan du yang byis pa shi bar ni //
translated: The face of the dakini is in the charnel ground of Vayu, with the corpse eaten by snakes, and the face of the owl is in the charnel ground of Isana, with the corpse of a child.

original: 'khor lo la  gnas 'ug gdong ma ste sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas zla nyi dag kyang bsgom par bya ;
analyzed: 'khor lo la  gnas 'ug gdong ma ste sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas zla nyi dag kyang bsgom par bya ;
translated: One should visualize the moon and sun in the mandala of the earth, standing in the wheel.

original: 65 / g-yon brkyang ba ni yum gyir 'gyur te mnyam pa'i stabs ni 'dab ma dag gi lha mo'i tshogs kyi'o //
analyzed: 65 / g-yon brkyang ba ni yum gyir 'gyur te mnyam pa'i stabs ni 'dab ma dag gi lha mo'i tshogs kyi'o //
translated: The left leg extended is the mother, and the even stance is the host of goddesses of the petals.

original: bcu dang nor gyi tshogs dag gi ni g-yon brkyangs ga lha min mo rnams kyi yang zlum po'o //
analyzed: bcu dang nor gyi tshogs dag gi ni g-yon brkyangs ga lha min mo rnams kyi yang zlum po'o //
translated: The ten and the wealth-possessing are extended to the left, and the female titans are also circular.

original: g-yon brkyang dag la gnas pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa g-yas brkyang stabs su nges par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang dag la gnas pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa g-yas brkyang stabs su nges par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Those who are extended to the left are definitely extended to the right in meditative equipoise.

original: sa ga la ni sa  gnyid ces bya bar 'gyur zhing nges par zlum po la yang zlum po'o /
analyzed: sa ga la ni sa  gnyid ces bya bar 'gyur zhing nges par zlum po la yang zlum po'o /
translated: The one on the sixth is called ‚Äúearth,‚Äù and the definite circle is also a circle.

original: 66 / dkyil 'khor du yang lhag ma'i lha rnams rab tu gsal zhing nges par rdo rje gdan gyis gnas pa ste //
analyzed: 66 / dkyil 'khor du yang lhag ma'i lha rnams rab tu gsal zhing nges par rdo rje gdan gyis gnas pa ste //
translated: In the ma·πá·∏çala, the remaining deities are definitely clear and are seated on vajra seats.

original: rang rigs phyogs gnas lha mo rnams ni rang rang padma zla ba'i steng du padma'i gdan gyis gnas //
analyzed: rang rigs phyogs gnas lha mo rnams ni rang rang padma zla ba'i steng du padma'i gdan gyis gnas //
translated: The goddesses of one‚Äôs own family are seated on lotus seats on their individual lotuses and moons.

original: gdengs can rigs dang bcas pa rang rang phyogs kyi bzhon par gnas pa'i lha rnams rdo rje gdan gyis gnas //
analyzed: gdengs can rigs dang bcas pa rang rang phyogs kyi bzhon par gnas pa'i lha rnams rdo rje gdan gyis gnas //
translated: The nƒÅgas and their families are seated on their individual mounts in their directions and are seated on vajra seats.

original: lha rnams 'dab mar lha mo rnams ni rol pa'i stabs te 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: lha rnams 'dab mar lha mo rnams ni rol pa'i stabs te 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi de bzhin nyid /
translated: The goddesses in the petals of the deities are in the manner of play.

original: 67 / g-yas ba bskum pa dag kyang sa gzhi la ni nges par bkod cing rkang pa g-yon pa brkyang ba dag / phyed dang bcas pa'i khru gnyis pa ste mi yi bdag po de ni g-yon pa brkyang ba'i stabs su 'gyur //
analyzed: 67 / g-yas ba bskum pa dag kyang sa gzhi la ni nges par bkod cing rkang pa g-yon pa brkyang ba dag / phyed dang bcas pa'i khru gnyis pa ste mi yi bdag po de ni g-yon pa brkyang ba'i stabs su 'gyur //
translated: The right foot is bent and placed on the ground, the left foot is extended, and the two feet are two cubits apart, together with half a cubit: this is the left-extended position, O King.

original: g-yon pa'i sbyor ba yis ni g-yas brkyang du 'gyur rkang pa zung ni mnyam pa dag kyang mnyam pa'i stabs //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i sbyor ba yis ni g-yas brkyang du 'gyur rkang pa zung ni mnyam pa dag kyang mnyam pa'i stabs //
translated: The right-extended position is the reverse of the left position. The two feet are even, and the position is even.

original: yon tan dbang gis pus mo zung ni rab tu brkyang ba dag las sa ga dang ni zlum por 'gyur /
analyzed: yon tan dbang gis pus mo zung ni rab tu brkyang ba dag las sa ga dang ni zlum por 'gyur /
translated: By the power of the qualities, the two knees are extended, and the position is called the half-moon and the circle.

original: 68 / cung zad pus mo phyed ni 'khyog pa rol par 'gyur te lhag ma dag ni rab tu grags pa nyid //
analyzed: 68 / cung zad pus mo phyed ni 'khyog pa rol par 'gyur te lhag ma dag ni rab tu grags pa nyid //
translated: The half-knee is slightly bent, and the position is called the dance. The rest are well known.

original: slar yang rnal 'byor pa yis bha ra ta las shes par bya ste rdo rje gar gyi @64a * //
analyzed: slar yang rnal 'byor pa yis bha ra ta las shes par bya ste rdo rje gar gyi @64a * //
translated: Again, the yogi should know from the Bharata, for the sake of the vajra dance.

original: slad du'o // cod pan dag la phan tshun rdo rje yi ni rdo rjer 'gyur te sangs rgyas lnga rnams re 'ga' na //
analyzed: slad du'o // cod pan dag la phan tshun rdo rje yi ni rdo rjer 'gyur te sangs rgyas lnga rnams re 'ga' na //
translated: In the head ornaments, the vajra is the vajra of the mutual vajras, and the five buddhas are sometimes

original: gzugs kyi steng du mi bskyod pa ste gsal bar padma 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs kyi steng du mi bskyod pa ste gsal bar padma 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nyid du 'gyur /
translated: On the form of Ak·π£obhya, the lotus-holder, Vairocana appears clearly.

original: 69 / rin chen dbang po'i chu skyes 'dzin dang don yod grub pa'i cod pan la ni rab mchog nor bu'i phyag / drug gi cod pan ral pa zhes byar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis lhag ma'i 'khor lo yi yang gzhan //
analyzed: 69 / rin chen dbang po'i chu skyes 'dzin dang don yod grub pa'i cod pan la ni rab mchog nor bu'i phyag / drug gi cod pan ral pa zhes byar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis lhag ma'i 'khor lo yi yang gzhan //
translated: The lotus-holder of Ratnasa·πÉbha, the jewel-holder of Amoghasiddhi, the crown of the six, is called the hair-tuft, and the other wheels are also so by the power of the qualities.

original: sa las 'khor lo rab tu skye bar 'gyur te chu las padma dang ni me las nor bu'o //
analyzed: sa las 'khor lo rab tu skye bar 'gyur te chu las padma dang ni me las nor bu'o //
translated: The wheel arises from earth, the lotus from water, and the jewel from fire.

original: rlung las ral gri dang ni stong pa dag las rdo rjer 'gyur te 'gyur med las ni gri gug go /
analyzed: rlung las ral gri dang ni stong pa dag las rdo rjer 'gyur te 'gyur med las ni gri gug go /
translated: The sword arises from wind, the vajra from space, and the flaying knife from the unchanging.

original: 70 / gos dang bdud rtsi'i snod du 'gyur te nges par me long dang bcas phreng ba dang ni rgyud mangs dang // drug pa chos 'byung nges par sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i zhi ba dag las so //
analyzed: 70 / gos dang bdud rtsi'i snod du 'gyur te nges par me long dang bcas phreng ba dang ni rgyud mangs dang // drug pa chos 'byung nges par sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i zhi ba dag las so //
translated: The cloth and the nectar vessel, the mirror, the garland, the lute, and the sixth, the dharma source, definitely arise from earth, water, fire, wind, space, and peace.

original: phub dang mdung dang mda' dang dgra sta dang ni da ma ru dag mtshan ma lnga ste de bzhin du //
analyzed: phub dang mdung dang mda' dang dgra sta dang ni da ma ru dag mtshan ma lnga ste de bzhin du //
translated: The five emblems are the shield, the spear, the arrow, the battle-axe, and the damaru.

original: dbyug pa zhags pa lcags kyu dag dang nges par de bzhin tho ba  dang ni rtse gsum dag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: dbyug pa zhags pa lcags kyu dag dang nges par de bzhin tho ba  dang ni rtse gsum dag tu 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, the club, the noose, the goad, the hammer, and the trident.

original: 71 / gzhu dang au tpa la dang slar yang de bzhin mgo bo dang ni kha tv'am ga dang dril bu dang // de bzhin lcags sgrog la sogs chu na rgyu ba thod pa stag lpags dang ni glang po'i pags pa ste //
analyzed: 71 / gzhu dang au tpa la dang slar yang de bzhin mgo bo dang ni kha tv'am ga dang dril bu dang // de bzhin lcags sgrog la sogs chu na rgyu ba thod pa stag lpags dang ni glang po'i pags pa ste //
translated: The bow, the utpala, the head, the kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga, the bell, and likewise the chain, etc., the skull, the tiger-skin, and the elephant-skin.

original: 'dir ni lhag ma nye ba'i mtshan ma sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' las skyes pa //
analyzed: 'dir ni lhag ma nye ba'i mtshan ma sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' las skyes pa //
translated: Here, the remaining secondary emblems are born from earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de dag rang bzhin yon tan dbang gi sa shes par bya ba nyid de lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o /
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin yon tan dbang gi sa shes par bya ba nyid de lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o /
translated: They are to be known as the qualities of the deities and goddesses, by their nature.

original: 72 / gang zhig li la sogs pa sum cu'i dbyangs ni sa chu bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' las skyes pa //
analyzed: 72 / gang zhig li la sogs pa sum cu'i dbyangs ni sa chu bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' las skyes pa //
translated: The thirty vowels, such as ‚Äúa,‚Äù are born from earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: thung ngu ring po'i rab dbye rnams kyis rim par yongs bkod nges par padma la gnas zla ba dang // nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa de dag mtha' dag 'khor lo la sogs mtshan ma rnams kyi rang gi sngags //
analyzed: thung ngu ring po'i rab dbye rnams kyis rim par yongs bkod nges par padma la gnas zla ba dang // nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa de dag mtha' dag 'khor lo la sogs mtshan ma rnams kyi rang gi sngags //
translated: The short vowels, in due order, are arranged on the lotus, on the seat of the moon and sun, and all of them are the seed syllables of the wheel and so forth.

original: gang zhig kho nar mtshan ma drug par gyur pa der ni yon tan dbang gis gzhom du med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig kho nar mtshan ma drug par gyur pa der ni yon tan dbang gis gzhom du med par 'gyur /
translated: He who is the six signs becomes invincible by the power of the qualities.

original: 73 / n'a da dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po thugs kyi rdo rje aa yig go //

translated: The Marici, the smell vajra, are the frowning and the cun·∏çƒÅ, well known.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas nges par ro yi rdo rje ma dang gzugs kyi rdo rjer rim pas shes par bya ;
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas nges par ro yi rdo rje ma dang gzugs kyi rdo rjer rim pas shes par bya ;
translated: By the division of the families, the taste vajra and the form vajra are to be known, respectively.

original: /'dir ni rengs byed dus mthar byed pa nyid de slar yang shin tu stobs dang bgegs dgrar rab tu grags //
analyzed: /'dir ni rengs byed dus mthar byed pa nyid de slar yang shin tu stobs dang bgegs dgrar rab tu grags //
translated: Here, the benumbed is the destroyer at the end of the world, and again, the very powerful and the enemy of obstacles, well known.

original: rmugs byed shes rab mthar byed dag tu rab tu 'gyur te de bzhin khengs byed dang ni padma'i dgra /üîΩ90 / rlung me chu sa ts'a mu nd'a dang phag mo dbang phyug ma dang de bzhin dbang mo bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: rmugs byed shes rab mthar byed dag tu rab tu 'gyur te de bzhin khengs byed dang ni padma'i dgra / 90 / rlung me chu sa ts'a mu nd'a dang phag mo dbang phyug ma dang de bzhin dbang mo bzhi pa ste //
translated: The four goddesses of the corners are, in order, Stambhani, Mohani, Marani, and Jariini, and also, in the same order, Mandarava, Padma, Arini, and Padma-Arini.üîΩThe four goddesses of the doors are Vayu, Agni, Varuna, and Prithivf, and also, in the same order, Surabhi, Sura, Vasudhara, and Vasudhara.

original: dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya zhes pa g-yo ba 'phrog byed lha min mer ni gnas pa yang //üîΩtshangs pa dang ni rnam par snang mdzad du 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis rgya mtsho dag dang 'od dpag med //
analyzed: dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya zhes pa g-yo ba 'phrog byed lha min mer ni gnas pa yang // tshangs pa dang ni rnam par snang mdzad du 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis rgya mtsho dag dang 'od dpag med //
translated: The four goddesses of the intermediate directions are Gandha, Rupa, Rasa, and Sparsa, and also, in the same order, Camunda, Canda, Canda, and Canda.üîΩBrahma and Visnu become Aksobhya and Amitabha, respectively, and also, in the same order, Ratnasambhava and Amoghasiddhi.üîΩIndra and Yama become, respectively, Vairocana and Amoghasiddhi, and also, in the same order, Ratnasambhava and Amitabha.

original: me dang dpal ldan phyag na rin chen du 'gyur rlung dang don yod grub pa dag ni de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: me dang dpal ldan phyag na rin chen du 'gyur rlung dang don yod grub pa dag ni de bzhin nyid /
translated: Kubera and Varuna become, respectively, Ratnasambhava and Amoghasiddhi, and also, in the same order, Amitabha and Aksobhya.

original: 91 / mi bskyod pa dang lha min dgra bor 'gyur te rgyal ba'i bdag po dang ni bde byed rab tu grags //üîΩrnam par sel ba gang de brgya byin du 'gyur 'jig rten mgon po tshogs kyi bdag po de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 91 / mi bskyod pa dang lha min dgra bor 'gyur te rgyal ba'i bdag po dang ni bde byed rab tu grags //üîΩrnam par sel ba gang de brgya byin du 'gyur 'jig rten mgon po tshogs kyi bdag po de bzhin nyid //
translated: Nirti and Isvara become, respectively, Amoghasiddhi and Aksobhya, and also, in the same order, Aksobhya and Amitabha.üîΩVayu and Agni become, respectively, Amoghasiddhi and Ratnasambhava, and also, in the same order, Amitabha and Aksobhya.üîΩVaruna and Prithivf become, respectively, Ratnasambhava and Amoghasiddhi, and also, in the same order, Aksobhya and Amitabha.üîΩCamunda and Canda become, respectively, Amoghasiddhi and Aksobhya, and also, in the same order, Aksobhya and Amitabha.üîΩCanda and Canda become, respectively, Ratnasambhava and Amoghasiddhi, and also, in the same order, Amitabha and Aksobhya.üîΩCanda and Canda become, respectively, Vairocana and Amoghasiddhi, and also, in the same order, Amitabha and Aksobhya.

original: sa yi snying po gdong drug par 'gyur dpal ldan mkha' snying da nu'i bdag por rab tu grags pa yin //
analyzed: sa yi snying po gdong drug par 'gyur dpal ldan mkha' snying da nu'i bdag por rab tu grags pa yin //
translated: Kshitigarbha is the six-faced one, and glorious Akashagarbha is renowned as the lord of the Danavas.

original: dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje dus su 'gyur te drug pa kun tu bzang po nor gyi bdag po'o /
analyzed: dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje dus su 'gyur te drug pa kun tu bzang po nor gyi bdag po'o /
translated: Glorious Vajrapani is the one in the time, and the sixth, Samantabhadra, is the lord of wealth.

original: 92 / rig ma drug dang phyag rgya drug ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis de rnams rang rang phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: 92 / rig ma drug dang phyag rgya drug ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis de rnams rang rang phyag rgya ste //
translated: The six consorts and six seals are their respective seals by the power of their inherent qualities.

original: phyag rgya rig ma la sogs nyi ma lha yi mchog gi bdag rnams dkar po nag po rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya rig ma la sogs nyi ma lha yi mchog gi bdag rnams dkar po nag po rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The seals, consorts, and so on, are the supreme lords of the solar deities, white and black, complete.

original: de dag rnams kyi pad 'dab la ni nor lag tshes te mchu yi zla ba la sogs gang de rnams //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi pad 'dab la ni nor lag tshes te mchu yi zla ba la sogs gang de rnams //
translated: On the petals of those, there are the lunar mansions, Hasta and so on.

original: zla ba drug ni snga ma drug tu 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lha mo rnams kyi phyi ma yang /
analyzed: zla ba drug ni snga ma drug tu 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lha mo rnams kyi phyi ma yang /
translated: The six months are the six earlier ones, and by the power of the family, the later ones of the goddesses

original: 93 / klu brgyad gang de bum pa rnams te khyab bdag padma'i 'dab la nus ma de rnams rab gtum ma //
analyzed: 93 / klu brgyad gang de bum pa rnams te khyab bdag padma'i 'dab la nus ma de rnams rab gtum ma //
translated: are the eight nagas, which are the vases. The all-pervading lord is the fierce lady on the lotus petals.

original: dpal ldan du ba bya rog gdong mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis bya rgod gdong ma smig rgyu ma //
analyzed: dpal ldan du ba bya rog gdong mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis bya rgod gdong ma smig rgyu ma //

original: mkha' snang ma ni 'ug pa'i gdong ma dpal ldan mar me mkha' 'gro'i bdag po'i gdong mar rab tu grags //üîΩnag mo 'bar ma khyi gdong ma ste dmar mo 'bar @66b ma shin tu rnam 'gyur bzhin ldan phag gdong ma /

translated: The Sky-wanderer is the Owl-faced, and the glorious Lamp is known as the face of the Lord of the Dakas.üîΩThe Black Blazing is the Dog-faced, the Red Blazing has a face with a very contorted expression, and the Pig-faced is the White Blazing.

original: 94 / dkar mo 'bar ma stag gi gdong mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis ser mo 'bar ma ce spyang ma //
analyzed: 94 / dkar mo 'bar ma stag gi gdong mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis ser mo 'bar ma ce spyang ma //
translated: The Yellow Blazing is the Jackal-faced, and by the power of the family, the Black Blazing is the Tiger-faced.

original: de bzhin sgeg mo la sogs thams cad rab tu gsal ba rnam bcu sna tshogs yum ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgeg mo la sogs thams cad rab tu gsal ba rnam bcu sna tshogs yum ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Similarly, all the Charnel Ground Goddesses, such as the Charming One, are very clear. The various Mothers are the remaining ones.

original: lha mo sangs rgyas rig ma shing dang bcas shing bum pa dang bcas rgyal ba yi ni dag pa'i sku //
analyzed: lha mo sangs rgyas rig ma shing dang bcas shing bum pa dang bcas rgyal ba yi ni dag pa'i sku //
translated: The Goddess, the Buddha's Knowledge, with the tree and the vase, is the Victor's Pure Body.

original: khro bo'i dbang po byang chub sems dpa' nges par ro yi rdo rje ma ni chos kyi sku de nyid /
analyzed: khro bo'i dbang po byang chub sems dpa' nges par ro yi rdo rje ma ni chos kyi sku de nyid /

original: 95 / rnal 'byor ma rnams longs spyod sku ste rab mchog shing rta la gnas lha ni nyi mar rab grags pa //
analyzed: 95 / rnal 'byor ma rnams longs spyod sku ste rab mchog shing rta la gnas lha ni nyi mar rab grags pa //
translated: The yoginis are the Sambhogakaya, the supreme vehicle, the deity well known as the sun.

analyzed: klu ni brgyad po rnams dang rab gtum ma rnams 'khor dang bcas pa sangs rgyas kyi ni sprul pa'i sku //

analyzed: de bzhin slar yang rgyal ba'i sku ni dbye ba gnyis su 'gyur te phyi rol dag dang nang na yang //

original: mngal nas skyes pa ji lta ba nyid de bzhin kho na dkyil 'khor la ni nges par rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa ji lta ba nyid de bzhin kho na dkyil 'khor la ni nges par rab tu 'gyur /

analyzed: 96 / ston pa lha mo sogs dang bum pa lhan skyes rgyal ba'i sku ste dkyil 'khor snying po'i dbus su'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs chos kyi sku ste nges par ro yi rdo rje ma sogs longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //

analyzed: khro bo sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi ni snying por yang dag gnas //

analyzed: phyi rol du ni ts'a mu nd'a la sogs pa lha mo brgyad po 'khor dang bcas pa dag pa'i sku /

analyzed: ye shes dang ni sprul pa'i sku dag zung du 'gyur te srog chags rnams la thar pa ster ba nyid //

analyzed: 'di dag gis ni byin brlabs yan lag rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po lha mo rnams kyis bkru bar bya //

translated: The spokes are doubled, and are the Bodhisattvas and so forth, and are the kings of the throat cakra of enjoyment.üîΩThe spokes are ninety, and are the nƒÅgas and so forth, and are the kings of the navel cakra of emanation.üîΩThe spokes are ninety, and are the gods and so forth, and are the kings of the cakra of action at the joints of the hands and feet.

analyzed: nyon mongs rnams kyis drag po chung mar bcas pa khyab bdag zhabs kyi 'og tu bdud kyi tshogs kyi bdud //

analyzed: dung dang ga nd'i ma ni ljon pa zhes pa dag kyang de bzhin sku yi rdo rje la sogs kyis //

analyzed: 103 /'du byed don yod grub pa tshor ba dri med nor bu'i phyag dang 'du shes snang ba mtha' yas te //

analyzed: gzugs ni 'khor lo can no ri bong can dang stobs khrag bshang ba gci ba rnam par dag pa'o /

analyzed: lha mo drug ni khams rnams kyis te yul dang yul can rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' phyag rgyar bcas //

analyzed: 104 / ts'a mu nd'a sogs thun brgyad kyis te padma'i 'dab mar gnas rnams nyi ma'i dus sbyor chu tshod kyis //

analyzed: gsang bar mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod rnams kyis klu rnams dang ni gtum mo rnams kyang rnam par dag / de bzhin 'dod ma la sogs de dag rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis lus kyi bya bas rnam par dag 105 / skra rnams kyis ni grub pa

analyzed: mtha' dag ba spu rnams kyis dur khrod sa gzhi la gnas 'byung po'i tshogs //
translated: All the pores of the body are the hosts of spirits dwelling in the charnel grounds.

original: de nyid rnams kyis gtso bo'i mtshon cha rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khams kyis phyi yi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnams kyis gtso bo'i mtshon cha rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khams kyis phyi yi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The weapons of the principal deities are the elements, by the power of their natures and qualities, the outer seals.

original: rdo rjes nang gi phyag rgya rdo rje 'dzin pa'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du yang dag gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes nang gi phyag rgya rdo rje 'dzin pa'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du yang dag gnas pa'o //
translated: The inner seals are the vajra and so forth, abiding perfectly on the moon in the heart of Vajradhara.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje can dang sna tshogs yum ni rnam gsum srid gnas 'gyur med ye shes dbye ba las /
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje can dang sna tshogs yum ni rnam gsum srid gnas 'gyur med ye shes dbye ba las /
translated: The glorious Vajra Holder and the various mothers are the three states of existence, unchanging due to the division of pristine consciousness.

original: 106 / dpal ldan dag pa las ni chos skur 'gyur te chos las nges par longs spyod rdzogs sku bzang po'o //
analyzed: 106 / dpal ldan dag pa las ni chos skur 'gyur te chos las nges par longs spyod rdzogs sku bzang po'o //

analyzed: longs spyod las ni sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur te rgyal ba'i bdag po'i sems can kun don byed pa po //
translated: From the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya arises; the lord of victors is the one who benefits all sentient beings.

original: bzhi pa'i gnas skabs shin tu gnyid log nges par slar yang gzhan dang lus kyi dbye bas sad pa ste //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i gnas skabs shin tu gnyid log nges par slar yang gzhan dang lus kyi dbye bas sad pa ste //

original: sna tshogs rgyan dang ldan zhing me long dag la gnas pa lta bu'i ye shes 'khor lo rang byung ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan dang ldan zhing me long dag la gnas pa lta bu'i ye shes 'khor lo rang byung ba //
translated: The self-arisen wheel of wisdom, endowed with various ornaments, is like a reflection in a mirror.

original: 'dod pa dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med srid pa rnam pa gsum po dag kyang rim pas sbyangs byas te //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med srid pa rnam pa gsum po dag kyang rim pas sbyangs byas te //
translated: Having gradually purified the three types of existence‚Äîdesire, form, and formless‚Äî

original: phyi nas ye shes me lce dag gis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag dus gcig tu ni dgug par bya /
analyzed: phyi nas ye shes me lce dag gis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag dus gcig tu ni dgug par bya /
translated: later, with the flame of wisdom, all three existences are summoned at once.

original: 111 / zla ba nyi ma aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyis rnam gsum bgrod gnas sku yi rdo rje sogs bzlas pa //
analyzed: 111 / zla ba nyi ma aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyis rnam gsum bgrod gnas sku yi rdo rje sogs bzlas pa //
translated: The three vajras, the body and so on, are recited with the vowels and consonants, the three places of the three paths.

original: so sor sdud pa la sogs drug gis gser bzang padma la ni sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor te //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa la sogs drug gis gser bzang padma la ni sku gsung thugs kyi rnal 'byor te //
translated: The yoga of body, speech, and mind is the excellent gold in the lotus through the six, withdrawal and so on.

original: dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis rdo rje chu skyes dag la ro mnyam gyur pas bsgom pa rdo rje gsum //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis rdo rje chu skyes dag la ro mnyam gyur pas bsgom pa rdo rje gsum //
translated: The three vajras are meditated on through the equal taste of the vajra lotus with joy and so on.

original: shes rab padmar sems kyi thig le dag la lhan skyes bde ba'i dbang gis bsgom pa gzhom med 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab padmar sems kyi thig le dag la lhan skyes bde ba'i dbang gis bsgom pa gzhom med 'gyur /
translated: The meditation on the bindu of the mind in the lotus of the wisdom consort through the power of innate bliss becomes the indestructible.

original: 112 / bdud rtsi lnga la sogs dang chu gter rdo rje rnams dang sngags kyi bzlas pa sogs kyis bsnyen pa ste //
analyzed: 112 / bdud rtsi lnga la sogs dang chu gter rdo rje rnams dang sngags kyi bzlas pa sogs kyis bsnyen pa ste //
translated: The approach is with the five nectars and so on, the water-jewel-vajra, and the mantra recitation and so on.

original: so sor sdud pa sogs dang rdo rje padma las skyes bdud rtsi yis ni nye ba'i sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa sogs dang rdo rje padma las skyes bdud rtsi yis ni nye ba'i sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: The near-accomplishment is with the withdrawal and so on, and the nectar born from the vajra and lotus.

original: dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis rdo rje gsum dang chu skyes ro mnyam gyur pa bsgom pa sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs rnams kyis rdo rje gsum dang chu skyes ro mnyam gyur pa bsgom pa sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: The accomplishment is the meditation on the three vajras and the lotus with the same taste as the joy and so on.

original: shes rab sbyar la gang tshe 'pho med phra mo'i rnal 'byor dag las nges par sgrub pa chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab sbyar la gang tshe 'pho med phra mo'i rnal 'byor dag las nges par sgrub pa chen por 'gyur /
translated: The great accomplishment is from the yoga of the subtle, the union without emission, when joined with wisdom.

original: 113 / dang por stong nyid byang chub nges par slar yang de nas zla ba thig le dag ni yang dag 'dzin //
analyzed: 113 / dang por stong nyid byang chub nges par slar yang de nas zla ba thig le dag ni yang dag 'dzin //
translated: First, definitely the emptiness enlightenment, then again the moon and the drop are held.

original: de nas gzugs dag bskyed cing rab mchog ro yi rigs rnams dag gis yi ge dgod pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: de nas gzugs dag bskyed cing rab mchog ro yi rigs rnams dag gis yi ge dgod pa nyid yin te //
translated: Then the forms are generated, and the syllables are placed with the supreme tastes and the families.

original: 'di @68b ni spyi yi bsnyen pa chu yi gter gyi rdo rje rnams kyis sgrub pa dag ni 'bring po yang //
analyzed: 'di @68b ni spyi yi bsnyen pa chu yi gter gyi rdo rje rnams kyis sgrub pa dag ni 'bring po yang //
translated: This is the general approach, the medium accomplishment with the water-jewel-vajras.

original: 'di la thabs ni rnam bzhir 'gyur te dman dang brtan pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag dag la de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: 'di la thabs ni rnam bzhir 'gyur te dman dang brtan pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag dag la de bzhin nyid /
translated: The means here are fourfold: the branch of accomplishing the inferior and the stable is reality.

original: 114 / so sor sdud pa rgyal ba'i dbang por 'gyur zhing rnam pa bcu ste bsam gtan mi bskyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 114 / so sor sdud pa rgyal ba'i dbang por 'gyur zhing rnam pa bcu ste bsam gtan mi bskyod pa nyid do //
translated: The branch of accomplishing the superior is the ten aspects of withdrawal, which is the lord of victors, and meditative concentration is the immovable.

original: srog rtsol dag kyang ral gri can no slar yang rnam pa bcu ste 'dzin pa phyag na rin chen no //
analyzed: srog rtsol dag kyang ral gri can no slar yang rnam pa bcu ste 'dzin pa phyag na rin chen no //
translated: The branch of accomplishing the supreme is life-force control, which is the sword wielder, and again, the ten aspects are retention, which is the jewel in the hand.

original: gdol pa mo la rjes su dran pa padma 'dzin par 'gyur te dpal ldan ting 'dzin 'khor lo can //
analyzed: gdol pa mo la rjes su dran pa padma 'dzin par 'gyur te dpal ldan ting 'dzin 'khor lo can //
translated: The branch of accomplishing the special is recollection, which is the lotus holder, and the glorious wheel of meditative concentration is the outcaste woman.

original: re re dbye ba lnga rnams kyis te slar yang gang las aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyis phye ba'o /
analyzed: re re dbye ba lnga rnams kyis te slar yang gang las aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyis phye ba'o /
translated: Each is divided into five, and again, they are divided by the vowels and consonants.

original: 115 / so sor sdud pa lus la yul dang yul can bcu po rnams ni rab tu 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 115 / so sor sdud pa lus la yul dang yul can bcu po rnams ni rab tu 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: Withdrawal is the ten objects and subjects in the body, which are without engagement.

original: bsam gtan dag kyang shes rab rtog dang dpyod pa dga' dang g-yo med bde ba rtse gcig sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag kyang shes rab rtog dang dpyod pa dga' dang g-yo med bde ba rtse gcig sems pa'o //
translated: Meditative concentration is wisdom, which is without conception, investigation, joy, movement, and bliss, and is one-pointed mind.

original: srog gi rtsol ba dag kyang lam ni gnyis po  bskyel zhing dbu mar srog ni zhugs pa dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: srog gi rtsol ba dag kyang lam ni gnyis po  bskyel zhing dbu mar srog ni zhugs pa dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma are also the two paths, and the prƒÅ·πáa enters the central nƒÅ·∏çƒ´.

original: thig ler srog ni rab tu zhugs shing gnyis ka'i bgrod pa bcom ste rtse gcig sems pa 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: thig ler srog ni rab tu zhugs shing gnyis ka'i bgrod pa bcom ste rtse gcig sems pa 'dzin pa'o /
translated: The prƒÅ·πáa enters the bindu, and the two paths are destroyed, and the mind is held one-pointedly.

original: 116 / gtum mo'i snang bar gang zhig gyur pa nges par lus dang nam mkha' la yang rjes su dran par 'gyur //
analyzed: 116 / gtum mo'i snang bar gang zhig gyur pa nges par lus dang nam mkha' la yang rjes su dran par 'gyur //
translated: The appearance of ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ is definitely recalled in the body and in space.

original: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni 'gyur med bde ba'i dbang gis ye shes gzugs la ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni 'gyur med bde ba'i dbang gis ye shes gzugs la ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The form of gnosis is samƒÅdhi by the power of unchanging bliss through the nature of wisdom and method.

original: 'di dag dman pa la sogs dbye ba rnams kyis sna tshogs gtso bo'i sgrub thabs rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag dman pa la sogs dbye ba rnams kyis sna tshogs gtso bo'i sgrub thabs rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: These are the three types of sƒÅdhana of the principal deity, with various divisions, such as inferior and so on.

original: phyag rgya gsum dang gnas skabs gsum ni rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gi las dang kun rtog mchog rnams so /
analyzed: phyag rgya gsum dang gnas skabs gsum ni rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gi las dang kun rtog mchog rnams so /
translated: The three mudras, the three occasions, the three paths, the action of the empowerment, and the supreme imagination.

original: 117 / so sor sdud pas rnal 'byor pa ni yul dang rnam par bral ba sngags rnams kun gyis byin gyis rlob //
analyzed: 117 / so sor sdud pas rnal 'byor pa ni yul dang rnam par bral ba sngags rnams kun gyis byin gyis rlob //
translated: The yogi, by means of the withdrawal, is blessed by all the mantras, and becomes free from objects.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga ni thob par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsam gtan sbyor bas dag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga ni thob par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsam gtan sbyor bas dag pa'o //
translated: He obtains the five superknowledges, O King, by means of the purification of concentration.

original: srog gi rtsol bas dag pa ri bong can dang nyi ma dang bral byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: srog gi rtsol bas dag pa ri bong can dang nyi ma dang bral byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod //
translated: The bodhisattvas worship him, purified by the life-force, free from the moon and sun,

original: bdud dang nyon mongs la sogs nyams shing stobs bcu la ni 'jug par 'gyur te 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis so /
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs la sogs nyams shing stobs bcu la ni 'jug par 'gyur te 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis so /
translated: and he enters the ten powers, his demons and afflictions destroyed, by means of the power of retention.

original: 118 / rjes su dran pa legs par dag pa dri med 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dag kyang ye shes gzugs las so //üîΩde @69a * //
analyzed: 118 / rjes su dran pa legs par dag pa dri med 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dag kyang ye shes gzugs las so // de @69a * //
translated: The ma·πá·∏çala of stainless light, well purified by the recollections, is also from the form of gnosis.

original: nas ting nge 'dzin gyis dag pa nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis ye shes lus ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: nas ting nge 'dzin gyis dag pa nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis ye shes lus ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: Then, by means of the purification of samƒÅdhi, the gnosis body is accomplished in a few days.

original: so sor sdud pa la sogs rnams kyis gal te sngags pa rnams kyi 'dod pa grub par ma gyur na //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa la sogs rnams kyis gal te sngags pa rnams kyi 'dod pa grub par ma gyur na //
translated: If the desires of the mantrins are not accomplished by means of the withdrawal and so forth,

original: n'a da goms pas btsan thabs chu skyes su gnas rdo rje nor bur thig le bkag nas bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: n'a da goms pas btsan thabs chu skyes su gnas rdo rje nor bur thig le bkag nas bsgrub par bya /
translated: By the practice of the nada, one should accomplish the binding of the bindu in the vajra jewel, the sudden method of abiding in the lotus.

original: 119 / bsnyen pa la ni dang po'i rnal 'byor rnam bcu mkha' la 'khor lo can gyi khro bo'i lta bas so //
analyzed: 119 / bsnyen pa la ni dang po'i rnal 'byor rnam bcu mkha' la 'khor lo can gyi khro bo'i lta bas so //
translated: In the approach, the first yoga is the view of the wrathful one with the wheel in the ten directions in the sky.üîΩIn the near accomplishment, the six branches are the path of the nectar of the view of Vighnantaka.

original: bgegs mthar byed pa'i lta ba bdud rtsi'i lam du son pa yis kyang nye ba'i sgrub la yan lag drug / shes rab la spros zla ba thig le rdo rje nor bur gnas pa'i 'gyur med gsum ni sgrub pa la //
analyzed: bgegs mthar byed pa'i lta ba bdud rtsi'i lam du son pa yis kyang nye ba'i sgrub la yan lag drug / shes rab la spros zla ba thig le rdo rje nor bur gnas pa'i 'gyur med gsum ni sgrub pa la //
translated: In the accomplishment, the three immovables are the bindu of the moon of the proliferation of wisdom abiding in the vajra jewel.

original: bde ba ma nyams gcig pu zhi ba'i lhan skyes ye shes rnal 'byor 'dir ni sgrub pa chen po la /
analyzed: bde ba ma nyams gcig pu zhi ba'i lhan skyes ye shes rnal 'byor 'dir ni sgrub pa chen po la /
translated: In this yoga, the great accomplishment is the innate pristine consciousness of peace, the single taste of undiminished bliss.

original: 120 / srog gi rtsol ba kun nas bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba ji srid mgo yi bar du 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: 120 / srog gi rtsol ba kun nas bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba ji srid mgo yi bar du 'dod pa ste //
translated: The prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma bestow the result of the bliss of union as far as the head.

original: de las steng du 'dod pa ma yin 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa phung po nges par 'jig pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: de las steng du 'dod pa ma yin 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa phung po nges par 'jig pa'i rgyu //
translated: Above that, there is no desire, the cause of the destruction of the aggregates, the fear of death.

original: gtsug tor sgo ni phug nas 'gro na mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la nges par sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: gtsug tor sgo ni phug nas 'gro na mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la nges par sbyar bar bya //
translated: If one goes through the aperture of BrahmƒÅ, one is certainly joined to the state of supreme bliss.

original: phung po med kyang rnal 'byor pa ni bde mnyam 'jug ste 'on kyang 'jig rten du ni grags pa min /
analyzed: phung po med kyang rnal 'byor pa ni bde mnyam 'jug ste 'on kyang 'jig rten du ni grags pa min /
translated: The yogi enters into the bliss of the void, even though the aggregates do not exist, but this is not known in the world.

original: 121 / dbus su srog ni rab tu zhugs pa sna tshogs yum la yul dang rnam par  bral ba'i 'khyud pa ste //
analyzed: 121 / dbus su srog ni rab tu zhugs pa sna tshogs yum la yul dang rnam par  bral ba'i 'khyud pa ste //
translated: The life force enters into the middle, embracing the mother of diversity, free from objects.

original: padmar zhugs pa'i rang gi rdo rje spro ba dag kyang de bzhin zla nyi'i dbus su rab zhugs pa //
analyzed: padmar zhugs pa'i rang gi rdo rje spro ba dag kyang de bzhin zla nyi'i dbus su rab zhugs pa //
translated: The self-vajra enters into the lotus, and the emanations also enter into the middle of the moon and sun.

original: bde ba sa bon ma lhung ba la rab dga'i dga' bar gnas pa rnal 'byor rnams kyi rnal 'byor 'di //
analyzed: bde ba sa bon ma lhung ba la rab dga'i dga' bar gnas pa rnal 'byor rnams kyi rnal 'byor 'di //
translated: The yogis‚Äô yoga is the abiding in the joy of supreme joy, where the seed of bliss has not fallen.

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub don slad khyab bdag gi ni dpal ldan gsang ba las kyang mchog tu gsang ba'o /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub don slad khyab bdag gi ni dpal ldan gsang ba las kyang mchog tu gsang ba'o /
translated: This is the supreme secret from the glorious secret of the Lord for the sake of the attainment of the seal.

original: 122 / gtsug tor du ni rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te phyi rol rtse mo dag ni nyis 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: 122 / gtsug tor du ni rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te phyi rol rtse mo dag ni nyis 'gyur gyi //
translated: The vajra becomes five-pointed in the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, with twice as many external points.

original: rdo rje chos kyi 'khor lor 'gyur zhing nyis 'gyur gzhan ma dang ni de yi nyis 'gyur dag kyang gzhan //
analyzed: rdo rje chos kyi 'khor lor 'gyur zhing nyis 'gyur gzhan ma dang ni de yi nyis 'gyur dag kyang gzhan //
translated: The wheel of Vajradharma is twice that, and the other [wheels] are twice that again.

original: de yi yang ni nyis 'gyur gzhan du 'gyur te lhan skyes longs spyod rdzogs dang sbrul pa'i 'khor lor ro //
analyzed: de yi yang ni nyis 'gyur gzhan du 'gyur te lhan skyes longs spyod rdzogs dang sbrul pa'i 'khor lor ro //
translated: And again, the other [wheels] are twice that, the innate wheel of enjoyment and the wheel of emanation.

original: de yi snying por rtse mo gcig pa bde mnyam 'bras ster gsang ba'i padma'i khongs su gnas pa'o /
analyzed: de yi snying por rtse mo gcig pa bde mnyam 'bras ster gsang ba'i padma'i khongs su gnas pa'o /
translated: In the center of that, abiding in the secret lotus, is the single peak that bestows the fruit of the bliss of equality.

original: 123 / rnal 'byor pa yis nyin dang mtshan mor srog gcod pa dag bya ba de ni srog nyams @69b par gsungs te //
analyzed: 123 / rnal 'byor pa yis nyin dang mtshan mor srog gcod pa dag bya ba de ni srog nyams @69b par gsungs te //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ should kill life day and night, which is said to be the life-force.

original: sgra ni gang zhig zhal gyis dman pa dag kyang snying la gyur pa de ni brdzun du smra ba nyid //
analyzed: sgra ni gang zhig zhal gyis dman pa dag kyang snying la gyur pa de ni brdzun du smra ba nyid //
translated: The sound that is in the heart of those who are inferior is said to be lying.

original: gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sa ni 'dzin pa dag kyang rnal 'byor pa yis brku bar gsungs //
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sa ni 'dzin pa dag kyang rnal 'byor pa yis brku bar gsungs //
translated: That which holds the stage of omniscient wisdom is said to be stolen by the yogi/nƒ´.

original: thig le ma lhung ba las bde bar 'gyur ba chags bral min las gzhan gyi bud med bsten pa'o /
analyzed: thig le ma lhung ba las bde bar 'gyur ba chags bral min las gzhan gyi bud med bsten pa'o /
translated: The bliss that comes from not letting the bindu fall is relying on another's wife, not from being free of desire.

original: 124 / srog gi rtsol ba'i me yis ri bong can ni zhu ba dag kyang btung ba chang ni 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: 124 / srog gi rtsol ba'i me yis ri bong can ni zhu ba dag kyang btung ba chang ni 'thung ba'o //
translated: The moon melts by the fire of the life-force, and one drinks the wine.

original: mthe bo'i tshigs nas gtsug tor dag tu nya yi mthar ni rang sems 'gro ste tshes kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: mthe bo'i tshigs nas gtsug tor dag tu nya yi mthar ni rang sems 'gro ste tshes kyi dbang gis so //
translated: One‚Äôs mind goes from the joint of the thumb to the crown, to the end of the fish, by the power of the lunar day.

original: gtsug tor nas ni sor mo rnams su slar yang 'di nyid 'gro ste nag po'i phyogs kyi mtha' ru'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor nas ni sor mo rnams su slar yang 'di nyid 'gro ste nag po'i phyogs kyi mtha' ru'o //
translated: From the crown, it goes again to the fingers, to the end of the dark lunar day.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams spyod pa gang de nyin zhag so so'i dus su 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab ster ba /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams spyod pa gang de nyin zhag so so'i dus su 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab ster ba /
translated: That conduct of the yogis bestows the desired powers in each daily period.üîΩFever, vomiting, dry lotus, lack of appetite, trembling, insanity, and confusion, mental delusion, and fainting‚ÄîüîΩthese ten clear signs of smoke and so on of the vajri

original: 125 / bsam dang 'dod dang lus la rims dang kha mchog padma skam dang zas la rab tu mi 'jug dang // 'dar dang smyo dang rab tu rmongs par 'gyur dang yid ni rnam par 'khrul dang drag tu brgyal ba dag / rdo rje can gyi du ba la sogs rab gsal rnam pa bcu ste srog chags lus la 'jig rten du //
analyzed: 125 / bsam dang 'dod dang lus la rims dang kha mchog padma skam dang zas la rab tu mi 'jug dang // 'dar dang smyo dang rab tu rmongs par 'gyur dang yid ni rnam par 'khrul dang drag tu brgyal ba dag / rdo rje can gyi du ba la sogs rab gsal rnam pa bcu ste srog chags lus la 'jig rten du //
translated: are in the body of the living being in the world.

original: rab tu gsal zhing nges pa de rnams yid srubs gnas skabs su zhig rgyal ba 'dod pa de ni su ;
analyzed: rab tu gsal zhing nges pa de rnams yid srubs gnas skabs su zhig rgyal ba 'dod pa de ni su ;
translated: Who is he who desires to conquer the fleeting moments of the mind, so clear and certain?

original: 126 / nyin dang mtshan mor thig le dag las dkar po'i rgyun 'bab gang zhig m'a ma k'i ste chang ma yin //
analyzed: 126 / nyin dang mtshan mor thig le dag las dkar po'i rgyun 'bab gang zhig m'a ma k'i ste chang ma yin //
translated: Day and night, from the drops flows a stream of white, not the wine of MƒÅmakƒ´.

original: go ku la sogs mig la sogs pa nyin zhag so sor spro ste sha gzhan res 'ga' dag kyang min //
analyzed: go ku la sogs mig la sogs pa nyin zhag so sor spro ste sha gzhan res 'ga' dag kyang min //
translated: The flesh of cow and so on is the eye and so on, which is emitted daily, not some other flesh occasionally.

original: rang rigs sa la gnas pa'i lha rnams dag gis dag pa'i lus la bdud rtsi lnga rnams bsnyen pa ste //
analyzed: rang rigs sa la gnas pa'i lha rnams dag gis dag pa'i lus la bdud rtsi lnga rnams bsnyen pa ste //
translated: The gods who dwell on the stage of their own family worship the pure body with the five nectars.

original: stong par sems ni rab tu zhugs pas ro mnyam byed pa 'khrig pa de ni skye gnas la ma yin /
analyzed: stong par sems ni rab tu zhugs pas ro mnyam byed pa 'khrig pa de ni skye gnas la ma yin /
translated: The union that makes the mind enter into emptiness, making it of equal taste, is not a birth-producing intercourse.

original: 127 / nor ni gtong ba sbyin pa yid dang bud med 'grogs pa las kyang 'pho ba med pa tshul khrims te //
analyzed: 127 / nor ni gtong ba sbyin pa yid dang bud med 'grogs pa las kyang 'pho ba med pa tshul khrims te //
translated: Giving wealth is generosity; the mind‚Äôs union with a woman is also the non-emission of semen, which is morality.

original: bzod pa sgra la sogs pa mi 'jug pa ste rlung gi gnyi ga'i bgrod pa 'jig pa brtson 'grus nyid //
analyzed: bzod pa sgra la sogs pa mi 'jug pa ste rlung gi gnyi ga'i bgrod pa 'jig pa brtson 'grus nyid //
translated: Patience is the non-engagement with sound and so on; the destruction of the path of both winds is diligence.

original: bsam gtan shes rab dag kyang lhan skyes bde la gnas pa'i sems dang kun tu 'gro ba kun gyi skad //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab dag kyang lhan skyes bde la gnas pa'i sems dang kun tu 'gro ba kun gyi skad //
translated: The concentrations and the wisdoms are the mind abiding in the innate bliss and the language of all the all-pervading ones.

original: de las sems can don dang rdzu 'phrul srid pa mthar byed mi skye 'thob ste gzhan pa bzhi rnams so /
analyzed: de las sems can don dang rdzu 'phrul srid pa mthar byed mi skye 'thob ste gzhan pa bzhi rnams so /
translated: From that, the aims of sentient beings, the magical powers, the end of existence, and the attainment of non-arising are the other four.

original: 128 / @70a * //  gcig pu'i sku ni nus pa dang ldan gnas dgu dang bcas nyi shu lnga yi bdag nyid la sogs pa //
analyzed: 128 / @70a * //  gcig pu'i sku ni nus pa dang ldan gnas dgu dang bcas nyi shu lnga yi bdag nyid la sogs pa //
translated: The body of the sole hero, endowed with power, with the nine abodes, the nature of the twenty-five, and so on,

original: bsgoms na phyag rgya la sogs grub pa rnams su nges par nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis yang dag 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgoms na phyag rgya la sogs grub pa rnams su nges par nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis yang dag 'gyur //
translated: when meditated upon, will certainly be accomplished in a few days in the accomplishments of the seal, and so on.

original: rengs pa dang ni zhi dang dbang dang srid pa 'jig pa dag ni zhal gyi dbye ba rnams kyis byed //
analyzed: rengs pa dang ni zhi dang dbang dang srid pa 'jig pa dag ni zhal gyi dbye ba rnams kyis byed //
translated: Paralysis, pacification, power, and the destruction of existence are done with the divisions of the faces.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas lha min lag 'gro'i rigs 'di bsgoms pa yis ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas lha min lag 'gro'i rigs 'di bsgoms pa yis ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: This family of demigods and migrating beings abiding in the ma·πá·∏çala of the elements should be accomplished by meditation.

original: 129 / dkar po yis ni zhi dang rgyas pa byed de rang gi yid la dmar po yis ni dgug dang dbang //
analyzed: 129 / dkar po yis ni zhi dang rgyas pa byed de rang gi yid la dmar po yis ni dgug dang dbang //
translated: With the white, one should perform pacification and increase; with the red, one should summon and control with one‚Äôs mind;

original: ser pos rengs dang rmongs pa dag ste nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pas gsad pa dang ni bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: ser pos rengs dang rmongs pa dag ste nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pas gsad pa dang ni bskrad pa'o //
translated: The yellow one paralyzes and confuses, and the black one kills and expels, like a black cloud.

original: bsgom dang bzlas pa de bzhin nyid du rang gi yid la byed de sku gsung thugs dang rdo rje ni //
analyzed: bsgom dang bzlas pa de bzhin nyid du rang gi yid la byed de sku gsung thugs dang rdo rje ni //
translated: One should visualize the mantra-circle in the heart, and the deity in the heart, and one should do the meditation and recitation in the same way, with one's mind.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag las kyi dbye bas bsgrub bar bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag las kyi dbye bas bsgrub bar bya /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is in the ma·πá·∏çala of the elements, and one should accomplish the entire triple world by the division of action.

original: 130 / phyogs ni lhag pa las byung bung ba dang ni gser dang mtshungs pa g-yas dang cig shos dag gis ni //üîΩphung po'i bdud la glang chen pags pa dag kyang ma lus bshus te rkang pa zung zhig dag nas 'dzin //
analyzed: 130 / phyogs ni lhag pa las byung bung ba dang ni gser dang mtshungs pa g-yas dang cig shos dag gis ni // phung po'i bdud la glang chen pags pa dag kyang ma lus bshus te rkang pa zung zhig dag nas 'dzin //
translated: The bee-like and gold-like directions arise from the excess, and with the right and left handsüîΩone should tear off the elephant hide of the demon of the aggregates and hold it with both hands.üîΩThe supreme skull of the blood of the lord of the demigods is in the palm of the hand, and the face of the demon of death is in the hand,

original: lha min dbang po'i khrag gi thod pa rab mchog phyag mthil na ste 'chi bdag bdud kyi gdong gi phyag / nyon mongs bdud ni zhabs kyis bsgyel ba gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ni gzhan gyi don du bsgom par bya /
analyzed: lha min dbang po'i khrag gi thod pa rab mchog phyag mthil na ste 'chi bdag bdud kyi gdong gi phyag / nyon mongs bdud ni zhabs kyis bsgyel ba gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ni gzhan gyi don du bsgom par bya /
translated: and the demon of afflictions is overthrown by the foot. The two remaining hands of the Victorious One should be visualized for the sake of others.

original: 131 / de la yum ni zhal gcig zung gi phyag gi padma dag la gri gug dpal ldan thod pa ste //
analyzed: 131 / de la yum ni zhal gcig zung gi phyag gi padma dag la gri gug dpal ldan thod pa ste //
translated: The Mother has one face and two arms, holding a curved knife and a glorious skull.

original: nyi ma las ni zla bas rang gi rgyu ba bcu gnyis lhag pa'i gcig rgyu bgrod pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: nyi ma las ni zla bas rang gi rgyu ba bcu gnyis lhag pa'i gcig rgyu bgrod pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: The moon, from the sun, moves in its own orbit, one orbit more than twelve, by the power of traversing.

original: de phyir lus kyi rab tu dbye bas rgyal ba'i bdag por 'gyur te sna tshogs yum ni de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: de phyir lus kyi rab tu dbye bas rgyal ba'i bdag por 'gyur te sna tshogs yum ni de bzhin nyid //
translated: Therefore, by the division of the body, one becomes the Lord of Victors, the Mother of the Variety of Suchness.

original: shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pa bde mnyam 'bras ster zla ba nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu bas so /
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi lus dang bsam pa bde mnyam 'bras ster zla ba nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu bas so /
translated: Wisdom and means, the body, the intention, bestowing the fruit of the equality of bliss, by the movement of the moon and sun.

original: 132 / gcig la sogs pa mtha' yas zhal te phyag dang zhabs mang du ma'i kha dog mun pa dag gi mthar //
analyzed: 132 / gcig la sogs pa mtha' yas zhal te phyag dang zhabs mang du ma'i kha dog mun pa dag gi mthar //
translated: One face, etc., infinite faces, many arms and feet, many colors, to the end of the darkness,

original: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid nges par bde mnyam ster te rtsa ni zla ba nyi ma 'gog pa las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid nges par bde mnyam ster te rtsa ni zla ba nyi ma 'gog pa las //
translated: the nature of wisdom and means, definitely bestowing the equality of bliss, from the cessation of the channels, moon and sun.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams ni kun nas 'bigs byed dri med nor bu dang mtshungs stong pa gcig pu ste //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams ni kun nas 'bigs byed dri med nor bu dang mtshungs stong pa gcig pu ste //
translated: Earth, etc., are completely pierced, like a stainless jewel, empty, alone.

original: thog ma med cing mtha' med dbus @70b kyang med la yul med yul ni bsgrubs pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o /
analyzed: thog ma med cing mtha' med dbus @70b kyang med la yul med yul ni bsgrubs pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o /
translated: Without beginning, without end, without middle, without object, the object is the Wheel of Time.

original: 133 / khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs ni gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang rig byed zhal dang zhabs gnyis pa //
analyzed: 133 / khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs ni gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang rig byed zhal dang zhabs gnyis pa //
translated: The powerful lord of wrath, Vajravega, has more than the hands of a victor, has faces and feet,

original: dmar ser spyan dang dbu skra dmar ser rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa ste //
analyzed: dmar ser spyan dang dbu skra dmar ser rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa ste //
translated: red-orange eyes and red-orange hair, the diadem of the lord of victors, sharp fangs bared.üîΩAdorned with snakes, with the best of tiger-skin skirts, with weapons in his hands like the principal one,

original: sbrul gyi rgyan dang rab mchog stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs dang ni gtso bo'i bzhin du mtshon cha'i phyag / spyi bor mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs kyi thod pa kha dog lnga rnams dag gis phreng ba nges par bcings /
analyzed: sbrul gyi rgyan dang rab mchog stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs dang ni gtso bo'i bzhin du mtshon cha'i phyag / spyi bor mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs kyi thod pa kha dog lnga rnams dag gis phreng ba nges par bcings /
translated: on his head a garland of the skulls of the families of all victors, five colors,

original: 134 / dri med 'od zer 'phro ba sna tshogs chu skyes nyi ma'i steng du dkyil 'khor sna tshogs mdog la ni //
analyzed: 134 / dri med 'od zer 'phro ba sna tshogs chu skyes nyi ma'i steng du dkyil 'khor sna tshogs mdog la ni //
translated: on a multicolored lotus and sun, the chief of the mandala, radiant with stainless light rays.

original: zhabs gnyis dag gis 'byung po'i mgon po lhag pa'i stobs kyis mnan cing g-yas brkyang stabs kyis yang dag gnas //
analyzed: zhabs gnyis dag gis 'byung po'i mgon po lhag pa'i stobs kyis mnan cing g-yas brkyang stabs kyis yang dag gnas //
translated: He stands with two legs, trampling on the lord of spirits, Balahaka, in the extended posture.

original: 'byung po rnams dang lha min gdengs can lha rnams skrag par byed cing ye shes sems dpa' gcig gyur pa //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams dang lha min gdengs can lha rnams skrag par byed cing ye shes sems dpa' gcig gyur pa //
translated: He terrifies the spirits, demigods, and gods, and is one with the wisdom being.

original: bsgoms na zla ba gcig nyid kho nas dur khrod sa la gnas pa 'byung po'i tshogs ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: bsgoms na zla ba gcig nyid kho nas dur khrod sa la gnas pa 'byung po'i tshogs ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: If meditated upon, in just one month, dwelling in a charnel ground, the host of spirits will be accomplished.

original: 135 / klu rnams chu skyes 'dab brgyad la ste rgyal dang rnam rgyal dag ni nyi ma'i steng du bsgyel byas nas //
analyzed: 135 / klu rnams chu skyes 'dab brgyad la ste rgyal dang rnam rgyal dag ni nyi ma'i steng du bsgyel byas nas //
translated: The nagas are on an eight-petaled lotus, and Jaya and Vijaya are overturned on the sun.

original: zhabs dag gis ni gdengs can bdag po zung dang padma'i 'dab mar gnas pa rnams kyis mjug ma yi //
analyzed: zhabs dag gis ni gdengs can bdag po zung dang padma'i 'dab mar gnas pa rnams kyis mjug ma yi //
translated: With his legs, he tramples on the lord of the nagas, Ananta, who is on a lotus petal, with his tail

original: rtse mo thams cad mnan nas sprin gyi rigs ni lto ba dag nas nges par kun tu spro byed pa //
analyzed: rtse mo thams cad mnan nas sprin gyi rigs ni lto ba dag nas nges par kun tu spro byed pa //
translated: raised up, and all the clouds are definitely emitted from his belly.

original: de ltar khro bo'i dbang po bsgoms pas nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis sprin gyi tshogs ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: de ltar khro bo'i dbang po bsgoms pas nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis sprin gyi tshogs ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: In this way, by meditating on the Lord of Wrath, one should accomplish the mass of clouds in a few days.

original: 136 / zhes pa la sogs mi yi bdag po lha rnams dang ni lha mo rnams kyi sgrub thabs so so ru //
analyzed: 136 / zhes pa la sogs mi yi bdag po lha rnams dang ni lha mo rnams kyi sgrub thabs so so ru //
translated: This is the means of achieving the gods and goddesses, O Lord of Men, in their individual rites.

original: dkyil 'khor 'dir ni rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis las kyi dbye ba mtha' dag rnams kyis 'gyur //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dir ni rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis las kyi dbye ba mtha' dag rnams kyis 'gyur //
translated: In this mandala, by the power of one's own buddha family, all the divisions of action occur.

original: rengs dang zhi  ba dag dang dbang dang gzhan nor 'phrog dang gsad pa dang ni bskrad pa dag la yang //
analyzed: rengs dang zhi  ba dag dang dbang dang gzhan nor 'phrog dang gsad pa dang ni bskrad pa dag la yang //
translated: For immobilization, pacification, subjugation, stealing the wealth of others, killing, and banishing,

original: sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams 'gyur te slar yang bzlas dang sbyin sreg rang gi sa bon gyis /üîΩ137 / zhi ba la ni bsam gtan dag kyang zhi ba ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar lha ni zhi ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams 'gyur te slar yang bzlas dang sbyin sreg rang gi sa bon gyis / 137 / zhi ba la ni bsam gtan dag kyang zhi ba ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar lha ni zhi ba'i gzugs //
translated: the yoginƒ´s of the thirty-six [channels] transform, and again through recitation and fire sacrifice with one's own seed syllable.üîΩFor pacification, the meditations are also peaceful, white like the moon, with the form of peaceful deities.

original: drag po la yang bsam gtan drag po dang ni sprin nag dang mtshungs lha rnams drag po nyid kyi gzugs //
analyzed: drag po la yang bsam gtan drag po dang ni sprin nag dang mtshungs lha rnams drag po nyid kyi gzugs //
translated: For wrathful [rites], the meditations are wrathful, like dark clouds, with the forms of wrathful deities.

original: dbang @71a * //
analyzed: dbang @71a * //
translated: EmpowermentüîΩ

original: du bya la bsam gtan chags pa dang bcas nyin mor byed pa'i sku ste lhan chags pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: du bya la bsam gtan chags pa dang bcas nyin mor byed pa'i sku ste lhan chags pa'i gzugs //
translated: 10. For subjugation, the contemplation is one of passion, and the form is that of the sun, the body of the passionate one.

original: rengs pa la ni bsam gtan rmongs pa dang bcas mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa'i lha rnams rengs pa'i gzugs /
analyzed: rengs pa la ni bsam gtan rmongs pa dang bcas mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa'i lha rnams rengs pa'i gzugs /
translated: 11. For paralyzing, the contemplation is one of delusion, and the form is that of the gods, who are like the finest gold, the form of the paralyzing one.

original: 138 / zhi dang rgyas pa dag kyang sras bcas rgyal ba'i rigs dang rgyal po lha mo rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 138 / zhi dang rgyas pa dag kyang sras bcas rgyal ba'i rigs dang rgyal po lha mo rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: 12. For pacification and increase, the accomplishment is by the family of the Victorious Ones, with their sons, and by the kings and goddesses.

original: dbye dang bskrad pa dag kyang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khro bo las skyes rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbye dang bskrad pa dag kyang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khro bo las skyes rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: 13. For separation and banishment, the accomplishment is by those born of the wrathful ones, by the power of their natural qualities.

original: dbang sogs 'byung skyes rnams kyis rab gsal lha min rigs la phur bus gdab pa'ang lha min mo rnams kyis //
analyzed: dbang sogs 'byung skyes rnams kyis rab gsal lha min rigs la phur bus gdab pa'ang lha min mo rnams kyis //
translated: 14. For subjugation, etc., born of the elements, the clear ones, and for the stake-driving, by the demonesses of the demon family.

original: yum dag gis ni las rnams thams cad gnyi ga'i rdo rje'i rigs la gsad pa dang ni gso ba yang /
analyzed: yum dag gis ni las rnams thams cad gnyi ga'i rdo rje'i rigs la gsad pa dang ni gso ba yang /
translated: 15. For all the actions, by the mothers, and for killing and reviving, by the Vajra family of both.

original: 139 / dang por dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo dang ni srid gsum skyed ma 'bad pa yis ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: 139 / dang por dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo dang ni srid gsum skyed ma 'bad pa yis ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: First, one should strive to accomplish the glorious Wheel of Time and the creator of the three worlds.

original: de nas sa gzhi'i gnas dag tu ni gang zhig zhi ba la sogs las rnams dag kyang bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de nas sa gzhi'i gnas dag tu ni gang zhig zhi ba la sogs las rnams dag kyang bsgrub par bya //
translated: Then, in the places of the earth, one should accomplish the rites of pacification and so forth.

original: pha dang ma yis rnam par dman pa'i bu ni yod pa min par dus kun tu ni 'jig rten grags //
analyzed: pha dang ma yis rnam par dman pa'i bu ni yod pa min par dus kun tu ni 'jig rten grags //
translated: A son who is devoid of father and mother is not known in the world at any time.

original: de phyir bde mnyam 'bras ster gnyis po bsgrub par bya ste rnam pa gzhan du las ni 'grub pa min /
analyzed: de phyir bde mnyam 'bras ster gnyis po bsgrub par bya ste rnam pa gzhan du las ni 'grub pa min /
translated: Therefore, one should accomplish the two that bestow the fruit of the bliss of equality; otherwise, the rite is not accomplished.

original: 140 / gtso bo'i thugs khar padma'i dbus su ri bong can dang nyi ma me yi steng du rdo rje ni //
analyzed: 140 / gtso bo'i thugs khar padma'i dbus su ri bong can dang nyi ma me yi steng du rdo rje ni //
translated: In the heart of the principal one, in the middle of a lotus, on the moon, sun, and fire, is a five-pronged vajra

original: h'um yig ye shes las skyes 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa rtse lnga 'od zer dang bcas dgod par bya //
analyzed: h'um yig ye shes las skyes 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa rtse lnga 'od zer dang bcas dgod par bya //
translated: arisen from the syllable h≈´·πÉ, with light rays like the cloud at the time of destruction, and blazing.

original: de yi dbus su dza: yi lcags kyu'i 'od zer rnams kyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag bkang byas nas //
analyzed: de yi dbus su dza: yi lcags kyu'i 'od zer rnams kyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag bkang byas nas //
translated: In its middle, with the hook of the syllable j·∏•·∏•, one should fill the entire triple world with light rays.

original: rnam gsum srid pa la gnas ye shes 'khor lo bkug nas rdo rje'i lam du rab tu gzhug bya ste /
analyzed: rnam gsum srid pa la gnas ye shes 'khor lo bkug nas rdo rje'i lam du rab tu gzhug bya ste /

original: 141 / thams cad zla ba zhu ba dang mtshungs rang gi rdo rje'i kha nas yum gyi padmar spro bar bya //
analyzed: 141 / thams cad zla ba zhu ba dang mtshungs rang gi rdo rje'i kha nas yum gyi padmar spro bar bya //

original: de ni nyi mar rab tu zhugs pa ro mnyam dag tu 'gyur te aa sogs ka sogs rab ldan pa //
analyzed: de ni nyi mar rab tu zhugs pa ro mnyam dag tu 'gyur te aa sogs ka sogs rab ldan pa //

analyzed: de yi dbus su zhi ba la sogs las kyi ye shes sa bon du 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis so //

analyzed: de yis rdzogs pa'i lha mo 'am ni lha yang rnal 'byor pa la 'bras bu ster ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: By that, the perfected goddess or god will grant the fruit to the yogi/nƒ´.

original: 142 / dza: h'um bam ho: rim pas lcags kyu zhes dang rdo rje dang ni rdo rje zhags pa dril bu ste //
analyzed: 142 / dza: h'um bam ho: rim pas lcags kyu zhes dang rdo rje dang ni rdo rje zhags pa dril bu ste //
translated: Ja·∏• h≈´·πÉ va·πÉ ho·∏•, in due order, are the hook, the vajra, the vajra chain, and the bell.

analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho: de bzhin du @71b gsungs zla ba nyi ma rdo rje de bzhin nyid du 'gyur med do //
translated: Om ƒÅ·∏• h≈´·πÉ ho·∏•, likewise, are the moon, the sun, the vajra, and suchness, which is unchanging.

original: a'i r'i a'u l'i de bzhin nyid du rab gsal ya ra wa la rlung me chu dang sa rnams so //
analyzed: a'i r'i a'u l'i de bzhin nyid du rab gsal ya ra wa la rlung me chu dang sa rnams so //
translated: The vowels are the wind, fire, water, and earth, and the consonants are their true nature, clearly manifest.

analyzed: ha: h'um ham phrem nyi ma dang ni rdo rje zla ba dag dang gri gug tu yang de bzhin gsungs /
translated: Ha, ha, ha, ha, and k·π£a are the sun, the vajra, the moon, and the flaying knife, respectively.

original: 143 / zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su a'a li k'a li dang bcas chu yi sa bon bdag nyid chu skyes te //
analyzed: 143 / zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su a'a li k'a li dang bcas chu yi sa bon bdag nyid chu skyes te //

analyzed: de las rdzogs pa'i lha mo zla ba'i mdog can zhal gcig ma ste zung gi phyag gi padma can //
translated: From that, the perfect goddess, the color of the moon, with one face and two arms, holding a lotus,üîΩmounted on a white elephant, holding a white lotus and the boon of fearlessness, wearing white garments,

analyzed: 144 / de nas bsgrub bya bzung nas slar yang khyab bdag dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab tu gzhug par bya'o //

analyzed: gtso bo'i bka' ni rab tu thob nas spyan ma la sogs rab dgyes rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i bum pa yis //

analyzed: bsgrub bya de ni bkru bar byed cing rab mchog rnam pa bcu yi nus ma rnams kyis mchod par byed //

analyzed: 145 /'byung por grags pa rnams kyis 'jigs pa med byed rab mchog rnam bcu khro skyes rnams kyis skyong bar byed //

analyzed: klu mo rnams kyis 'o dag byed cing 'chi med na chung bcu gnyis rnams kyis 'khyud pa dag tu byed //

analyzed: gtum mo rnams kyis bsrung ba byed de mtha' dag sa gzhi dag la zhi rgyas don gyi slad du'o //
translated: The ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ women protect him, for the sake of the goal of pacifying and prospering on the entire earth.

analyzed: de ltar bsgrub bya yi ni mchog gi bde ba byed pa thams cad rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /

analyzed: 146 / zla ba nyi ma'i dbus su hr'i: ste autpala kha ma bye ba'i mda' nyid dang ni ai kshu'i gzhu //

analyzed: de las rdzogs pa nyi ma ltar gsal phyag ni gnyi gas gzhu dang mda' ni rna ba'i bar du bkang //

analyzed: padma dang ni ri bong 'dzin par g-yon brkyang rta la zhon pa bsgrub bya'i khyim du bskul bar bya //
translated: Mounted on a horse, with left leg extended, he should be urged to the house of the one to be subdued, holding a lotus and a rabbit.

analyzed: bsgrub bya yi ni snying ga lte ba gsang ba dag dang mgo dang kha la mda' yis bsnun byas shing /

analyzed: 147 / mgrin par gzhu yis bcings nas de yis bskyod pa dag kyang dkyil 'khor du ni khrid @72a * // par byed pa ste //
translated: and bound at the throat with the bow. Shaken by him, he is led to the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: gtum mo rnams kyis gos dang bral ba byas shing klu mo rnams kyis kyang ni nges par bkri ba byas //
analyzed: gtum mo rnams kyis gos dang bral ba byas shing klu mo rnams kyis kyang ni nges par bkri ba byas //
translated: The cƒÅ·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´s make him naked, and the nƒÅgƒ´s lead him.

analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis spyo bar byed cing khro skyes rnams kyis gtun shing dbyug par bcas pa dag gis bsnun //
