analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyis 'jigs par byed cing sgeg mo la sogs rnams kyis kyang ni sen mo rnon po 'debs /
translated: The bh≈´tas terrify them, and the ladies such as Rati pierce them with sharp nails.

original: 148 / rdo rje ma rnams kyis ni blo gros nyams byas sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung rnams dag gis bcings //
analyzed: 148 / rdo rje ma rnams kyis ni blo gros nyams byas sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung rnams dag gis bcings //

analyzed: nus ma rnams kyis gos bral rgyags pa mtha' dag bcom zhing gtso bo yin zhabs la ltung bar byas //

analyzed: de ltar dbang du byas nas slar yang khyab bdag dag gis tshim par byas te der ni bsgrub par bya //

original: de bzhin zhags pa lcags kyu dag gis khams gsum po nas dgug pa'i las ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin zhags pa lcags kyu dag gis khams gsum po nas dgug pa'i las ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, there are many types of summoning rites from the three realms with the noose and the goad.

analyzed: 149 / nyi ma zla ba'i dbus su sprin nag dang mtshungs h'um yig ring po las skyes ral gri bsgoms byas nas /

analyzed: bsgrub bya zhags pas bcing ba byas nas khros pa'i zhal gyis dkyil 'khor gyi ni sgo ru khrid byas te /

analyzed: 150 / ya: yig las skyes rnga mo mgyogs pa rlung ltar bgrod pa de la gtso bo'i gsung gis bsgrub bya ni //

analyzed: zhon pa rtse mo can dang g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor ji srid nyid du rang bzhin gyis ni bskul bar bya //

analyzed: de ltar lha yi bdag po dag kyang nges par bskrad par 'gyur na mi rnams dag ni smos ci dgos //

analyzed: 151 / nyi zla'i dbus su la: zhes bya ba yongs gyur 'khor lo bzang po kha dog ser po bsgoms byas nas //
translated: In the middle of the sun and moon, the syllable A, transformed into an excellent wheel, yellow in color, is visualized.üîΩ

analyzed: rus sbal la ni lha min gdan gyis gnas shing shin tu dal 'gro bsgrub bya'i khyim du bskul bar bya //
translated: He stands on the back of a tortoise, on a seat of demons, and moves very slowly. He is urged to the house of the one to be subdued.

analyzed: de yi steng du bsgrub bya'i lus la lhun po mchog gi gser gyi rang bzhin dgod bya rengs la ste //

analyzed: phur bus gdab pa'i don du tshigs drug la ni rdo rje'i rang bzhin phur bu rnams kyis gdab par bya //

analyzed: rmongs pa la yang sbrul rnams kyis ni kun tu za bar byed cing sa la 'gyel bar bsgom par bya /

analyzed: 153 / nyi ma zla ba'i dbus su dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i gri gug phrem gyi rang bzhin bsgoms byas nas //

analyzed: de las byung ba'i rab tu gtum mo 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa phyag na gri gug thod pa can //

analyzed: bsgrub bya'i skra rnams dag las myur  du bzung zhing de yis dkyil 'khor du ni gos kyis dman pa yang /
translated: Having quickly seized the hair of the one to be subjugated, with that one, who is lacking clothing in the ma·πá·∏çala,

original: 154 / kun tu khrid de dpal ldan dur khrod dag tu rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis bya rgod bya rog dang // ce spyang rnams kyis bsgrub bya'i yan lag kun las khrag 'thungs sha dang de bzhin du ni khams kun zos //
analyzed: 154 / kun tu khrid de dpal ldan dur khrod dag tu rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis bya rgod bya rog dang // ce spyang rnams kyis bsgrub bya'i yan lag kun las khrag 'thungs sha dang de bzhin du ni khams kun zos //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving led them all to the glorious charnel grounds, the Lord of Victors commands the vultures, crows, and jackals to drink the blood from all the limbs of the victim and to eat the flesh and all the organs.

original: de ltar ma lus pa ni rab mchog sa yi gzhi la bsgom par bya ste gsad pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma lus pa ni rab mchog sa yi gzhi la bsgom par bya ste gsad pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, having killed them all, one should meditate on the supreme ground.

original: bsam gtan 'di yis brgya byin dag kyang gshin rje'i grong khyer 'gro na mngal nas skyes pa smos ci dgos /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'di yis brgya byin dag kyang gshin rje'i grong khyer 'gro na mngal nas skyes pa smos ci dgos /
translated: By this meditation even Indra goes to the city of the Lord of Death, not to mention one born from a womb.

original: 155 / zhi dang rgyas pa la yang rigs kyi dbang gis chu yi sa bon las ni bsam gtan dkar por 'gyur //
analyzed: 155 / zhi dang rgyas pa la yang rigs kyi dbang gis chu yi sa bon las ni bsam gtan dkar por 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of pacification and increase, the seed of water becomes the white meditation by the power of the family.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la yang dmar po lus ni sreg par byed pa me yi sa bon bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la yang dmar po lus ni sreg par byed pa me yi sa bon bdag nyid do //
translated: In the case of enthrallment and summoning, it becomes the red body, the seed of fire that burns the body.

original: dbye ba dang ni bskrad pa la yang 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa rlung gi sa bon bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dbye ba dang ni bskrad pa la yang 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa rlung gi sa bon bdag nyid do //
translated: In the case of separating and expelling, it becomes the seed of wind, like the cloud at the time of destruction.üîΩ‚Äú

original: rengs pa rnams ni phur bus gdab ba sogs la gser zhun dang mtshungs sa yi sa bon rang bzhin no /
analyzed: rengs pa rnams ni phur bus gdab ba sogs la gser zhun dang mtshungs sa yi sa bon rang bzhin no /
translated: The seed of earth is similar to gold in the case of paralyzing, and so on.

original: 156 / stong pa'i sa bon las ni sngon po'i mdog dang ljang gur 'gyur te gsad dang gso ba dag la'o //
analyzed: 156 / stong pa'i sa bon las ni sngon po'i mdog dang ljang gur 'gyur te gsad dang gso ba dag la'o //
translated: The seed of space is blue or green in color in the case of killing and reviving.

original: sa yi zad par kun nas chu yi gter du 'gro ba la ste rlung gi zad par char pa ni //
analyzed: sa yi zad par kun nas chu yi gter du 'gro ba la ste rlung gi zad par char pa ni //
translated: The exhaustion of earth is the exhaustion of water, which is the exhaustion of rain.

original: nyams pa'i don te me yi zad par dag kyang sa yi dkyil 'khor bzhu ba'i don te me dag kyang //
analyzed: nyams pa'i don te me yi zad par dag kyang sa yi dkyil 'khor bzhu ba'i don te me dag kyang //
translated: The exhaustion of fire is the exhaustion of earth, which is the melting of the ma·πá·∏çala of earth.

original: nyams pa'i don du chu yi zad par du 'gyur stong pa'i @73a * //
analyzed: nyams pa'i don du chu yi zad par du 'gyur stong pa'i @73a * //
translated: The exhaustion of water is the exhaustion of fire, which is the exhaustion of water.

original: zad par mkha' la 'gro dang snang min la /üîΩ157 / glang po'i bdag po gzhom pa la ni me yi sa bon nyid las gdong lnga pa yi bsam gtan 'gyur //
analyzed: zad par mkha' la 'gro dang snang min la / 157 / glang po'i bdag po gzhom pa la ni me yi sa bon nyid las gdong lnga pa yi bsam gtan 'gyur //
translated: The exhaustion of space is the exhaustion of air, which is the exhaustion of space.üîΩIn order to destroy the lord of elephants, the meditation of the five faces arises from the seed of fire.

original: klu yi dbang po gzhom pa la ni mkha' lding dkar po chu yi sa bon bdag nyid can du 'gyur //
analyzed: klu yi dbang po gzhom pa la ni mkha' lding dkar po chu yi sa bon bdag nyid can du 'gyur //
translated: In order to destroy the lord of nƒÅgas, the white garu·∏ça arises from the seed of water.

original: bse dang seng ge dag la rkang brgyad 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa rlung gi sa bon bdag nyid can //
analyzed: bse dang seng ge dag la rkang brgyad 'jig dus sprin dang mtshungs pa rlung gi sa bon bdag nyid can //
translated: The elephant and the lion, the eight-footed one, is the time of destruction, like a cloud, the seed of wind.

original: rta yi dgra la bse zhes grags pa sa yi rigs kyi dbang gis lha min gzhom la khro bo skyes /
analyzed: rta yi dgra la bse zhes grags pa sa yi rigs kyi dbang gis lha min gzhom la khro bo skyes /
translated: The enemy of the horse, known as the elephant, is born of the family of the earth, angry to destroy the demigods.

original: 158 / khyab bdag gi ni dpal ldan sngags dang sangs rgyas gzugs kyang rnal 'byor pa yis dang por bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: 158 / khyab bdag gi ni dpal ldan sngags dang sangs rgyas gzugs kyang rnal 'byor pa yis dang por bsgrub par bya /
translated: The glorious mantra and the form of the Buddha, which are the all-pervading lord, should first be accomplished by the yogi.

original: phyi nas nyi ma'i dbye ba rnams kyis gnas pa yon tan dpag tu med pa'i las rnams 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas nyi ma'i dbye ba rnams kyis gnas pa yon tan dpag tu med pa'i las rnams 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: Later, by the divisions of the sun, the actions of immeasurable qualities are accomplished.

original: sngags dang gzugs brnyan ma grub par ni srid gsum gnas su ci yang 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: sngags dang gzugs brnyan ma grub par ni srid gsum gnas su ci yang 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin //
translated: Without the accomplishment of the mantra and the image, nothing at all is accomplished in the three worlds.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag la sngags dang gzugs ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag la sngags dang gzugs ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: Therefore, O King, the mantra and the form should be accomplished by those whose own minds are completely free from stains.

original: 159 / dpa' bo g-yul gyi dus su lhung bar gyur pa zhes pa 'am ni de bzhin chom rkun dbyangs pa dag / brgyad dang 'byung po'i mtshan mo mi yi bdag po ro bsreg sar ni bum pa brgyad kyis bkru bar bya //
analyzed: 159 / dpa' bo g-yul gyi dus su lhung bar gyur pa zhes pa 'am ni de bzhin chom rkun dbyangs pa dag / brgyad dang 'byung po'i mtshan mo mi yi bdag po ro bsreg sar ni bum pa brgyad kyis bkru bar bya //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen a hero falls in battle, or likewise a singer is killed by thieves, on the eighth and the fourteenth night, O Lord of men, he is washed with eight vases at the cremation ground.

original: dri dang spos dang mar me dang ni rnam mang kha zas me tog dmar po rnams kyis rab mchod nas //
analyzed: dri dang spos dang mar me dang ni rnam mang kha zas me tog dmar po rnams kyis rab mchod nas //
translated: Having made a great offering with perfumes, incense, lamps, various foods, and red flowers,

original: mgo dang snying ga dang ni spyi bo lte ba la sogs su yang rdo rje dgod pa rab byas te /
analyzed: mgo dang snying ga dang ni spyi bo lte ba la sogs su yang rdo rje dgod pa rab byas te /
translated: one should place the vajra on the head, heart, crown, navel, and so forth.

original: 160 / thab khung zur gsum du ni rdul tshon dmar pos snying po'i padma gang zhig mtshan mar bcas pa dang // 'dab mar rgyal rnams mtshan ma phyogs su phyogs bral du ni de bzhin lha mo rnams kyi rang mtshan ma //
analyzed: 160 / thab khung zur gsum du ni rdul tshon dmar pos snying po'i padma gang zhig mtshan mar bcas pa dang // 'dab mar rgyal rnams mtshan ma phyogs su phyogs bral du ni de bzhin lha mo rnams kyi rang mtshan ma //
translated: In the triangular hearth, with red powder, one should mark the essential lotus, with its sign, and on the petals, the signs of the Victors, in the directions and intermediate directions, and likewise the signs of the goddesses.

original: phyi rol re kh'a gsum la phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor du ni de bzhin khro bo'i mtshan ma rnams byas nas //
analyzed: phyi rol re kh'a gsum la phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor du ni de bzhin khro bo'i mtshan ma rnams byas nas //
translated: On the three outer lines, in the ten directions of the ma·πá·∏çala, one should make the signs of the wrathful ones.

original: de yi g-yas min du ni yi dags lag pad ral gri dkyil 'khor las ni g-yas su rkang pa'o /
analyzed: de yi g-yas min du ni yi dags lag pad ral gri dkyil 'khor las ni g-yas su rkang pa'o /
translated: To the left of that, the ghost Padmahasta, from the mandala of the sword, to the right of the foot.

original: 161 / sngar brjod ma mo'i skyon las rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje rnams kyis bdag nyid bsrung ba rab byas nas //
analyzed: 161 / sngar brjod ma mo'i skyon las rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje rnams kyis bdag nyid bsrung ba rab byas nas //
translated: Having thus protected oneself with the vajras of the lords who are victorious over the faults of the mothers mentioned previously,

original: sngags pas thab kyi g-yas su khrag dang bcas pa'i sha rnams dag gis sbyin sreg nyid ni rab byed pa //
analyzed: sngags pas thab kyi g-yas su khrag dang bcas pa'i sha rnams dag gis sbyin sreg nyid ni rab byed pa //
translated: the mantrin should perform the homa to the right of the hearth with flesh together with blood.

original: de yi sngags ni aom hr'im phrem h'um phat kyi mtha' ste bcu yis bsgyur ba'i brgyar @73b ni sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: de yi sngags ni aom hr'im phrem h'um phat kyi mtha' ste bcu yis bsgyur ba'i brgyar @73b ni sbyin sreg bya //
translated: His mantra is O·πÉ h·πõƒ´·πÉ pha·π≠, ending with h≈´·πÉ pha·π≠, and the oblation is one hundred times multiplied by ten.

original: rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas 'chi med ri bo bzhin du g-yo ba med pa nyid du mtshan mo phyed /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas 'chi med ri bo bzhin du g-yo ba med pa nyid du mtshan mo phyed /
translated: Having assumed the vajra posture, one should remain motionless like the mountain of immortality until midnight.

original: 162 / sbyin sreg rdzogs na ri 'dzin ral gri lta bur 'khyug cing 'bar la mche ba rnon po mig gsum pa //
analyzed: 162 / sbyin sreg rdzogs na ri 'dzin ral gri lta bur 'khyug cing 'bar la mche ba rnon po mig gsum pa //
translated: When the homa is complete, the mountain will tremble like a sword, blazing, with sharp fangs, and three eyes.

original: gang zhig sgra sgrogs sa yang rkang pas rnam par 'gems shing sgrub pa po ni 'jigs par byed pa de //
analyzed: gang zhig sgra sgrogs sa yang rkang pas rnam par 'gems shing sgrub pa po ni 'jigs par byed pa de //
translated: It will emit a sound and crush the earth with its feet, terrifying the adept.

original: thab kyi mtha' ru gnas nas ka ha ka ha dgod par byed cing 'jigs pa'i lus kyis gar byed de //
analyzed: thab kyi mtha' ru gnas nas ka ha ka ha dgod par byed cing 'jigs pa'i lus kyis gar byed de //
translated: Standing around the fire, he laughs ka ha ka ha, and dances with a terrifying body.

original: de mthong nas ni 'jigs pa'i sngags pa sems nyams skad cig gis ni gshin rje'i grong khyer 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de mthong nas ni 'jigs pa'i sngags pa sems nyams skad cig gis ni gshin rje'i grong khyer 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: Seeing him, the terrified mantrin, his mind destroyed, in an instant goes to the city of the Lord of Death.

original: 163 / ro bsreg gnas su sngags pas dngos grub rgyur ni lha min dbang po las kyang 'jigs par mi bya ste //
analyzed: 163 / ro bsreg gnas su sngags pas dngos grub rgyur ni lha min dbang po las kyang 'jigs par mi bya ste //
translated: In the cremation ground, the mantrin should not be afraid of even the lord of the demigods, for he is the cause of power.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i sems mthong nas ni slar yang bsgrubs pa'i 'byung po'i mgon po 'di skad smra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i sems mthong nas ni slar yang bsgrubs pa'i 'byung po'i mgon po 'di skad smra bar 'gyur //
translated: Seeing the unmoving mind, the accomplished lord of spirits again speaks thus:

original: dpa' bo bzang po khyod kyis bdag ni grub bo mtha' dag smros shig da ni bdag gis ci zhig bgyi //
analyzed: dpa' bo bzang po khyod kyis bdag ni grub bo mtha' dag smros shig da ni bdag gis ci zhig bgyi //
translated: ‚ÄúO hero, I am accomplished, O good one. Tell me everything. Now what shall I do?‚Äù

original: de skad brjod na sgrub pa po yis gzhan gyi don du rang yid la 'dod don du gnyer bar bya /
analyzed: de skad brjod na sgrub pa po yis gzhan gyi don du rang yid la 'dod don du gnyer bar bya /
translated: When he says this, the adept should request for the sake of others whatever he desires in his mind.

original: 164 / ral gri reg pa bcud kyi dbang po bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu'i ril bu ro tsa na dang mig sman dang // rkang pa byug dang shing lham dag dang 'jig rten pa yi dngos grub brgyad po khyod kyis bdag la stsol //
analyzed: 164 / ral gri reg pa bcud kyi dbang po bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu'i ril bu ro tsa na dang mig sman dang // rkang pa byug dang shing lham dag dang 'jig rten pa yi dngos grub brgyad po khyod kyis bdag la stsol //
translated: The sword, the touch-incantation, the elixir, the pill of ambrosia, the alchemical transmutation, the eye-salve, the ointment for the feet, and the magic boots‚Äîthese eight mundane accomplishments you must bestow upon me.

original: dbye dang bskrad pa dang ni srid pa gzhom pa nyid dang rengs pa dang ni dgug pa dag dang dbang //
analyzed: dbye dang bskrad pa dang ni srid pa gzhom pa nyid dang rengs pa dang ni dgug pa dag dang dbang //
translated: ‚ÄúDivination, exorcism, the destruction of existence itself, paralysis, summoning, and enthrallment‚Äî

original: bdag gi dngos grub thams cad mdzod cig de yis slar yang 'di dag thams cad bdag gis bgyi'o smra /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos grub thams cad mdzod cig de yis slar yang 'di dag thams cad bdag gis bgyi'o smra /
translated: ‚ÄúGrant me all accomplishments, and in return I will do all this for you.‚Äù

original: 165 /'byung po'i dbang po bsgrubs nas mi yi bdag po sgrub pa po ni sa 'og dag dang bar snang dang // lha yi mchog gi khang pa dang ni lhun po'i rtse dang rgya mtsho'i pha rol gang yin der 'gro ste //
analyzed: 165 /'byung po'i dbang po bsgrubs nas mi yi bdag po sgrub pa po ni sa 'og dag dang bar snang dang // lha yi mchog gi khang pa dang ni lhun po'i rtse dang rgya mtsho'i pha rol gang yin der 'gro ste //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving accomplished the lord of spirits, the adept, O king, goes to the underworld, the sky, the palace of the lord of the gods, the peak of Mount Meru, and the far side of the ocean.

original: de la zhon pa phyag na ral gri thogs pas sa yi steng gi gnas su 'jig rten bya ba byed //
analyzed: de la zhon pa phyag na ral gri thogs pas sa yi steng gi gnas su 'jig rten bya ba byed //
translated: ‚ÄúMounted on him, armed with a sword in his hand, he goes about his worldly business on the face of the earth.‚Äù

original: de phyir sems can don gyi slad du mchog gi snying rje yis ni lha min dbang po bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: de phyir sems can don gyi slad du mchog gi snying rje yis ni lha min dbang po bsgrub par bya /
translated: Therefore, for the sake of sentient beings, one should accomplish the lord of the demigods through supreme compassion.

original: 166 / ming gi dang po thugs kyi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi yi bdag po lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 166 / ming gi dang po thugs kyi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi yi bdag po lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The first syllable of the name becomes the mind vajra, the lord of men, the god and goddess.

original: gsung gi rdo rje ming gi yi ge thams cad de las lhag pa dag kyang sku yi rdo rje ste //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje ming gi yi ge thams cad de las lhag pa dag kyang sku yi rdo rje ste //
translated: The speech vajra is all the syllables of the name, and the body vajra is more than that.

original: de las yan lag so so'i sngags ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur te bklags pas grub pa brgya lam na //
analyzed: de las yan lag so so'i sngags ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur te bklags pas grub pa brgya lam na //
translated: From that, the mantras of the individual limbs become many, and the hundred accomplishments are obtained by recitation.

original: bsgom bya mchod bya bzlas bya rang @74a * //
analyzed: bsgom bya mchod bya bzlas bya rang @74a * //
translated: The object of meditation, the object of offering, and the object of recitation

original: gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis thugs gsung sku yi dbye bas so /
analyzed: gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis thugs gsung sku yi dbye bas so /
translated: are one's own, by the power of the buddha family, divided into mind, speech, and body.

original: 167 / so sor sngags kyi rigs ni nges par bye ba bzlas par rab tu 'gyur te rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: 167 / so sor sngags kyi rigs ni nges par bye ba bzlas par rab tu 'gyur te rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: The mantra family of each is definitely a hundred million recitations, which is well known.

original: sbyin sreg de las bcu yi cha shas rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis grub par 'gyur ba ji srid nyid //
analyzed: sbyin sreg de las bcu yi cha shas rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis grub par 'gyur ba ji srid nyid //
translated: The accomplishment by the power of the intrinsic qualities is a tenth part of that burnt offering, just as it is.

original: phyi nas zhi ba la sogs rnams la 'bras bu ster bar rab 'gyur rnam pa gzhan du 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas zhi ba la sogs rnams la 'bras bu ster bar rab 'gyur rnam pa gzhan du 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: Later, they will certainly bestow the fruit on those who are peaceful, etc., and not otherwise.

original: bsam gtan dang bcas bzlas dang sbyin sreg brtul zhugs nges ldan rnams kyi sngags kyi skye gnas sgrub par bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang bcas bzlas dang sbyin sreg brtul zhugs nges ldan rnams kyi sngags kyi skye gnas sgrub par bya /
translated: The place of the mantra should be accomplished by those who are endowed with meditation, repetition, fire sacrifice, and observances.

original: 168 / grub pa lcags gsum gyis bcings mkha' la 'gro ba'i sha yi ril bus mkha' la spyod pa nyid dag ster //
analyzed: 168 / grub pa lcags gsum gyis bcings mkha' la 'gro ba'i sha yi ril bus mkha' la spyod pa nyid dag ster //
translated: The flesh pill bound by the three metals gives the state of flying in the sky, and bestows the state of enjoying the sky.

original: khyi dang rta la sogs pa'i sgron ma rnams kyis lus la bkres skom la sogs nad rnams 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: khyi dang rta la sogs pa'i sgron ma rnams kyis lus la bkres skom la sogs nad rnams 'phrog par byed //
translated: The lamps of dogs, horses, and so forth take away the diseases of hunger, thirst, and so forth in the body.

original: de dag rnams kyi mig dang mkhris pa rnams kyis mi mchog rnams kyi mig sman sa ni rab 'byed dang // mi snang ba dang dbang du bya ba na chung yid 'phrog dpal ldan dur khrod du ni bsgrubs pa'o /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi mig dang mkhris pa rnams kyis mi mchog rnams kyi mig sman sa ni rab 'byed dang // mi snang ba dang dbang du bya ba na chung yid 'phrog dpal ldan dur khrod du ni bsgrubs pa'o /
translated: The eye and bile of those are the eye medicine of supreme men, which is the opening of the earth, invisibility, enthrallment, the ravishing of young women, and the glorious charnel ground.

original: 169 / nag po'i brgyad kyi mtshan mo dag gam yang na ma nu'i nyin zhag la ni dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas //
analyzed: 169 / nag po'i brgyad kyi mtshan mo dag gam yang na ma nu'i nyin zhag la ni dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas //
translated: On the night of the eighth of the dark fortnight, or on the day of the new moon, he should construct the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: bsrung ba dag kyang kun nas byas te de yi dbus su sha yi ril bu dag gam mig sman ni //
analyzed: bsrung ba dag kyang kun nas byas te de yi dbus su sha yi ril bu dag gam mig sman ni //
translated: Having made the protection rite all around, he should place in the center a pill of flesh or the eye ointment,

original: byas nas shin tu dri  bzangs  me tog rnams kyis yang dag mchod de sngags kyi bzlas pa rab tu bya //
analyzed: byas nas shin tu dri  bzangs  me tog rnams kyis yang dag mchod de sngags kyi bzlas pa rab tu bya //
translated: and having made offerings with very fragrant flowers, he should perform the recitation of the mantra.

original: ji srid mkha' la nyi ma bzhin du 'od zer 'phro ba'i bar te de nas blangs la gzung bar bya /
analyzed: ji srid mkha' la nyi ma bzhin du 'od zer 'phro ba'i bar te de nas blangs la gzung bar bya /
translated: As long as it emits light rays like the sun in the sky, then he should take it and hold it.

original: 170 /'tsho bar pho nya de ni 'tsho la nam mkha'i phyogs su gnas na sos zin 'chi ba thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 170 /'tsho bar pho nya de ni 'tsho la nam mkha'i phyogs su gnas na sos zin 'chi ba thob par 'gyur //
translated: If the messenger lives, he should stand in the direction of the sky; if he dies, he will be restored to life.

original: pho nya'i dri ba mi mnyam pa gang nges par bde ba'i 'bras ster mnyam pa 'chi ba ster bar brjod //
analyzed: pho nya'i dri ba mi mnyam pa gang nges par bde ba'i 'bras ster mnyam pa 'chi ba ster bar brjod //
translated: It is said that an uneven answer to the messenger‚Äôs question will give the result of life, and an even answer will give death.

original: pho nya sbrul la sogs pa'i ming dag rab tu brjod na de las sos zin 'chi ba thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: pho nya sbrul la sogs pa'i ming dag rab tu brjod na de las sos zin 'chi ba thob par 'gyur //
translated: If the messenger utters the names of the snake and so forth, then he will die, even if he is restored to life.

original: gal te srog ni rab tu 'jug la dris na dge bar 'gyur te 'byung ba la ni dge min 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te srog ni rab tu 'jug la dris na dge bar 'gyur te 'byung ba la ni dge min 'gyur /
translated: If the breath enters the life-channel, it is good; if it enters the life-force, it is not good.

original: 171 / pho nya'i rkang pa g-yon pa mdun na na chung mar brjod g-yas pa mdun du yin na skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 171 / pho nya'i rkang pa g-yon pa mdun na na chung mar brjod g-yas pa mdun du yin na skyes pa'o //
translated: If the left foot of the messenger is in front, it is a young woman; if the right foot is in front, it is a man.

original: lag pas rang gi yan lag dag la gang du reg pa'i phyogs 'dir mi de so yis zin pa ste //
analyzed: lag pas rang gi yan lag dag la gang du reg pa'i phyogs 'dir mi de so yis zin pa ste //
translated: The place where the hand touches the body is where the man will bite.

original: mig dang kha ni rab tu gdangs pa dag dang rna ba'i rtsa bar nag po yang ni 'chi bar @74b brjod ;
analyzed: mig dang kha ni rab tu gdangs pa dag dang rna ba'i rtsa bar nag po yang ni 'chi bar @74b brjod ;
translated: If the eyes and mouth are wide open, and there is a black spot at the base of the ear, it is said that he will die.

original: / gal te snying ga'i padma dkar por sgra ni cung zad gyur na de ni rab tu bsdu bar bya /
analyzed: / gal te snying ga'i padma dkar por sgra ni cung zad gyur na de ni rab tu bsdu bar bya /
translated: If there is a little sound in the white lotus of the heart, it should be suppressed.

original: 172 / dang por bsrung ba'i cho ga so yis zin pa dang ni bdag nyid la yang bde ba byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: 172 / dang por bsrung ba'i cho ga so yis zin pa dang ni bdag nyid la yang bde ba byed par 'gyur //
translated: First, the rite of protection; then, the biting of the self and the bringing of bliss.

original: sa chu me rlung de bzhin nam mkha' dag kyang mthe bo la sogs la ni nges par sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung de bzhin nam mkha' dag kyang mthe bo la sogs la ni nges par sbyar bar bya //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, and space are to be applied to the thumb and so forth.

original: la la sogs pa ha yi mtha' rnams rim pas brla dang lto ba snying ga kha nang dpral ba la //
analyzed: la la sogs pa ha yi mtha' rnams rim pas brla dang lto ba snying ga kha nang dpral ba la //
translated: The seed syllables of the ten nƒÅgas, beginning with ‚Äúha‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúha,‚Äù are in order on the thighs, belly, heart, mouth, and forehead.

original: h'um ksh'um hya hy'a la sogs klu bcu mi mnyam mnyam pa thung ngu ring po'i rab tu dbye ba yis /
analyzed: h'um ksh'um hya hy'a la sogs klu bcu mi mnyam mnyam pa thung ngu ring po'i rab tu dbye ba yis /
translated: The short and long vowels distinguish the equal and unequal.

original: 173 / g-yon gyi lus la sa bon thung ngu rna ba mgrin pa la gnas mchan khung dku dang brla phyogs la //
analyzed: 173 / g-yon gyi lus la sa bon thung ngu rna ba mgrin pa la gnas mchan khung dku dang brla phyogs la //
translated: The short seed syllables are on the left side of the body, located in the ear, throat, armpit, side, and thighs.

analyzed: g-yas kyi lus la gdengs can rnams kyi ring po nyid du rab 'gyur spro dang bsdu ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: The long ones are on the right side of the body, belonging to the nƒÅgas, and are divided into the exhaled and inhaled breath.

analyzed: rgyal ba zhes grags sor mo shin tu mnyam pa'i 'dam bu sbrul gyi sa bon ldan pas bsrung byas nas //
translated: Having protected the body with the seed syllables of the lotus and snake, which are the equal fingers of the famous Jina,

original: h'um ksh'um ldan pas snying gar shin tu bsnun na myur du so yis zin pa bskyod par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: h'um ksh'um ldan pas snying gar shin tu bsnun na myur du so yis zin pa bskyod par byed par 'gyur /

analyzed: 174 / sa yi sa bon dpral ba la ste mkha' skyes rkang par gnas pas myur du rengs par byed par 'gyur //
translated: The seed syllable of the earth is on the forehead, and the one born from space is on the foot; they will quickly paralyze [the body].

original: spyi bor chu dang rtse mo can ni lto bar rab tu bcug na dug ni med pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: spyi bor chu dang rtse mo can ni lto bar rab tu bcug na dug ni med pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: If one inserts the water and the crest jewel into the navel, the poison will be destroyed.

original: dpral bar rlung gi sa bon dang ni snying gar rtse mo can gyis nges par dug ni 'pho ba ste ;
analyzed: dpral bar rlung gi sa bon dang ni snying gar rtse mo can gyis nges par dug ni 'pho ba ste ;

analyzed: / spyi bor stong pa rab tu zhugs zhing sa ni rkang par gnas pas nges par dug ni gcod par byed /

analyzed: 175 / dpral par thig le dkar po yis ni rnam pa gsum gyi dug kyang nges par dug ni med par byed //

analyzed: dmar pos bskyod cing nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pas 'jug pa dang ni kha dog ser pos rengs par byed //

analyzed: tsha ba gsum po sbyar ba'i sdong bu srog ni rab tu 'bab par dug med byed la sbyar byas te //

analyzed: yang na kha ni rnam par phye ba'i lce'u chung la sor mo yis ni tam ga na sbyar bya /

analyzed: sngags kyis dgug par rab tu 'gyur te gdon gyi tshogs pa mtha' dag dus kyi sos zin rjod par byed //

analyzed: de phyir sems can don gyi slad du dang por mi rnams kyis ni mkha' lding dbang po bsgrub par bya /

analyzed: 184 / rig byed dang ni 'dab brgyad nyid dang mi yi bdag po so dang chu gter drug dang gnyis skyes la //

analyzed: snying por yi ge yan lag mchog dang rtse mo can dang g-yo bar rkang pa dbang dang dgug pa la /

translated: Then from the center of the petal of the essence, now ra ya k·π£e ca, then at the end ru.

original: de yi phyi rol aom hr'im sht'im dang bi kri t'a na na las rnam gnyis h'um dang phat du 'gyur /
analyzed: de yi phyi rol aom hr'im sht'im dang bi kri t'a na na las rnam gnyis h'um dang phat du 'gyur /
translated: Outside of that, o·πÉ h·πõi·πÉ ·π£·π≠i·πÉ and vi k·πõi tƒÅ na na, from the two la, h≈´·πÉ and pha·π≠.

original: 188 / re mig nas ni re mig bar la 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsgrub bya'i ming dang sngags 'di'o //
analyzed: 188 / re mig nas ni re mig bar la 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsgrub bya'i ming dang sngags 'di'o //
translated: From square to square, O lord of men, this is the mantra with the name of the one to be accomplished.

original: dbye dang gsad dang dbang la ya ma r'a ni rab tu 'gyur te kshe da me do sa tsa sogs //
analyzed: dbye dang gsad dang dbang la ya ma r'a ni rab tu 'gyur te kshe da me do sa tsa sogs //
translated: For the separation, killing, and enthrallment, ya ma ra ·πái is excellent, k·π£e da me do sa ca and so forth.

original: rengs dang dgug dang rmongs pa dang ni stobs ni byed pa dag dang zhi ba dang ni bskrad pa la //
analyzed: rengs dang dgug dang rmongs pa dang ni stobs ni byed pa dag dang zhi ba dang ni bskrad pa la //
translated: For the paralyzing, summoning, confusing, and empowering, and for the pacifying and expelling,

original: der ni snying po ngag nas ya yig 'gro ste yon tan dbang gis phyi rol thams cad snga ma bzhin /
analyzed: der ni snying po ngag nas ya yig 'gro ste yon tan dbang gis phyi rol thams cad snga ma bzhin /
translated: there the essence goes to ya, and by the power of the quality, all outside is as before.

original: 189 / yi ge rnams kyi yan lag mchog las mdun du dbyangs kyis 'khyud pa dag ni ma ru rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 189 / yi ge rnams kyi yan lag mchog las mdun du dbyangs kyis 'khyud pa dag ni ma ru rab tu 'gyur //
translated: From the supreme limb of the syllables, in front, the vowels embrace, becoming ma ru.

original: yi ge rnams kyis sde mtha'i yi ge rdo rje rigs kyi dbang gis lnga pa ham dang sam du gsungs //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis sde mtha'i yi ge rdo rje rigs kyi dbang gis lnga pa ham dang sam du gsungs //
translated: The letters are the letters at the end of the classes, the seed syllables of the Vajra family, the fifth being ham and sam.

original: thig le gnyis kyis dbyangs mchog sbyar ba la ni 'di yang bdag gis shes rab yi ge au ru 'gyur //
analyzed: thig le gnyis kyis dbyangs mchog sbyar ba la ni 'di yang bdag gis shes rab yi ge au ru 'gyur //
translated: The two bindus are the union with the supreme melody, and this is my wisdom, the letter u.

original: mam mu: ham hum: sam su: ma nydzu: nyid ni padma nor 'dab la ste nyi ma'i 'dab ma la /
analyzed: mam mu: ham hum: sam su: ma nydzu: nyid ni padma nor 'dab la ste nyi ma'i 'dab ma la /
translated: Mam muh, ham hum, sam sum, mam jhuh are on the lotus petals, the sun petals.

original: 190 / phyi rol du shr'i badzra gho sha: sa dang ldan pa'i ma nta bha dra h'um dang phat du 'gyur //
analyzed: 190 / phyi rol du shr'i badzra gho sha: sa dang ldan pa'i ma nta bha dra h'um dang phat du 'gyur //
translated: Outside, shra shra vajra ghosha, the one endowed with the earth, is mantavajra hum phat.

original: bsgrub bya 'dir ni lte ba la ste che ge mo yang mdzod cig dpal ldan zhi ba sogs la bskul //
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'dir ni lte ba la ste che ge mo yang mdzod cig dpal ldan zhi ba sogs la bskul //
translated: The one to be accomplished is here in the navel, and so-and-so is also to be accomplished, glorious peace, and so on.

original: de bzhin sngar brjod 'khor lo rnams dag la yang rtag tu bsgrub bya'i ming ni bri bar bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin sngar brjod 'khor lo rnams dag la yang rtag tu bsgrub bya'i ming ni bri bar bya bar 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, the names of the one to be accomplished are always to be written in the previously described wheels.

original: 'di dag thams cad bdag gis drin las rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis mi rnams kyis ni 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad bdag gis drin las rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis mi rnams kyis ni 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: All of this is accomplished by humans through my grace, by the word of the Lord of Conquerors.

original: 191 / sgra ni gang zhig snying ga'i phyogs na yod pa mi mchog rnams kyi rna ba'i bu gas thos gyur pa //
analyzed: 191 / sgra ni gang zhig snying ga'i phyogs na yod pa mi mchog rnams kyi rna ba'i bu gas thos gyur pa //
translated: The sound that is in the heart region, which is heard by the ears of the best of men,

original: de la mi yis sems ni gcig tu gyur par sbyar ba dag kyang ro ni mnyam par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: de la mi yis sems ni gcig tu gyur par sbyar ba dag kyang ro ni mnyam par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: is the same taste for the mind of a man who is one-pointedly engaged in it.

original: 'jig rten kun du sgra ni gang zhig srid par skyes pas brjod pa de dang de ni de bzhin thos //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun du sgra ni gang zhig srid par skyes pas brjod pa de dang de ni de bzhin thos //
translated: Whatever sound there is in the world, which is expressed by those born into existence, is heard just as it is.

original: khyab bdag gi ni rnam shes nyid dang ring du thos pa dag kyang rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: khyab bdag gi ni rnam shes nyid dang ring du thos pa dag kyang rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /
translated: The consciousness itself of the all-pervading lord, and even the distant sound, are to be contemplated by the yogi.

original: 192 / skyil krung bcing ba byas nas phan tshun so dag reg pa min par kha ni rnam par phye ba yis //
analyzed: 192 / skyil krung bcing ba byas nas phan tshun so dag reg pa min par kha ni rnam par phye ba yis //
translated: Having bound the knees together, without the teeth touching each other, with the mouth open,

original: phyi rol rlung dag bkug ste de dang bdud rtsir bcas pa lte ba'i dbus su rab tu bcug pa yis //
analyzed: phyi rol rlung dag bkug ste de dang bdud rtsir bcas pa lte ba'i dbus su rab tu bcug pa yis //
translated: the external winds are drawn in, together with the nectar, and inserted into the center of the navel.

original: kun tu gdung ba dang ni bkres dang @76b skom pa 'phrog cing mchog gi lus la dug kyang yang dag 'gog / dpral bar thig le dkar po dbyangs kyis yongs su bskor ba bdud rtsi spro bar byed pa yis kyang ngo /
analyzed: kun tu gdung ba dang ni bkres dang @76b skom pa 'phrog cing mchog gi lus la dug kyang yang dag 'gog / dpral bar thig le dkar po dbyangs kyis yongs su bskor ba bdud rtsi spro bar byed pa yis kyang ngo /
translated: The white drop on the forehead, surrounded by the vowels, emits nectar, and it also stops the poison in the body.

original: 193 / kha yang bkab ste sna yi bug pa gnyis ka dag nas phyi rol dag gi rlung ni ma lus pa //
analyzed: 193 / kha yang bkab ste sna yi bug pa gnyis ka dag nas phyi rol dag gi rlung ni ma lus pa //
translated: The mouth is covered, and all the external winds enter through the two nostrils.

original: srog gi shugs kyis bkug ste dri ma med pa'i glog dang mtshungs pa thur sel rlung dang sbyar byas pa //
analyzed: srog gi shugs kyis bkug ste dri ma med pa'i glog dang mtshungs pa thur sel rlung dang sbyar byas pa //
translated: Drawn in by the force of the life-wind, they unite with the downward-clearing wind, which is like a stainless lightning bolt.

original: dus kyis goms pa'i sbyor ba dag las zla ba nyi ma me yi dbus su ro ni mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: dus kyis goms pa'i sbyor ba dag las zla ba nyi ma me yi dbus su ro ni mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: Through the yoga of time and practice, the moon, sun, and fire become equal in taste in the middle.

original: lus la zas la sogs pa dang ni bkres dang skom pa 'phrog ste 'chi ba med pa nyid kyang ster /
analyzed: lus la zas la sogs pa dang ni bkres dang skom pa 'phrog ste 'chi ba med pa nyid kyang ster /
translated: It stops hunger and thirst and gives the food of immortality to the body.

original: 194 / nyi ma las ni gzhan du phyogs te nyi 'od la gnas rang gi grib ma brtan pa'i mig gis blta //
analyzed: 194 / nyi ma las ni gzhan du phyogs te nyi 'od la gnas rang gi grib ma brtan pa'i mig gis blta //
translated: Looking with the eyes, which are stable in the light of the sun, turned away from the sun,

original: phyi nas nam mkha' dag la mngon par brtags na ro mnyam skyes bu du ba'i kha dog mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas nam mkha' dag la mngon par brtags na ro mnyam skyes bu du ba'i kha dog mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: If one then looks up into the sky, one will see a person of the same color as the smoke.

original: zla ba drug tu goms pa'i sbyor ba dag las sa la gnas pa'i gter ni sa yi bu gar mthong //
analyzed: zla ba drug tu goms pa'i sbyor ba dag las sa la gnas pa'i gter ni sa yi bu gar mthong //
translated: Through the practice of familiarization for six months, one will see a treasure on the ground in a hole in the ground.

original: yang na shing gi grib mar rab tu zhugs te nam mkha'i mthil du thig le'i phreng ba bsgoms pas so /
analyzed: yang na shing gi grib mar rab tu zhugs te nam mkha'i mthil du thig le'i phreng ba bsgoms pas so /
translated: Or else, having entered into the shade of a tree, one should meditate on a garland of bindus in the middle of the sky.

original: 195 / nus ma gang zhig lte ba'i dbus nas gzhan gyi gnas su bcu gnyis mtha' dang cha yi mthar 'gro ba //
analyzed: 195 / nus ma gang zhig lte ba'i dbus nas gzhan gyi gnas su bcu gnyis mtha' dang cha yi mthar 'gro ba //
translated: The yoginƒ´ who goes from the middle of the navel to the other place, to the end of the twelve, and to the end of the parts,

original: de ni lte bar 'gog pa dang bcas dri med glog dang mtshungs pa dbyug pa'i gzugs can langs pa yang //
analyzed: de ni lte bar 'gog pa dang bcas dri med glog dang mtshungs pa dbyug pa'i gzugs can langs pa yang //
translated: arises with the form of a club, endowed with the cessation in the navel, and is like a stainless lightning flash.

original: 'khor lo nas ni 'khor lo'i bar du nges par dman zhing rol pa'i bgrod pas dbu ma'i rtsa la bskyod //
analyzed: 'khor lo nas ni 'khor lo'i bar du nges par dman zhing rol pa'i bgrod pas dbu ma'i rtsa la bskyod //
translated: She definitely moves through the central nƒÅ·∏çƒ´, from cakra to cakra, by the movement of play.

original: ji srid gtsug tor bug par btsan thabs nyid kyis phyi rol gyi ni pags pa dag la khab bzhin reg 196 / de yi dus su thur du sel ba mchog gi btsan thabs nyid kyis steng gi lam du bskul bar bya //
analyzed: ji srid gtsug tor bug par btsan thabs nyid kyis phyi rol gyi ni pags pa dag la khab bzhin reg 196 / de yi dus su thur du sel ba mchog gi btsan thabs nyid kyis steng gi lam du bskul bar bya //
translated: At that time, the downward-voiding wind is forced by the power of the supreme downward-voiding wind to enter the central channel from below.

original: zung gi rlung dag 'gags pa na ni gtsug tor phug nas mchog gi grong khyer dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zung gi rlung dag 'gags pa na ni gtsug tor phug nas mchog gi grong khyer dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: When the two winds are blocked, the downward-voiding wind enters the central channel from below and goes to the supreme city, the very crown of the head.

original: de ltar yid la rdo rje rab tu sad pas yul dang bcas pa mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar yid la rdo rje rab tu sad pas yul dang bcas pa mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: In this way, the mind-vajra is aroused, and the yogi and yogini attain the state of Khecara, the ‚Äúsky-farer,‚Äù together with the object of one‚Äôs desire.

original: mngon shes lnga yi rang bzhin du 'gyur slar yang 'di ni rnal 'byor pa rnams dag gi sna tshogs yum /
analyzed: mngon shes lnga yi rang bzhin du 'gyur slar yang 'di ni rnal 'byor pa rnams dag gi sna tshogs yum /
translated: The yogi and yogini attain the state of the five supernormal powers.

original: 197 / phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long dag la gzugs bzhin te //
analyzed: 197 / phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long dag la gzugs bzhin te //
translated: The yogi and yogini see the illusory mudra, the various forms of the consort, in the sky, in the same way that one sees one‚Äôs reflection in a mirror.

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
translated: The yogi and yogini emit many rays of light that illuminate the three worlds and are like stainless lightning.

original: phyi dang lus la dbyer med yul @77a * //
analyzed: phyi dang lus la dbyer med yul @77a * //
translated: The external and the body are inseparable, free from objects,

original: dang rnam par bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: dang rnam par bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' la gnas pa yi //
translated: merely appearances abiding in space.

original: sems dang sems byung la ni bdag gis 'khyud de 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs kyis de ni gcig pu'o /
analyzed: sems dang sems byung la ni bdag gis 'khyud de 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs kyis de ni gcig pu'o /
translated: The mind and mental factors are embraced by me, and by the forms of many beings, it is alone.

original: 198 / snying ni rnyog pa dang bcas las kyi phyag rgya 'di dag brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya gtang bya ste //
analyzed: 198 / snying ni rnyog pa dang bcas las kyi phyag rgya 'di dag brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya gtang bya ste //
translated: The mind is troubled, and these action mudrƒÅs are to be released by the gnosis mudrƒÅ.

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub slad du rgyal ba mchog gi skyed ma mchog gi phyag rgya gos pa med //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub slad du rgyal ba mchog gi skyed ma mchog gi phyag rgya gos pa med //
translated: For the sake of perfect complete enlightenment, the supreme mother of the supreme victors is the supreme unstained mudrƒÅ.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med cing mkha' mnyam mun bcom khyab byed rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya brtsegs par gnas //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med cing mkha' mnyam mun bcom khyab byed rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya brtsegs par gnas //
translated: Without change, equal to space, destroying darkness, pervading, and to be traversed by the yogƒ´, it abides in the summit.

original: ye shes gzi brjid srid pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing dus kyi 'khor lo rjes su rig pa bsgom par bya /
analyzed: ye shes gzi brjid srid pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing dus kyi 'khor lo rjes su rig pa bsgom par bya /
translated: The blazing gnosis, stealing the stains of existence, is the meditation on the knowledge of the KƒÅlacakra.

original: 199 / srid gsum phra rab gzugs min 'dir ni rnam par shes ba de bzhin rnam par shes pa nyid med de //
analyzed: 199 / srid gsum phra rab gzugs min 'dir ni rnam par shes ba de bzhin rnam par shes pa nyid med de //
translated: The subtle form of the three existences is not here, and likewise, consciousness itself does not exist.

original: sangs rgyas shes rab gang du'ang gnas pa ma yin zhes pa'i tshig ni sangs rgyas pa rnams ston par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas shes rab gang du'ang gnas pa ma yin zhes pa'i tshig ni sangs rgyas pa rnams ston par 'gyur //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe wisdom of the Buddha does not abide anywhere‚Äù teach the Buddhas.

original: gang gis 'gyur med dang bral mi rnams kyis ni stong pa nyid de bzung nas stong par lta byed pa //
analyzed: gang gis 'gyur med dang bral mi rnams kyis ni stong pa nyid de bzung nas stong par lta byed pa //
translated: Those who are devoid of the unchanging, having grasped emptiness, see emptiness.

original: des na gtso bos gang zhig 'pho med lhan skyes lus kyi bde ba dag ni sngags kyi theg par bstan /
analyzed: des na gtso bos gang zhig 'pho med lhan skyes lus kyi bde ba dag ni sngags kyi theg par bstan /
translated: Therefore, the Lord taught the innate, unchanging bliss of the body in the Mantra Vehicle.

original: 200 / ba lang bse rta glang po'i mgon song mchod sbyin dus su lus kyi yul la khyod kyi dbang po ni //
analyzed: 200 / ba lang bse rta glang po'i mgon song mchod sbyin dus su lus kyi yul la khyod kyi dbang po ni //
translated: At the time of the sacrifice, your senses should enjoy the objects of the body, the cow, the elephant, the horse, and the buffalo.

original: bde bar bzung bgyi gang de yul dang yul can rnams ni ye shes sbyor ba dag la 'gog pa ste //
analyzed: bde bar bzung bgyi gang de yul dang yul can rnams ni ye shes sbyor ba dag la 'gog pa ste //
translated: That which is taken as bliss, the object and the subject, is stopped in the practice of wisdom.

original: bslab ldan rnams kyi ba lang pags par so ma ba lli'i btung ba khrag dang bcas par gyur pa gang //
analyzed: bslab ldan rnams kyi ba lang pags par so ma ba lli'i btung ba khrag dang bcas par gyur pa gang //
translated: The skin of the cow of the one who possesses the training becomes the drinking cup of soma with blood.

original: de ni spyi bo'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi bha ga'i rdul la gnas shing kun tu 'gro ba dga' ba'i gzugs /
analyzed: de ni spyi bo'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi bha ga'i rdul la gnas shing kun tu 'gro ba dga' ba'i gzugs /
translated: That is the nectar of the moon of the crown, the form of the all-pervading joy that abides in the dust of the bhaga.

original: 201 / tshangs pa srog chags rnams kyi lus dang 'phrog byed ngag ste khyab 'jug kyang yid de dag rig byed gsum //
analyzed: 201 / tshangs pa srog chags rnams kyi lus dang 'phrog byed ngag ste khyab 'jug kyang yid de dag rig byed gsum //
translated: Brahma is the body of living beings, Vishnu is the speech, and Shiva is the mind, and these are the three Vedas.

original: aom yig de dag yi ge gsum ste zla nyi bsreg za de dag rnams dang yon tan rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: aom yig de dag yi ge gsum ste zla nyi bsreg za de dag rnams dang yon tan rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The three syllables are the syllables Om, and the moon, sun, and fire are the three channels of the qualities.

original: rigs can lus kyi rigs la gzhan pa yul dang yon tan la gnas srid srung n'a da'i gzugs can te //
analyzed: rigs can lus kyi rigs la gzhan pa yul dang yon tan la gnas srid srung n'a da'i gzugs can te //
translated: The three channels are the three families, and the other channels are the families of the body, the objects, and the qualities.

original: de yi dbus su gzhom med gang de yul dang rnam par bral zhing yon tan med pa'i 'gyur med do /
analyzed: de yi dbus su gzhom med gang de yul dang rnam par bral zhing yon tan med pa'i 'gyur med do /
translated: In the middle of that is the indestructible, which is free from objects and qualities and is unchanging.

original: 202 / rig byed mtha' las gsang ba 'di dag tshangs pa yis ni rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la sngon brjod de //
analyzed: 202 / rig byed mtha' las gsang ba 'di dag tshangs pa yis ni rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la sngon brjod de //
translated: These secrets were previously taught by Brahma to the yogis in the Vedanta.

original: dus kyi shes pa rab nyams thub pa rnams kyis 'dir @77b ni srog chags rnams la gsod pa dag kyang bstan //
analyzed: dus kyi shes pa rab nyams thub pa rnams kyis 'dir @77b ni srog chags rnams la gsod pa dag kyang bstan //
translated: The sages have taught them here to living beings in order to destroy the knowledge of time.

original: mi rnams mtho ris don du de la rab tu 'jug ste dmyal ba ngan pa'i 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rnams mtho ris don du de la rab tu 'jug ste dmyal ba ngan pa'i 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur //
translated: People engage in them for the sake of heaven, but they give rise to the result of the lower realms.

original: sol ba 'o ma'i rgyun gyis mngon par bkrus pa 'dir ni zla ba'i mdog tu 'gar yang 'gyur ma yin /
analyzed: sol ba 'o ma'i rgyun gyis mngon par bkrus pa 'dir ni zla ba'i mdog tu 'gar yang 'gyur ma yin /
translated: The pure white hue of a moon-bright crystal pearl.üîΩThe Vedas, though they be recited by the lips of men,

original: 203 / sbyor ba med pa'i rig byed tshig ni dam tshig rnam par bral ba dag gis bslus pa'i mi rnams gang //
analyzed: 203 / sbyor ba med pa'i rig byed tshig ni dam tshig rnam par bral ba dag gis bslus pa'i mi rnams gang //
translated: Are but a fraud on those who have no knowledge of their sense.

original: de rnams gzhan gyi bu ni mi skyed don du nyin mtshan dus su rang gi bud med bsrung byas nas //
analyzed: de rnams gzhan gyi bu ni mi skyed don du nyin mtshan dus su rang gi bud med bsrung byas nas //
translated: The man who guards his wife at night and day, lest other men should see her,

original: bu yis byin pa dag kyang yi dags kyi ni 'jig rten du song  pha yi sbyin par 'gyur ro lo //
analyzed: bu yis byin pa dag kyang yi dags kyi ni 'jig rten du song  pha yi sbyin par 'gyur ro lo //
translated: Begets no son, and all his wealth goes to the world of hungry ghosts.

original: des na bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba 'dod pa'i sbyin pa 'di ni gdug pa'i bram ze rnams kyis sbas /
analyzed: des na bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba 'dod pa'i sbyin pa 'di ni gdug pa'i bram ze rnams kyis sbas /
translated: So, when the Brahmans, greedy for their own advantage, have stolen the gift of this desire-granting gem,üîΩThe horse of noble breed begets a mare, and she a mule, and then the line is broken.

original: 204 / gal te rigs kyi rta yis rgod ma bzang mo la ni rta mchog skyes bu gzhan du gyur pa na //
analyzed: 204 / gal te rigs kyi rta yis rgod ma bzang mo la ni rta mchog skyes bu gzhan du gyur pa na //
translated: But if the horse be good, the mare be good, the union be propitious,

original: dpal yang 'di yi mthu las slar yang 'gyur te bdag po yi ni rnyed pa dag kyang cis ma yin //
analyzed: dpal yang 'di yi mthu las slar yang 'gyur te bdag po yi ni rnyed pa dag kyang cis ma yin //
translated: The glory of the master grows, and he receives the fruit of his possession.

original: gang gis chags pa can rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su rang rang bud med dag ni srung bar byed //
analyzed: gang gis chags pa can rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su rang rang bud med dag ni srung bar byed //
translated: The courtesans, who are the mistresses of the day and night, are guarded by their keepers.

original: shi bar gyur na khyod su khyod kyi rang gi bud med su ste kye ma mi dge'i las kyis bcings /
analyzed: shi bar gyur na khyod su khyod kyi rang gi bud med su ste kye ma mi dge'i las kyis bcings /
translated: When they die, who will be yours? And who will be your mistress? Alas! You are bound by the fetters of evil karma.

original: 205 / ba lang sbyin dang sa gzhi sbyin pa de bzhin gzhan yang mi yi 'jig rten du ni longs spyod ster //
analyzed: 205 / ba lang sbyin dang sa gzhi sbyin pa de bzhin gzhan yang mi yi 'jig rten du ni longs spyod ster //
translated: The gift of cattle, the gift of land, and likewise the gift of wealth in the human world,

original: sman dang kha zas sbyin pa dag ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog bkres pa dag ni skom pa dag kyang 'phrog /'dod pa'i sbyin pa thams cad du ni bde mnyam 'bras ster 'khor lo'i dus su smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: sman dang kha zas sbyin pa dag ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog bkres pa dag ni skom pa dag kyang 'phrog /'dod pa'i sbyin pa thams cad du ni bde mnyam 'bras ster 'khor lo'i dus su smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
translated: the gift of medicine and food, which removes all sickness and hunger and thirst, the gift of sensual pleasures, which everywhere bestows the fruit of perfect bliss, what need to mention the gift of the wheel at the time of the wheel-turning kings?

original: yid 'ong chung ma sring mo skal  bzangs bu mo rnams kyang gsang ba sbyin pa la ni rab sbyin bya /
analyzed: yid 'ong chung ma sring mo skal  bzangs bu mo rnams kyang gsang ba sbyin pa la ni rab sbyin bya /
translated: Beautiful wives, sisters, and fortunate daughters are given as secret gifts.

original: 206 / smad 'tshong dam pa rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur zhing gsang ba'i mi mo gzhan gyi bud med dam tshig ste //
analyzed: 206 / smad 'tshong dam pa rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur zhing gsang ba'i mi mo gzhan gyi bud med dam tshig ste //
translated: The best of courtesans become the karma-mudras, and other secret women become the samaya-women.

original: rang dbang chos kyi phyag rgya yul ni mang po la dga' rang gi chung ma ye shes phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rang dbang chos kyi phyag rgya yul ni mang po la dga' rang gi chung ma ye shes phyag rgya'o //
translated: The seal of the Dharma of independence is the enjoyment of many objects, one‚Äôs own wife, the wisdom seal.

original: smad 'tshong dam pa bcu gnyis lo lon mchog gi bde ba la dga' gzhan gyi bud med bcu drug lo //
analyzed: smad 'tshong dam pa bcu gnyis lo lon mchog gi bde ba la dga' gzhan gyi bud med bcu drug lo //
translated: The supreme prostitute is the enjoyment of the supreme bliss of a sixteen-year-old girl, another‚Äôs wife.

original: rang dbang lo ni nyi shu lon pa bu mo dang bcas rang gi chung ma sum cu'i lo ru 'gyur /
analyzed: rang dbang lo ni nyi shu lon pa bu mo dang bcas rang gi chung ma sum cu'i lo ru 'gyur /
translated: The independent one, twenty years old, with a daughter, is one‚Äôs own wife, thirty years old.

original: 207 / sngon tshe sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dzin ma dang ni glang chen rta dang shing rta du ma gser gyi khur //
analyzed: 207 / sngon tshe sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dzin ma dang ni glang chen rta dang shing rta du ma gser gyi khur //
translated: In former times, the mothers of the buddhas, the elephants, horses, and many chariots of gold

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du byin zhing slar yang mgo dang khrag dang sha rnams dag kyang rab tu byin //üîΩ'di rnams kyis ni bzhed pa'i sangs @78a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du byin zhing slar yang mgo dang khrag dang sha rnams dag kyang rab tu byin // 'di rnams kyis ni bzhed pa'i sangs @78a * //
translated: were given for the sake of buddhahood itself, and again, the head, blood, and flesh were given.

original: rgyas nyid du ma gyur de nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rab tu byin //
analyzed: rgyas nyid du ma gyur de nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rab tu byin //
translated: By these, the desired buddhahood was not attained. Then, the gift of desire was given.

original: gsang ba'i sbyin pa de yis skyes bu rnams ni rgyal ba skyed byed rigs la sangs rgyas nyid du 'khrungs /
analyzed: gsang ba'i sbyin pa de yis skyes bu rnams ni rgyal ba skyed byed rigs la sangs rgyas nyid du 'khrungs /
translated: By that gift of the secret, the beings born in the family that produces the Victor were born as buddhas.

original: 208 / zangs ma yis ni gser dang mtshungs shing mching bu dum bus lha yi cod pan nor bu dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: 208 / zangs ma yis ni gser dang mtshungs shing mching bu dum bus lha yi cod pan nor bu dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Copper is like gold, a piece of glass is like a precious stone on the forehead of a god.

original: smad 'tshong dam pa'i 'dod pa'i sbyin pas 'chi med rigs kyi bu mo pags pa dum bu gla rtsi ste //
analyzed: smad 'tshong dam pa'i 'dod pa'i sbyin pas 'chi med rigs kyi bu mo pags pa dum bu gla rtsi ste //
translated: A piece of skin from a courtesan is like the gift of immortality to a holy man.

original: bong bu yis ni rigs kyi rta dang ra yis rab mchog glang chen bdag po gal te rnyed pa na //
analyzed: bong bu yis ni rigs kyi rta dang ra yis rab mchog glang chen bdag po gal te rnyed pa na //
translated: If one can get a donkey for a horse, a goat for an elephant,

original: chung ma'i sbyin pas rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la lha mo de la 'di ni rnyed pa cis ma yin /
analyzed: chung ma'i sbyin pas rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la lha mo de la 'di ni rnyed pa cis ma yin /
translated: why not get a goddess for a wife, a wife who will bear a Buddha?üîΩThe gift of love, not the gift of wealth, brings the fruit of bliss to the abode of love.üîΩThe gift of love is not the gift of wealth, but the gift of the heart, the gift of the soul.

original: snying rje dga' dang bcas pa'i gnas ni zung la gzhan gyi don du bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: snying rje dga' dang bcas pa'i gnas ni zung la gzhan gyi don du bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyis //
translated: The gift of love is not the gift of wealth, but

original: rab tu byin na dman pa nyid dang mchog nyid phyir na tshogs gnyis rab rdzogs mi zad bde 'bras ster /
analyzed: rab tu byin na dman pa nyid dang mchog nyid phyir na tshogs gnyis rab rdzogs mi zad bde 'bras ster /
translated: When given well, it gives the fruit of inexhaustible bliss, the perfection of the two stores, because of its inferiority and superiority.

original: 210 / gang la rigs ni tshad mar gyur pa de la mi yi bdag po rig byed dag ni tshad mar 'gyur //
analyzed: 210 / gang la rigs ni tshad mar gyur pa de la mi yi bdag po rig byed dag ni tshad mar 'gyur //
translated: When the Veda is authoritative, then the Veda is authoritative for the lord of men.

original: gang la rig byed tshad mar gyur pa de la nges par sa gzhi'i gnas su mchod sbyin tshad ma ste //
analyzed: gang la rig byed tshad mar gyur pa de la nges par sa gzhi'i gnas su mchod sbyin tshad ma ste //
translated: When the Veda is authoritative, then sacrifice is authoritative in the realm of the earth.

original: gang la mchod sbyin tshad ma de la rnam mang phyugs dang mi rnams dag la 'tshe ba tshad mar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang la mchod sbyin tshad ma de la rnam mang phyugs dang mi rnams dag la 'tshe ba tshad mar 'gyur //
translated: When sacrifice is authoritative, then the harm of many animals and men is authoritative.

original: gang la 'tshe ba tshad mar gyur pa de la dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i sdig pa tshad ma'o /
analyzed: gang la 'tshe ba tshad mar gyur pa de la dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i sdig pa tshad ma'o /
translated: When harm is authoritative, then sin is authoritative, the cause of fear of hell.

original: 211 / gnas ni 'dzin pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal ldan gtsug lag khang gi rab gnas bzhed par gsungs //
analyzed: 211 / gnas ni 'dzin pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal ldan gtsug lag khang gi rab gnas bzhed par gsungs //
translated: For the sake of holding the place, the Lord is said to desire the consecration of the glorious monastery.

original: de la sman dang kha zas sbyin pa nad  ni zhi bar byed pa sbyin pa po yis sbyin no zer //
analyzed: de la sman dang kha zas sbyin pa nad  ni zhi bar byed pa sbyin pa po yis sbyin no zer //
translated: There, it is said, the giver of medicine and food gives the gift of the alleviation of disease.

original: sbyin pa med na gtsug lag khang 'di sa yi steng gi gnas su dud 'gro rnams kyi gnas sa ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa med na gtsug lag khang 'di sa yi steng gi gnas su dud 'gro rnams kyi gnas sa ste //
translated: If there is no charity, this temple will be the dwelling place of animals on the surface of the earth.

original: gang du dge 'dun gcig ni 'dzin par gyur pa der ni mi yi bdag po chos dang sangs rgyas kyang /
analyzed: gang du dge 'dun gcig ni 'dzin par gyur pa der ni mi yi bdag po chos dang sangs rgyas kyang /
translated: Where there is one monk, there is the Dharma and the Buddha,

original: 212 / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la ni mi rnams thar pa'i slad du skyabs su nye bar 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: 212 / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la ni mi rnams thar pa'i slad du skyabs su nye bar 'gro ba ste //
translated: and there people go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha for the sake of liberation.

original: 'dir ni sangs rgyas gtsug lag khang na gnas pa 'di dang yi ge bris pa'i glegs bam chos nyid dang // dge 'dun dur smrig 'dzin pa mchog gi khyab bdag bde ba skye ba @78b 'bum phrag rnams kyis ster ba min //
analyzed: 'dir ni sangs rgyas gtsug lag khang na gnas pa 'di dang yi ge bris pa'i glegs bam chos nyid dang // dge 'dun dur smrig 'dzin pa mchog gi khyab bdag bde ba skye ba @78b 'bum phrag rnams kyis ster ba min //
translated: Here, in this temple, the Buddha is present, the Dharma is the written scriptures, the Sangha is the supreme lord of the saffron-robed monks, and they bestow the bliss of hundreds of thousands of births.

original: slob dpon dag ni sangs rgyas nyid de rab mchog sa yi gzhi la chos ni de yi bstan pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon dag ni sangs rgyas nyid de rab mchog sa yi gzhi la chos ni de yi bstan pa'o /
translated: The masters are the very Buddha himself, the supreme ground is the Dharma,

original: 213 / dge 'dun gang zhig der gnas rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang sems can kun la rjes su brtse ba ste //
analyzed: 213 / dge 'dun gang zhig der gnas rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang sems can kun la rjes su brtse ba ste //
translated: and the Sangha is the one who dwells there with a joyful heart, compassionate towards all beings.

original: de 'dir rnam bzhi rnam pa gnyis gsungs 'dir ni slar yang nyan thos pa dang bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir rnam bzhi rnam pa gnyis gsungs 'dir ni slar yang nyan thos pa dang bla na med pa'o //
translated: Here, the fourfold is said to be twofold, again ≈õrƒÅvaka and unsurpassed.

original: dge slong rnams dang dge slong ma dang slar yang 'dir ni dge bsnyen chen po dag dang dge bsnyen ma //
analyzed: dge slong rnams dang dge slong ma dang slar yang 'dir ni dge bsnyen chen po dag dang dge bsnyen ma //
translated: Monks and nuns, and again here, the great upƒÅsakas and upƒÅsikƒÅs,

original: rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor pa rnams lhan skyes bde ba la dga' dge bsnyen ma dang dge bsnyen yang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor pa rnams lhan skyes bde ba la dga' dge bsnyen ma dang dge bsnyen yang /
translated: The yoginƒ´s and yogins delight in co-emergent bliss, and the upƒÅsakas and upƒÅsikƒÅs,

original: 214 / bsod nams ye shes don gyi slad du rtag par mchog tu 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang //
analyzed: 214 / bsod nams ye shes don gyi slad du rtag par mchog tu 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang //
translated: For the sake of merit and wisdom, always give various desired gifts.

original: nyan thos rnams la mchod ston la sogs rnal 'byor pa la mchog gi bde byed 'dod pa'i sbyin pa yang //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la mchod ston la sogs rnal 'byor pa la mchog gi bde byed 'dod pa'i sbyin pa yang //
translated: To the ≈õrƒÅvakas, they give gifts such as feasts, and to the yogins, they give gifts that create supreme bliss.

original: sbyin pa po gang rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang dus kun du ni chags pa'i sems kyis sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: sbyin pa po gang rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang dus kun du ni chags pa'i sems kyis sbyin byed pa //
translated: The givers, with a mind of constant attachment, give with a joyful heart.

original: de dag bsod nams ye shes rdzogs te mchog gi bde ba'i gnas su skye ba 'di la 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag bsod nams ye shes rdzogs te mchog gi bde ba'i gnas su skye ba 'di la 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: They go to the supreme blissful state in this life, having perfected merit and wisdom.

original: 215 / slob dpon dang ni rgyal ba la yang mkhas pa min pa'i nyan thos gang dag gsal bar smod byed pa //
analyzed: 215 / slob dpon dang ni rgyal ba la yang mkhas pa min pa'i nyan thos gang dag gsal bar smod byed pa //
translated: Those who are not wise, who are ≈õrƒÅvakas, who clearly disparage the master and the Victorious One,

original: de dag bgegs kyi mgon pos bsad de mchog tu 'jigs pa byed pa'i mnar med du ni myur du 'gro //
analyzed: de dag bgegs kyi mgon pos bsad de mchog tu 'jigs pa byed pa'i mnar med du ni myur du 'gro //
translated: are killed by the lord of obstacles and quickly go to the Avƒ´ci hell, which causes supreme fear.

original: gang la rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag pos sngags kyi mthu rnams kyis ni rang nyid byin gyis brlab pa mdzad //
analyzed: gang la rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag pos sngags kyi mthu rnams kyis ni rang nyid byin gyis brlab pa mdzad //
translated: To whom the supreme Victorious One, the Lord, with the powers of mantra, blesses himself,

original: mi rnams dag las dge slong su zhig brtul zhugs nges pa'i gnas la de dang tshangs par spyod pa mtshungs /
analyzed: mi rnams dag las dge slong su zhig brtul zhugs nges pa'i gnas la de dang tshangs par spyod pa mtshungs /
translated: among humans, which monk is on the definite path of disciplined conduct, equal in pure conduct to him?

original: 216 / mchog gi bde ba la dga' dge slong dag gam kun tu rgyu dang gcer bu mgo zlum ral pa can //
analyzed: 216 / mchog gi bde ba la dga' dge slong dag gam kun tu rgyu dang gcer bu mgo zlum ral pa can //
translated: The monk who delights in supreme bliss, or the wandering mendicant, the naked one, the shaven-headed one with matted hair,

original: thos dang klog pa la dga' mkhas pa lam nyams thams cad byed po dang ni bdag tu zhen pa dang // 'dir ni rtag tu rang gzhan bu dang chung mar zhen dang bza' dang bza' ba min par zhen pa dang // rigs dang rigs ni min pa la dga' snod dang snod min dag tu zhen pas dka' ba byed pa'o /
analyzed: thos dang klog pa la dga' mkhas pa lam nyams thams cad byed po dang ni bdag tu zhen pa dang // 'dir ni rtag tu rang gzhan bu dang chung mar zhen dang bza' dang bza' ba min par zhen pa dang // rigs dang rigs ni min pa la dga' snod dang snod min dag tu zhen pas dka' ba byed pa'o /
translated: The wise who delight in hearing and reading, who practice the path, who are attached to an agent and a self,üîΩwho are always attached to self and others, to children and wives, to food and drink, to what is proper and improper,
