original: kun nas dga' ba thams cad rdo rje can gyi bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas te dus ni thams cad do //
analyzed: kun nas dga' ba thams cad rdo rje can gyi bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas te dus ni thams cad do //
translated: The place of the equality of bliss of the Vajra Holder is all the delightful places, and the time is all times.

original: zla ba zhu ba bla ma'i zhal de ru ni gang zhig zhugs pa dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid de //
analyzed: zla ba zhu ba bla ma'i zhal de ru ni gang zhig zhugs pa dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid de //
translated: The moon is the guru‚Äôs face, and the one who enters there is the Wheel of Time.

original: bdud rnams kyi ni dus su gsungs shing 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo 'di dag go /
analyzed: bdud rnams kyi ni dus su gsungs shing 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo 'di dag go /
translated: These are the wheels of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, which are taught in the time of the demons and frighten away the fear of death.

original: 37 / shes rab thabs kyi yi ge dag gis gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang las mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro'i ming //
analyzed: 37 / shes rab thabs kyi yi ge dag gis gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang las mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro'i ming //
translated: The names of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s and ·∏çƒÅkas are from the seed syllables of method and wisdom, by the power of both families.

original: rdo rje gsum po rkang pa gzhan dang bcas pas thog ma dbus dang mtha' mar phye ba bzlas bya ste //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum po rkang pa gzhan dang bcas pas thog ma dbus dang mtha' mar phye ba bzlas bya ste //
translated: The mantra is to be recited with the three vajras, along with the other limbs, divided into beginning, middle, and end.

original: srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa gang zhig gnyi ga'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis rang rang las kyi rjes mthun pa'o //
analyzed: srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa gang zhig gnyi ga'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis rang rang las kyi rjes mthun pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the life-force is by the power of the two paths, in accordance with one‚Äôs own karma.

original: ro yi 'gro rnams la gnas mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro rnams ni myur du 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ro yi 'gro rnams la gnas mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro rnams ni myur du 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: The ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s and vajra ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s who dwell in the charnel grounds will be quickly accomplished.

original: 38 / dbugs rnams gang dag skye ba'i dus su dbu ma la ni rkang pa dang bcas ro dang mngar gyur pa //
analyzed: 38 / dbugs rnams gang dag skye ba'i dus su dbu ma la ni rkang pa dang bcas ro dang mngar gyur pa //
translated: The eight channels, which are sweet and have feet, are in the madhyama at the time of the arising of the breaths.

original: de brgyad rnams kyis 'khor lor 'gyur te 'og dang mkha' yi dbang gis sgo yi dbus gnas lha mo rnams //
analyzed: de brgyad rnams kyis 'khor lor 'gyur te 'og dang mkha' yi dbang gis sgo yi dbus gnas lha mo rnams //
translated: They are the cakras, with the goddesses in the middle of the doors, below and above, by the power of the winds.

original: @84b rkang pa gcig gis bskyed pa srid pa gsum gyi yum ste phyag na gri gug dang ni thod pa can //
analyzed: @84b rkang pa gcig gis bskyed pa srid pa gsum gyi yum ste phyag na gri gug dang ni thod pa can //
translated: The mother of the three existences, generated by one foot, is in the dakini chakra at the crown, with a hooked knife and a skull-cup in her hands.

original: bdud rtsi bde ba'i cha yis 'khyud pa nyi ma zla ba'i steng du g-yas brkyang dus kyi 'khor lo'o /
analyzed: bdud rtsi bde ba'i cha yis 'khyud pa nyi ma zla ba'i steng du g-yas brkyang dus kyi 'khor lo'o /
translated: She is embraced by the part of bliss, the nectar, on a sun and moon seat, with the right leg extended, the Wheel of Time.

original: 39 / lnga gsum me lce yul dang yon tan dbang gis zla ba nyi ma'i gdan rnams chu gter rkang pa las //
analyzed: 39 / lnga gsum me lce yul dang yon tan dbang gis zla ba nyi ma'i gdan rnams chu gter rkang pa las //
translated: The five and three are the tongues of fire, by the power of the objects and the qualities, the moon and sun seats, from the ocean of the feet.

original: gza' bdun dang ni rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan ni gzhan pa rnams //
analyzed: gza' bdun dang ni rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan ni gzhan pa rnams //
translated: The seven planets and the full sun, the sun that makes the day, and the seat of the moon, the others.

original: nag po dkar po'i rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan ni gzhan rnams dang // 'di nyid la ni ri bo'i gza' rnams mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la nyi ma zla ba'i gdan rnams so /
analyzed: nag po dkar po'i rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan ni gzhan rnams dang // 'di nyid la ni ri bo'i gza' rnams mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la nyi ma zla ba'i gdan rnams so /
translated: In this [mandala], the planets are in the mountains, the sun and moon are in the even and uneven [squares], and the seats are the sun and moon.

original: 40 / zla ba nyi ma'i rkang pa rtsibs rnams dang ni padma'i 'dab ma sgo bzhi zur gyi ro rnams te //
analyzed: 40 / zla ba nyi ma'i rkang pa rtsibs rnams dang ni padma'i 'dab ma sgo bzhi zur gyi ro rnams te //
translated: The feet of the moon and sun are the spokes, the lotus petals are the four doors, and the corners are the ro.

original: slar yang rkang pa nyis 'gyur de dag rnams ni nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan rnams nyid //
analyzed: slar yang rkang pa nyis 'gyur de dag rnams ni nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan rnams nyid //
translated: Again, the double of the feet are the seats of the sun and moon.

original: rdzogs pa gza' dang nyi ma'i rkang pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la chu gter rkang pa gdan rnams te //
analyzed: rdzogs pa gza' dang nyi ma'i rkang pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la chu gter rkang pa gdan rnams te //
translated: The complete planets and the feet of the sun and moon are in the even and uneven [squares], and the feet of the ocean are the seats.

original: nyi ma'am ni gang ba'i zla ba la 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis gtso bo yang na kha sbyor la /
analyzed: nyi ma'am ni gang ba'i zla ba la 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis gtso bo yang na kha sbyor la /
translated: Either the sun or the full moon is the family, and the principal is in union.

original: 41 / rlung la reg bya'i zhal gcig dang ni yon tan gzhan gyis dbang gis rgyas gdab zhal ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 41 / rlung la reg bya'i zhal gcig dang ni yon tan gzhan gyis dbang gis rgyas gdab zhal ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The wind has one face of touch, and the other qualities have two faces of sealing.

original: rtse mo can la gzugs dang reg bya'i zhal ni gnyis su 'gyur te rgyas gdab zhal ni gsum pa'o //üîΩchu la zhal yang reg bya dang ni gzugs dang ro yi zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo can la gzugs dang reg bya'i zhal ni gnyis su 'gyur te rgyas gdab zhal ni gsum pa'o // chu la zhal yang reg bya dang ni gzugs dang ro yi zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The peak has two faces, form and tactility, and the seal is the third face.üîΩThe water has three faces, tactility, form, and taste, and the seal is the fourth face.

original: sa la dri la sogs pa reg bya'i mtha' yi yon tan zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni lnga pa'o /
analyzed: sa la dri la sogs pa reg bya'i mtha' yi yon tan zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni lnga pa'o /
translated: The earth has four faces, smell and so forth up to tactility, and the seal is the fifth face.

original: 42 / nam mkha' la ni zhal yang stong pa rnam pa lnga ste rgya yis gdab pa'i zhal ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: 42 / nam mkha' la ni zhal yang stong pa rnam pa lnga ste rgya yis gdab pa'i zhal ni drug pa'o //
translated: The space has five faces, the five kinds of emptiness, and the seal is the sixth face.

original: de bzhin du ni ye shes khams la 'gyur te yon tan dbang las stong pa drug gi zhal rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ye shes khams la 'gyur te yon tan dbang las stong pa drug gi zhal rnams so //
translated: In the same way, in the realm of gnosis, there are six faces of emptiness, according to the three qualities.

original: gcig ni bzhi la bsres pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba dag ste gnyis dang gsum ni bsres pa lnga //
analyzed: gcig ni bzhi la bsres pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba dag ste gnyis dang gsum ni bsres pa lnga //
translated: One is the union of four, which bestows the fruit of the bliss of union; two and three are the union of five.

original: shes rab thabs ni zhal bcu yon tan rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis zhal ni bcu gnyis rnam pa bzhi /
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni zhal bcu yon tan rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis zhal ni bcu gnyis rnam pa bzhi /
translated: Wisdom and means have ten faces, and according to the three kinds of qualities, there are twelve faces, four kinds.

original: 43 / thun mtshams dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa gsum gyi zhal yang dus sbyor dbye bas kha dog gsum //
analyzed: 43 / thun mtshams dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa gsum gyi zhal yang dus sbyor dbye bas kha dog gsum //
translated: 43. The four aspects are due to the division of the periods; the three faces are also due to the division of the periods, and the three colors.

original: dus sbyor phyed pa phyag gi dbye ba mi mnyam mnyam pa 'khyud pa dag kyang lus dang sems la ni //üîΩthun mtshams cha shas snga phyi las te @85a * //
analyzed: dus sbyor phyed pa phyag gi dbye ba mi mnyam mnyam pa 'khyud pa dag kyang lus dang sems la ni // thun mtshams cha shas snga phyi las te @85a * //
translated: The division of the hands is due to the division of the half-periods; the unequal and equal embrace are due to the body and the mind.

original: zhal gsum ro yi phyag ni 'khyud pa dbu ma'i cha shas la //
analyzed: zhal gsum ro yi phyag ni 'khyud pa dbu ma'i cha shas la //
translated: 44. The division of the periods is due to the earlier and later parts; the three faces and the embrace with the three flavors are due to the parts of the central face.

original: shes rab sbyor dang snyoms par zhugs pa dag kyang dgod pa la sogs rnams ni thun gyi mngon mtshams la'o /
analyzed: shes rab sbyor dang snyoms par zhugs pa dag kyang dgod pa la sogs rnams ni thun gyi mngon mtshams la'o /
translated: 45. The union with the wisdom and the absorption are due to the beginning of the periods, and the laughter, etc.

original: 44 / shes rab yan lag dmar dang ser po la ni nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug / rdo rje can gyi g-yon mdun yan lag dkar dang sprin nag mtshungs pa dag la shes rab bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 44 / shes rab yan lag dmar dang ser po la ni nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug / rdo rje can gyi g-yon mdun yan lag dkar dang sprin nag mtshungs pa dag la shes rab bsam pa'o //
translated: 46. The red and yellow limbs of the wisdom are certainly engaged in the thought of the Wheel of Time; the left and front limbs of the vajra-holder are white and black-cloud-like, and are the thought of the wisdom.

original: mchog gi lus la shes rab bsam pas phye ba g-yon dang mdun gyi yan lag dag ni zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog gi lus la shes rab bsam pas phye ba g-yon dang mdun gyi yan lag dag ni zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: 47. The left and front limbs of the supreme body, divided by the thought of the wisdom, become peaceful.

original: drag po g-yas dang rgyab kyi yan lag mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bsam pas phye ba de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: drag po g-yas dang rgyab kyi yan lag mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bsam pas phye ba de bzhin nyid /
translated: The right and rear limbs are the supreme family of the Victorious Ones, divided by the intention of the Lord of Supreme Victory.

original: 45 / shes rab kyis phye rgyal ba dag gi rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 45 / shes rab kyis phye rgyal ba dag gi rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The family of the supreme Victorious Ones is of the nature of the two accumulations, divided by wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi ni gtso bos phye ba nges par phyogs bral du yang rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs nyid de //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni gtso bos phye ba nges par phyogs bral du yang rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs nyid de //
translated: The assembly of yoginƒ´s is definitely free from partiality, divided by the chief of wisdom.

original: g-yas dang g-yas min nyi ma dang ni ri bong can gyi sku dag zung ste shar dang nub nyid kyang //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yas min nyi ma dang ni ri bong can gyi sku dag zung ste shar dang nub nyid kyang //
translated: The pairs of the bodies of the sun and moon, right and left, are the east and west.

original: nag po ser po dag ste sngon po ljang gu dag kyang de bzhin mkha' dang sa 'og yang dag gnas /
analyzed: nag po ser po dag ste sngon po ljang gu dag kyang de bzhin mkha' dang sa 'og yang dag gnas /
translated: The black and yellow, and the blue and green, are the sky and the underworld.

original: 46 / dkar po rnams kyi shes rab dmar mo dmar po rnams kyi ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 46 / dkar po rnams kyi shes rab dmar mo dmar po rnams kyi ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar de bzhin nyid //
translated: The wisdom of the white ones is red; the red ones are like the moon.

original: ser po rnams kyi kha dog cag mo dkar min rigs rnams kyi yang mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: ser po rnams kyi kha dog cag mo dkar min rigs rnams kyi yang mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The color of the yellow ones is like the color of the non-white ones, and the supreme family is like gold.

original: sngon po rnams kyi kha dog sna tshogs slar yang ljang gu rnams kyi sngon mo rnams su de bzhin gsungs //
analyzed: sngon po rnams kyi kha dog sna tshogs slar yang ljang gu rnams kyi sngon mo rnams su de bzhin gsungs //
translated: The various colors of the blue ones are again the blue of the green ones.

original: de bzhin  des par lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa'i lha rnams dag tu rig par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin  des par lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa'i lha rnams dag tu rig par bya /
translated: In the same way, the goddesses should be known as the gods of their respective families.

original: 47 / shes rab rgyud ni shar nas slar yang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa nyid ni nub kyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: 47 / shes rab rgyud ni shar nas slar yang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa nyid ni nub kyi zhal nas so //
translated: The wisdom tantra arose in the east, and again the yoga-anvaya itself from the western face.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas rgyal ba'i bdag pos rnal 'byor rgyud gsungs g-yon gyi zhal nas bya ba la sogs so //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas rgyal ba'i bdag pos rnal 'byor rgyud gsungs g-yon gyi zhal nas bya ba la sogs so //
translated: From the right face, the Lord of Victors taught the yoga tantra, and from the left face, the kriya and so forth.

original: shar nas rnal 'byor spyod pa nyid de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas nges par dbu ma mtha' dag go //
analyzed: shar nas rnal 'byor spyod pa nyid de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas nges par dbu ma mtha' dag go //
translated: The yoga practice itself arose in the east, and again from the western face, all of the Madhyamaka.

original: mdo sde pa ni g-yas kyi zhal nas gsungs te dkar po'i zhal nas dag pa'i bye brag smra ba'o /
analyzed: mdo sde pa ni g-yas kyi zhal nas gsungs te dkar po'i zhal nas dag pa'i bye brag smra ba'o /
translated: The Sautrantikas are from the right face, and the Vaibhashikas from the white face.

original: 48 / nub kyi zhal nas nges brjod rig byed dang ni rgyal ba'i dbang pos g-yon gyi zhal nas mchod sbyin gsungs //
analyzed: 48 / nub kyi zhal nas nges brjod rig byed dang ni rgyal ba'i dbang pos g-yon gyi zhal nas mchod sbyin gsungs //
translated: From the western face, the Rig Veda was taught, and from the left face, the Yajur Veda by the Lord of Victors.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas snyan tshig rig byed mchog gi bsreg bya'i rigs la srid srung @85b shar gyi zhal nas so //üîΩshar gyi zhal nas rigs can rgyud de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas mkha' lding dang ni 'byung po'i rgyud //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas snyan tshig rig byed mchog gi bsreg bya'i rigs la srid srung @85b shar gyi zhal nas so // shar gyi zhal nas rigs can rgyud de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas mkha' lding dang ni 'byung po'i rgyud //
translated: From the right face, the Veda of the Metres; from the eastern face, the Veda of the Sacrifices.üîΩFrom the eastern face, the Veda of the Rituals; from the western face, the Veda of the Spirits.

original: g-yon gyi zhal nas zhi ba'i mtha' ste nyi ma 'char ka dang mtshungs g-yas pa nas ni khyab 'jug chos /
analyzed: g-yon gyi zhal nas zhi ba'i mtha' ste nyi ma 'char ka dang mtshungs g-yas pa nas ni khyab 'jug chos /
translated: From the right face, the Veda of the Law; from the left face, the Veda of Peace; from the right face, the Veda of Vishnu;

original: 49 / rgyab nas 'phral la ldog pa mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas g-yon gyi lha dang rab tu gnas pa ste //
analyzed: 49 / rgyab nas 'phral la ldog pa mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas g-yon gyi lha dang rab tu gnas pa ste //
translated: from the back face, the Veda of the Immediate Return; from the supremely white face, the Veda of the Left-handers.üîΩFrom the right face, the Veda of the Knowledge; from the wind face, the Veda of the Wind; from the Brahma face, the Veda of the Peace;

original: g-yas nas rig pa drag po min dang slar yang rlung gi zhal nas rlung skyes tshangs pa zhi ba dag / stong pa'i zhal nas stong pa dbang phyug dag ni srid gsum bdag pos 'jig rten pa yi don du spros //
analyzed: g-yas nas rig pa drag po min dang slar yang rlung gi zhal nas rlung skyes tshangs pa zhi ba dag / stong pa'i zhal nas stong pa dbang phyug dag ni srid gsum bdag pos 'jig rten pa yi don du spros //
translated: from the void face, the void, the Shiva, the lord of the three worlds, the creator of the world.

original: rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan dang ni gzhan pa rtsod dus rgyab kyi zhal la sogs pa'i dbye ba las /
analyzed: rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan dang ni gzhan pa rtsod dus rgyab kyi zhal la sogs pa'i dbye ba las /
translated: The three Ages of Fulness, of Twofoldness, and of Discord, are the four faces of the back.

original: 50 / de bzhin dpa' bo'i rim pa sogs dang nyi ma'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis thun mtshams bzhi po nyid dag dang // kha zas dag ni g-yas kyi zhal nas mchog tu 'jigs pa dag kyang rgyab kyi zhal nas spros pa ste //üîΩmdun gyi zhal nas 'khrig pa nyid do mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas rgyal po rmi lam dag dang gnyid //
analyzed: 50 / de bzhin dpa' bo'i rim pa sogs dang nyi ma'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis thun mtshams bzhi po nyid dag dang // kha zas dag ni g-yas kyi zhal nas mchog tu 'jigs pa dag kyang rgyab kyi zhal nas spros pa ste // mdun gyi zhal nas 'khrig pa nyid do mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas rgyal po rmi lam dag dang gnyid //
translated: The four watches of the day are the four faces of the hero, and so on, according to the movement of the sun.üîΩThe food is emitted from the right face, the most terrible; the sexual act from the front face; sleep and dreams from the white face.

original: rgyab nas rje rigs gnyis skyes mi yi bdag po dang ni de bzhin dmangs rigs dag kyang rim pas 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyab nas rje rigs gnyis skyes mi yi bdag po dang ni de bzhin dmangs rigs dag kyang rim pas 'gyur /
translated: From the back face, the king, the Kshatriya, the Vaisya, and the Sudra in order.

original: 51 / rgyal ba'i bdag pos mdun nas thams cad yod par smra ba gsungs te g-yas nas mang pos bkur ba'o //
analyzed: 51 / rgyal ba'i bdag pos mdun nas thams cad yod par smra ba gsungs te g-yas nas mang pos bkur ba'o //
translated: The Lord of the Victorious Ones, from the front face, teaches the Vaibhasikas; from the right face, the Sa·πÉmitƒ´yas.

original: rgyab kyi zhal nas gnas brtan pa ste slar yang dge 'dun phal chen pa ni g-yon gyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: rgyab kyi zhal nas gnas brtan pa ste slar yang dge 'dun phal chen pa ni g-yon gyi zhal nas so //
translated: From the back face, the Sthaviras; and from the left face, the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÖghikas.

original: mdun gyi zhal nas mi rnams dang ni slar yang rgyab kyi zhal nas dud 'gro rnams ni nges par spros //
analyzed: mdun gyi zhal nas mi rnams dang ni slar yang rgyab kyi zhal nas dud 'gro rnams ni nges par spros //
translated: From the face in front, he certainly emanates humans, and again from the face in back, he emanates animals.üîΩFrom the face on the right, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the right, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.üîΩFrom the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas 'byung po lha rnams mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas dmyal ba rnams dang lha min rnams /üîΩ52 / mdun gyi zhal nas spros pa dag kyang snying ga'i 'khor lo nas 'gyur rgyab zhal lte ba'i 'khor lo nas //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas 'byung po lha rnams mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas dmyal ba rnams dang lha min rnams / 52 / mdun gyi zhal nas spros pa dag kyang snying ga'i 'khor lo nas 'gyur rgyab zhal lte ba'i 'khor lo nas //
translated: From the face in front, he emanates the gods, and from the face on the left, he emanates the asuras.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas longs spyod rdzogs pa nas 'gyur kun tu g-yon gyi zhal nas lhan cig skyes pa nas //üîΩ'khor lo rnams kyi zhal gyi dbus nas lus la dngos po spro ba dang mi sdud pa nyid du 'gyur //üîΩ'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang rgyal ba skyed byed zhal gyi dbye ba rnams kyis yang dag go /
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas longs spyod rdzogs pa nas 'gyur kun tu g-yon gyi zhal nas lhan cig skyes pa nas //üîΩ'khor lo rnams kyi zhal gyi dbus nas lus la dngos po spro ba dang mi sdud pa nyid du 'gyur //üîΩ'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang rgyal ba skyed byed zhal gyi dbye ba rnams kyis yang dag go /
translated: From the face in front, he emanates

original: 53 / dpal ldan zla ba zla ba chu shel rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin las ni chu 'byung ba //
analyzed: 53 / dpal ldan zla ba zla ba chu shel rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin las ni chu 'byung ba //
translated: The moon, the glorious moon, the water crystal, without any thought, produces water.

original: @86a * // de bzhin 'jig rten du ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phung po la brten thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos 'dzag ste //
analyzed: @86a * // de bzhin 'jig rten du ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phung po la brten thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos 'dzag ste //
translated: In the same way, in the world, the aggregates of the Lord of the Victorious Ones, the Omniscient One, produce the Dharma.

original: chu ni sa bon khams la kun tu brten nas ro mnyam 'gyur ba ji bzhin nyid du chos dag ni //
analyzed: chu ni sa bon khams la kun tu brten nas ro mnyam 'gyur ba ji bzhin nyid du chos dag ni //
translated: The water, in contact with the elements of the seed, becomes of the same nature as the seed.

original: sems can rnams kyi dag pa'i sems kyis rnam pa mang por 'gyur te sngon gyi las kyi mthu las so /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dag pa'i sems kyis rnam pa mang por 'gyur te sngon gyi las kyi mthu las so /
translated: The Dharma, in contact with the pure mind of beings, becomes of many kinds, according to the power of their previous actions.

original: 54 / srid gsum gnas na sems can don gyi byed po dang ni yid bzhin nor bu la yang bsam pa med //
analyzed: 54 / srid gsum gnas na sems can don gyi byed po dang ni yid bzhin nor bu la yang bsam pa med //
translated: The one who acts for the benefit of beings in the three worlds has no thought, like the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: sems la gnas te mi dge 'bras bu'i dbang gis sdig pa'i las can sems can rnams kyis mi mthong ste //
analyzed: sems la gnas te mi dge 'bras bu'i dbang gis sdig pa'i las can sems can rnams kyis mi mthong ste //
translated: The beings who have evil karma do not see him, because of the power of the result of non-virtue, even though he is present in their minds.

original: yid bzhin nor bu'i skyon min mi dge ba dang dge ba'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad rab tu spyod //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu'i skyon min mi dge ba dang dge ba'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad rab tu spyod //
translated: The wish-fulfilling gem is not at fault; the result of non-virtue and virtue is experienced by all beings.

original: sems ni dag na mi de yang ni rgyal ba'i dbang por 'gyur te rgyal ba gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: sems ni dag na mi de yang ni rgyal ba'i dbang por 'gyur te rgyal ba gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If the mind is pure, then that man becomes a lord of the victors. What need has he for other victors?

original: 55 / gang gis myu gu 'di skyed skyed par byed pa de ni dngos po skyes nas rnam par nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: 55 / gang gis myu gu 'di skyed skyed par byed pa de ni dngos po skyes nas rnam par nyams par 'gyur //
translated: The seed that produces this sprout is destroyed when the sprout arises.

original: nyams pa de yis skyes par rab tu 'gyur te slar yang sa bon rgyal po dag gi skyed byed do //
analyzed: nyams pa de yis skyes par rab tu 'gyur te slar yang sa bon rgyal po dag gi skyed byed do //
translated: The seed that is destroyed produces the sprout, and the seed that is the king produces the sprout again.

original: snga ma gang de gzhan gyi dngos las shi ba zhes pa'i tshig ste rang gi ngo bos skyes pa min //
analyzed: snga ma gang de gzhan gyi dngos las shi ba zhes pa'i tshig ste rang gi ngo bos skyes pa min //
translated: The former is called ‚Äúdead‚Äù because it is a different thing. It does not arise by its own nature.

original: gang gis stong pa nas ni sa la 'ongs pa bde ba'i skad cig de yis stobs bcu 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis stong pa nas ni sa la 'ongs pa bde ba'i skad cig de yis stobs bcu 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: The one who is empty of the seed comes to the earth. By that moment of bliss, he becomes one who possesses the ten powers.

original: 56 / bde nas bde la rjes chags skad cig 'dir ni lhan skyes dngos po gzhan la rjes su chags pa min //
analyzed: 56 / bde nas bde la rjes chags skad cig 'dir ni lhan skyes dngos po gzhan la rjes su chags pa min //
translated: From bliss to bliss, he is attached in this moment. He is not attached to other things that are innate.

original: phung po gang dag de yis bskyed rnams slar yang bde ba'i skad cig de yis skyed par byed pa ste //
analyzed: phung po gang dag de yis bskyed rnams slar yang bde ba'i skad cig de yis skyed par byed pa ste //
translated: The aggregates that he produces are produced again by that moment of bliss.

original: dag pa las chos de las gzhan te slar yang de las gzhan dang de las rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa las chos de las gzhan te slar yang de las gzhan dang de las rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: From the pure, other than that, again other than that, and from that, pure.

original: dag pa'i sa la sa bon btab pa las ni rtsa ba rnams dang lo ma me tog 'bras bu bzhin /
analyzed: dag pa'i sa la sa bon btab pa las ni rtsa ba rnams dang lo ma me tog 'bras bu bzhin /
translated: Like roots, leaves, flowers, and fruits from seeds planted in the pure earth,üîΩthe particles are of six kinds: earth, water, fire, wind, taste, and supreme taste.

original: 57 / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang mchog gi ro ste phra rab dag ni rnam pa drug / dri la sogs pa re res dman zhing yul dang rnam par bral ba mtha' ma ye shes blta bya rnams //
analyzed: 57 / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang mchog gi ro ste phra rab dag ni rnam pa drug / dri la sogs pa re res dman zhing yul dang rnam par bral ba mtha' ma ye shes blta bya rnams //
translated: The last, the object of knowledge, is devoid of each of the others, smell and so forth, and is free from object and subject.

original: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med rnams ni zung dang zung dang ri bong can te mtha' ma chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med rnams ni zung dang zung dang ri bong can te mtha' ma chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The end of desire, form, and formlessness is the yoni, the rabbit, and the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: rnam pa kun ldan de dag kun nas rtag tu 'pho med bde ba lhan skyes rten du gyur pa'o /
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan de dag kun nas rtag tu 'pho med bde ba lhan skyes rten du gyur pa'o /
translated: Endowed with all aspects, always unchanging, bliss, and innate, it is the support.

original: 58 / slar yang sa sogs khams la phan tshun du ni gtso bo'i dngos po dag la chung pa'i dngos rnams gnas //
analyzed: 58 / slar yang sa sogs khams la phan tshun du ni gtso bo'i dngos po dag la chung pa'i dngos rnams gnas //
translated: Again, the small things are in the principal things of the elements, earth and so forth, in mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun phung po 'byung ba @86b dang ni yul dang yul can rnams dang phan tshun bdud dang ma rig pa //üîΩphan tshun rjes chags lnga ni ro yi 'gro rnams la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i skad cig gi //üîΩrnam pa thams cad pa rnams kun nas gzhan gyi yon tan mi dga' mi phyed rdo rje yang dag gnas /üîΩ59 / de dag rnams kyi dus kyi 'khor lo rdzu 'phrul rab tu gsal byed chen po du ma sprul pa'i sku //üîΩrdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa lha min dang ni mi rnams dang // longs spyod rdzogs pas gzugs can rnams dang mkha' la rgyal ba'i sras sogs dgra bcom rnams la chos sku yis //
analyzed: phan tshun phung po 'byung ba @86b dang ni yul dang yul can rnams dang phan tshun bdud dang ma rig pa // phan tshun rjes chags lnga ni ro yi 'gro rnams la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i skad cig gi // rnam pa thams cad pa rnams kun nas gzhan gyi yon tan mi dga' mi phyed rdo rje yang dag gnas / 59 / de dag rnams kyi dus kyi 'khor lo rdzu 'phrul rab tu gsal byed chen po du ma sprul pa'i sku // rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa lha min dang ni mi rnams dang // longs spyod rdzogs pas gzugs can rnams dang mkha' la rgyal ba'i sras sogs dgra bcom rnams la chos sku yis //
translated: and the mutuals of the five attachments.

original: stong pa'i cha yis srid gsum mtha' dag stong pa'i zad par rlung rnams kyis ni rlung gi zad par te /
analyzed: stong pa'i cha yis srid gsum mtha' dag stong pa'i zad par rlung rnams kyis ni rlung gi zad par te /
translated: The all-aspects are the vajra-like, the abiding in the joy of the taste of the Dharma, the abiding in the joy of the taste of the Dharma, the abiding in the joy of the taste of the Dharma, original: 60 / me yi cha shas rnams kyis me yi zad par chu yang 'gro la spros pa'i chu yi cha rnams kyis //
analyzed: 60 / me yi cha shas rnams kyis me yi zad par chu yang 'gro la spros pa'i chu yi cha rnams kyis //
translated: The parts of fire, by the exhaustion of fire, go to water; and the parts of water, by the exhaustion of water, go to earth.

original: 'dzin ma'i cha shas rnams kyis sa yi zad par tshogs pa'i yul rnams kyis ni dngos po'i rang bzhin kun //
analyzed: 'dzin ma'i cha shas rnams kyis sa yi zad par tshogs pa'i yul rnams kyis ni dngos po'i rang bzhin kun //
translated: The parts of earth, by the exhaustion of earth, go to the totality of the elements; and the totality of the elements, by the exhaustion of the elements, goes to the nature of all things.

original: kun nas nam mkha' dag dang mtshungs pa gcig gi bdag nyid 'di ni dag pa'i sa la ston par byed //
analyzed: kun nas nam mkha' dag dang mtshungs pa gcig gi bdag nyid 'di ni dag pa'i sa la ston par byed //
translated: The nature of all things, by the exhaustion of all things, goes to the state of the one, which is like pure space; and this is shown on the pure stage.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas skur 'gyur bde ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin phyir na 'chi bar yang ni mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas skur 'gyur bde ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin phyir na 'chi bar yang ni mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Thus, becoming the body of the Buddha, it is of the nature of the one bliss, and so does not die.

original: 61 / de gcig pu las rnam pa lnga ste mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog rnams kyis ni mngon rdzogs byang chub 'di //
analyzed: 61 / de gcig pu las rnam pa lnga ste mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog rnams kyis ni mngon rdzogs byang chub 'di //
translated: From that one, it is fivefold; and this perfect enlightenment of the supreme victors is all.

original: rnam pa nyi shu'i rang bzhin dang ni slar yang de nas sgyu 'phrul du ma'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu'i rang bzhin dang ni slar yang de nas sgyu 'phrul du ma'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is of the nature of twenty aspects, and then again of the nature of many kinds of magical creations.

original: de yi skad cig gcig ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur te las gzhan gyi ni rang bzhin min //
analyzed: de yi skad cig gcig ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur te las gzhan gyi ni rang bzhin min //
translated: One moment of it bestows the fruit of the bliss of equality; it is not of the nature of other actions.

original: 'dir thabs 'pho med skad cig gang yin 'dir ni lhan skyes chos kyi dbyings su rab tu zhugs pa la'o /
analyzed: 'dir thabs 'pho med skad cig gang yin 'dir ni lhan skyes chos kyi dbyings su rab tu zhugs pa la'o /
translated: Here, the ‚Äúunmoving method‚Äù is the instant when the innate [joy] enters the dharmadhatu.üîΩThe infinite buddhafields, the immeasurable qualities, the elements such as space,

original: 62 / mtha' yas sangs rgyas zhing rnams dang ni dpag med yon tan rnams dang nam mkha' la sogs khams rnams dang // gnas dang skye dang nyams pa rnam gsum zhes pa'i srid pa dang ni 'gro ba drug tu sems can kun //
analyzed: 62 / mtha' yas sangs rgyas zhing rnams dang ni dpag med yon tan rnams dang nam mkha' la sogs khams rnams dang // gnas dang skye dang nyams pa rnam gsum zhes pa'i srid pa dang ni 'gro ba drug tu sems can kun //
translated: the three states of existence called ‚Äúabode, birth, and death,‚Äù and all sentient beings in the six realms,

original: sangs rgyas khro bo lha sogs rnams dang snying rje'i thugs ldan byang chub sems dpa' btsun mor bcas rnams te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khro bo lha sogs rnams dang snying rje'i thugs ldan byang chub sems dpa' btsun mor bcas rnams te //
translated: the wrathful buddhas, the gods, and so forth, and the bodhisattvas with compassionate minds and their queens,

original: 'di dag rnams ni srid pa gsum gyis phyag byas rgyal ba bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig yin no /üîΩ63 / spu dang pags pa sha khrag ro dang bcas pa dag kyang de bzhin rus pa dang @87a * //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni srid pa gsum gyis phyag byas rgyal ba bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig yin no / 63 / spu dang pags pa sha khrag ro dang bcas pa dag kyang de bzhin rus pa dang @87a * //
translated: these are the retinue of the sole wheel of the single blissful arising of the victors, who are worshipped by the three worlds.üîΩThe hair, skin, flesh, blood, and marrow, as well as the bones,

original: ni rkang dang rtsa //
analyzed: ni rkang dang rtsa //
translated: the sinews, and the channels,

original: de dag rnams la srog sogs rlung ste kun nas rlung gi dbus su nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams la srog sogs rlung ste kun nas rlung gi dbus su nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the wind, which is the life-force and so on, is the path of the sun and moon.

original: zla ba'i dbus su dri med nor bu bzhin du dngos po kun gyis 'khyud pa'i rnam par shes pa ste //
analyzed: zla ba'i dbus su dri med nor bu bzhin du dngos po kun gyis 'khyud pa'i rnam par shes pa ste //
translated: In the middle of the moon is consciousness, which is like a stainless gem, embraced by all things.

original: de ni dngos dang dngos med gnyis med nyid dang mchog gi bdud rtsi'i go 'phang khyab byed gzhom med do /
analyzed: de ni dngos dang dngos med gnyis med nyid dang mchog gi bdud rtsi'i go 'phang khyab byed gzhom med do /
translated: That is the state of non-duality of entity and non-entity, the supreme nectar, the omnipresent, indestructible reality.

original: 64 / spu la sogs pa zla ba'i mtha' ni mtha' dag lus la gnas rnams gang zhig sa bcur gsungs pa rnams //
analyzed: 64 / spu la sogs pa zla ba'i mtha' ni mtha' dag lus la gnas rnams gang zhig sa bcur gsungs pa rnams //
translated: The hairs and so on, the end of the moon, all the bodies, the ten stages,

original: sde pa drug dang la sogs gzhan rnams de dag dus kun rnal 'byor rnams la bde mnyam 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: sde pa drug dang la sogs gzhan rnams de dag dus kun rnal 'byor rnams la bde mnyam 'bras bu ster //
translated: the six classes, and so on, are always the cause of the result of the bliss of union for the yogis.

original: de phyir bla ma'i zhabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni thar pa'i slad du btsal bar bya //
analyzed: de phyir bla ma'i zhabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni thar pa'i slad du btsal bar bya //
translated: Therefore, the yogis who abide at the feet of the guru should seek liberation.

original: lus las ma gtogs gang zhig khyab byed thar pa ster ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa min /
analyzed: lus las ma gtogs gang zhig khyab byed thar pa ster ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa min /
translated: There is no other buddha who grants the omnipresent liberation apart from the body.

original: 65 / sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas yin te sangs rgyas chen po gzhan 'dir 'jig rten khams na yod ma yin //
analyzed: 65 / sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas yin te sangs rgyas chen po gzhan 'dir 'jig rten khams na yod ma yin //
translated: 65. The beings are the Buddhas; there is no other great Buddha in the universe.

original: de rnams mnyes par byas pas dpag med srid pa gcod par byed de rnam par mi rtog pa las so //
analyzed: de rnams mnyes par byas pas dpag med srid pa gcod par byed de rnam par mi rtog pa las so //
translated: By pleasing them, one cuts off the infinite series of births, by the non-discriminating intuition.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen po'i mtha' ru 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen po'i mtha' ru 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: But if the yogin hates them, he goes to the great Avici hell and so on.

original: de phyir sems ni dag pa na yang mkhas dang mi mkhas skye bo rnams la 'gal ba mi bya'o /
analyzed: de phyir sems ni dag pa na yang mkhas dang mi mkhas skye bo rnams la 'gal ba mi bya'o /
translated: Therefore, even when the mind is pure, one should not offend the ignorant or the learned.

original: 66 / sems can dag dang 'grogs pa thob nas mi yi bdag po dag pa'i byams pa la sogs sems su 'gyur //
analyzed: 66 / sems can dag dang 'grogs pa thob nas mi yi bdag po dag pa'i byams pa la sogs sems su 'gyur //
translated: When the lord of men has obtained the company of beings, his mind becomes pure love and so on.

original: mi dge'i yon tan dang ldan 'khor ba pa ni drug po rnams kyi zhe sdang chags sogs sems su 'gyur //
analyzed: mi dge'i yon tan dang ldan 'khor ba pa ni drug po rnams kyi zhe sdang chags sogs sems su 'gyur //
translated: When he has a retinue of men who have the qualities of the unwholesome, his mind becomes hatred, passion, and so on.

original: dus kun tu ni byang chub sems kyang 'gro ba dang ni 'gro bar 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: dus kun tu ni byang chub sems kyang 'gro ba dang ni 'gro bar 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is twofold: the going and the desire to go.

original: thar par 'jug pas dman zhing smod pa rnam par spangs pa dag ni thams cad dus su bdud kyi sems /
analyzed: thar par 'jug pas dman zhing smod pa rnam par spangs pa dag ni thams cad dus su bdud kyi sems /
translated: They are not inferior or contemptible, because they enter into liberation.

original: 67 / srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdud rnams zhi ba min pa dang ni byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba byed //
analyzed: 67 / srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdud rnams zhi ba min pa dang ni byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba byed //
translated: The demons are not pacified in the three worlds, but the Bodhisattvas pacify them.

original: bdud kyi dbang po rdzu 'phrul gyis dman mchog tu 'jigs byed yin te ston pa gcig pu rdzu 'phrul ldan //
analyzed: bdud kyi dbang po rdzu 'phrul gyis dman mchog tu 'jigs byed yin te ston pa gcig pu rdzu 'phrul ldan //
translated: The demons are terrified by the magic power of the Lord of the Demons, but the Teacher, who has magic power, is not.üîΩThe demons have the mentality of demons, but the protectors have the mentality of happiness, which enters the heart of another.

original: bdud rnams kyi ni bdud kyi blo dang skyob pa rnams kyi bde ba'i blo gros gzhan gyi snying la 'jug / de phyir sangs rgyas mthu rnams kyis ni srid pa gsum po mtha' dag mtha' yas dus su 'jug @87b par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdud rnams kyi ni bdud kyi blo dang skyob pa rnams kyi bde ba'i blo gros gzhan gyi snying la 'jug / de phyir sangs rgyas mthu rnams kyis ni srid pa gsum po mtha' dag mtha' yas dus su 'jug @87b par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the Buddhas, the entire three worlds enter into infinite time.

original: 68 / rgyal ba rnams kyis 'jig rten khams la tshad gsungs gang yin de yang mi rnams ye shes nyid ma yin //
analyzed: 68 / rgyal ba rnams kyis 'jig rten khams la tshad gsungs gang yin de yang mi rnams ye shes nyid ma yin //
translated: The measure of the world systems taught by the Victorious Ones is not the measure of knowledge for humans.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la lhan skyes lus kyi dbang gis khru ni gcig dang du ma dag gi tshad med de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la lhan skyes lus kyi dbang gis khru ni gcig dang du ma dag gi tshad med de //
translated: The Buddhas do not have a body born of the elements, with a measure of one cubit or many cubits.

original: las kyi sar ni srog chags rnams la sems can rjes mthun tshad dag rtag tu rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: las kyi sar ni srog chags rnams la sems can rjes mthun tshad dag rtag tu rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: On the stage of action, the life of beings is always clearly manifest in accordance with the measure of beings.

original: gal te tshad 'di bdag gi 'dod pa brjod na lha rnams kyis 'di med pa pa zhes brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te tshad 'di bdag gi 'dod pa brjod na lha rnams kyis 'di med pa pa zhes brjod par 'gyur /
translated: If this measure is expressed by me, the gods will say that it is non-existent.

original: 69 / gang gi rgyal ba'i dbang po skyed cing nyin zhag so so'i dbang las gang gis mngal nas nges par 'byung //
analyzed: 69 / gang gi rgyal ba'i dbang po skyed cing nyin zhag so so'i dbang las gang gis mngal nas nges par 'byung //
translated: By which the lord of the victors is generated, and by the power of each day, by which one definitely emerges from the womb.

original: skad cig gang gis 'gyur ba dag dang rnam par bral ba grub cing g-yo ba g-yo ba med gyur pa //
analyzed: skad cig gang gis 'gyur ba dag dang rnam par bral ba grub cing g-yo ba g-yo ba med gyur pa //
translated: By which instant one becomes free from change, accomplished, and unmoving.

original: sangs rgyas bya ba de spangs nas ni bde mnyam dang bral stong pa gzhan dag gang zhig sgom byed pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bya ba de spangs nas ni bde mnyam dang bral stong pa gzhan dag gang zhig sgom byed pa //
translated: Having abandoned that buddha activity, who else meditates on emptiness devoid of the bliss of equality?

original: de yi bskal pa bye ba du ma rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid dang lhan skyes bde ba dag kyang ring /
analyzed: de yi bskal pa bye ba du ma rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid dang lhan skyes bde ba dag kyang ring /
translated: By many millions of eons, buddhahood and innate bliss are far away.

original: 70 / nim pa'i shing las rgun 'brum min te dug las bdud rtsi dang ni tshangs pa'i shing las 'dam skyes dang // stong pa las ni myang 'das bde ba mi dge'i dbang las dge ba srog chags gsod las grub pa rnams //
analyzed: 70 / nim pa'i shing las rgun 'brum min te dug las bdud rtsi dang ni tshangs pa'i shing las 'dam skyes dang // stong pa las ni myang 'das bde ba mi dge'i dbang las dge ba srog chags gsod las grub pa rnams //
translated: From the power of evil comes good, and from the slaughter of living creatures, the attainment of perfection;

original: mchod sbyin dag las phyugs rnams mtho ris mchog tu zhi ba'i go 'phang dbang po rnams ni 'gog las min //
analyzed: mchod sbyin dag las phyugs rnams mtho ris mchog tu zhi ba'i go 'phang dbang po rnams ni 'gog las min //
translated: from the sacrifice of cattle, heaven; and the state of peace is not the result of the suppression of the senses.

original: rig byed las ni kun mkhyen gsung dang 'gyur med bde ba g-yo med 'gyur ba ma dag sems las min /
analyzed: rig byed las ni kun mkhyen gsung dang 'gyur med bde ba g-yo med 'gyur ba ma dag sems las min /
translated: The omniscience of the Vedas is not the result of the mind, nor is the bliss of immortality the result of an unmoving mind; nor is the purity of the mind the result of an impure mind.

original: 71 / sems can rnams kyi sdig pa'i sems ni mi yi bdag po bdud kyi tshogs kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 71 / sems can rnams kyi sdig pa'i sems ni mi yi bdag po bdud kyi tshogs kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur //
translated: The sinful thoughts of living beings are blessed by the hosts of Mara, the lords of men.

original: bsod nams ye shes rjes chags bde ster dag kyang rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes rjes chags bde ster dag kyang rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin brlabs pa'o //
translated: But the thoughts of the Bodhisattvas, which are full of merit and knowledge, which are devoted to the welfare of others, and which are the source of bliss, are always blessed by the Buddhas.

original: gang phyir bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis bdud dang nyon mongs bcom nas mya ngan 'das par 'gro byed pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis bdud dang nyon mongs bcom nas mya ngan 'das par 'gro byed pa //
translated: Because, by the power of the pledge of bliss, having conquered the demons and afflictions, one goes to nirvana.

original: de phyir bdud rnams nyi ma so so'i dus su de dag rnams la du ma yis ni bgegs rnams byed /
analyzed: de phyir bdud rnams nyi ma so so'i dus su de dag rnams la du ma yis ni bgegs rnams byed /
translated: Therefore, the demons, at their respective times, create many obstacles for them.

original: 72 / rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel ba'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bsten par bya //
analyzed: 72 / rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel ba'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bsten par bya //
translated: For the sake of increasing this innate bliss of the Victor, one should first rely on an action seal.

original: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni lus dang gdong dang rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni lus dang gdong dang rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
translated: Then, the form of the sun is the body, face, feet, and u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, complete with all limbs,

original: glog gi dbyug pa'i rjes mthun 'pho med bde ba skyed par byed ma @88a * //
analyzed: glog gi dbyug pa'i rjes mthun 'pho med bde ba skyed par byed ma @88a * //
translated: concordant with the lightning club, generating unchanging bliss.

original: mtshan nyid yan lag rab tu rdzogs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yan lag rab tu rdzogs //
translated: The characteristics and limbs are completely perfect.

original: rdo rje rnams kyis rab ru snang bar byed ma srid gsum gnas lus chos kyi dbyings ni de nas 'gyur /
analyzed: rdo rje rnams kyis rab ru snang bar byed ma srid gsum gnas lus chos kyi dbyings ni de nas 'gyur /
translated: Illuminated by the vajras, the realm of phenomena of the body and the world transform.

original: 73 /'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i 'bras ster phyag rgya bzhi po 'di rnams grong dang 'brog dgon dur khrod dang // mi gtsang ba dang gtsang ba'i gnas dang khyim dang lha yi khang pa thams cad du ni dus kun tu //
analyzed: 73 /'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i 'bras ster phyag rgya bzhi po 'di rnams grong dang 'brog dgon dur khrod dang // mi gtsang ba dang gtsang ba'i gnas dang khyim dang lha yi khang pa thams cad du ni dus kun tu //
translated: These four seals, which bestow the fruit of unchanging bliss, are to be cultivated by yogis everywhere, in town and in the forest, in the charnel ground, in the pure and the impure, in the house and in the temple.

original: shin tu dga' ba'i dga' ba la gnas 'jig rten lam las rab grol rigs dang rigs min mngon spyod cing //
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba'i dga' ba la gnas 'jig rten lam las rab grol rigs dang rigs min mngon spyod cing //
translated: Abiding in the bliss of supreme joy, free from the worldly path, engaging in the proper and improper,

original: lus stobs bde ster bza' ba btung ba la sogs longs spyod dang ldan rnal 'byor rnams kyis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: lus stobs bde ster bza' ba btung ba la sogs longs spyod dang ldan rnal 'byor rnams kyis bsgom par bya /
translated: endowed with enjoyments such as food and drink that bestow the bliss of bodily strength,

original: 74 / rlung ni yang dag phrad pa rnams kyis glog gi me yi rtse mos spyi bo'i zla ba zhu bar byed //
analyzed: 74 / rlung ni yang dag phrad pa rnams kyis glog gi me yi rtse mos spyi bo'i zla ba zhu bar byed //
translated: the yogis should cultivate the fire of lightning at the crown moon, which is ignited by the correct union of the winds.üîΩThe moon melts from the drops that fall from there, stopping at the throat, heart, navel, and secret place.

original: thig le gang gang zhu ba 'di las mgrin pa snying ga la son lte ba gsang ba dag la 'gog / thig le las ni g-yo ba'i khu ba rdo rje nor bu la gnas rgyal mtshan rtse la 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: thig le gang gang zhu ba 'di las mgrin pa snying ga la son lte ba gsang ba dag la 'gog / thig le las ni g-yo ba'i khu ba rdo rje nor bu la gnas rgyal mtshan rtse la 'gog pa gang //
translated: The moving essence that is from the drop stops at the tip of the victory banner, which is located at the vajra jewel.

original: de ni shes rab ye shes skad cig gal te thig le'i phreng ba 'pho ba med pas bde ster na'o /
analyzed: de ni shes rab ye shes skad cig gal te thig le'i phreng ba 'pho ba med pas bde ster na'o /
translated: If the garland of drops is not transferred, then there is bliss, which is the moment of the gnosis of the wisdom consort empowerment.

original: 75 / de phyir g-yo med bde ba'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings kyis ster byed do //
analyzed: 75 / de phyir g-yo med bde ba'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings kyis ster byed do //
translated: Therefore, the dhatu of phenomena bestows the innate, unmoving bliss in this life.

original: srog gis ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa thams cad bkug cing nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom byas nas ;
analyzed: srog gis ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa thams cad bkug cing nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom byas nas ;
translated: Having summoned all the life-winds of the corpse and having conquered the afflictive maras,

original: / rdzu 'phrul kun mkhyen sa dang srid gsum bla ma nyid ni rnal 'byor rnams kyi skye ba 'di las te //
analyzed: / rdzu 'phrul kun mkhyen sa dang srid gsum bla ma nyid ni rnal 'byor rnams kyi skye ba 'di las te //
translated: the yogi/nis attain the state of omniscience, the state of magical powers, the state of the three worlds, and the state of the guru in this life.

original: gal te lam du rab zhugs shi bar 'gyur na de tshe de yi 'dzin pas skye ba gzhan la'o /
analyzed: gal te lam du rab zhugs shi bar 'gyur na de tshe de yi 'dzin pas skye ba gzhan la'o /
translated: If they die while on the path, then they attain these in another life through the power of their practice.

original: 76 / gang zhig yon tan med cing dngos chung yul dang rnam bral de ni sku yi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: 76 / gang zhig yon tan med cing dngos chung yul dang rnam bral de ni sku yi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis /
translated: The two mudras of the body are the one without qualities and the one with few qualities, and the one that is free from objects.

original: de nas chags pa rjes chags dang ni yon tan gter gzhan dag kyang gsung gi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: de nas chags pa rjes chags dang ni yon tan gter gzhan dag kyang gsung gi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The two natures of speech are the treasure of qualities and the other one, which is the nature of speech.

original: gnag dang dkar la rjes chags yul gyi yon tan la dga' thugs kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis 'gyur te //
analyzed: gnag dang dkar la rjes chags yul gyi yon tan la dga' thugs kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis 'gyur te //
translated: The two seals of the mind are the seal of the black and the seal of the white, which are the delight in the qualities of the object of attachment.

original: brgyad dang gnyis dang lnga dang lnga dang gsal bar mkha' dus dang ni stong pa rig byed dag gi lo /
analyzed: brgyad dang gnyis dang lnga dang lnga dang gsal bar mkha' dus dang ni stong pa rig byed dag gi lo /
translated: The years of the sky, the time, and the empty vidyƒÅ are clearly eight, two, five, and five.

original: 77 / rin chen dbang po mi 'byung bar du rgyal ba mchog skyed ma ni rnal 'byor pa yis bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: 77 / rin chen dbang po mi 'byung bar du rgyal ba mchog skyed ma ni rnal 'byor pa yis bsrung bar bya //
translated: Until the appearance of the precious lord, the supreme Victor, the mother should be protected by the yogƒ´.

original: rin chen dbang po rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas //
translated: At the time of the appearance of the precious lord, having erected the ma·πá·∏çala of the treasure of all good qualities,

original: sangs rgyas byin brlabs sngags rnams @88b kyis ni gsang ba'i padmar bde mnyam sngags dang bcas pa spro bya ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byin brlabs sngags rnams @88b kyis ni gsang ba'i padmar bde mnyam sngags dang bcas pa spro bya ste //
translated: the secret mantra should be emanated into the secret lotus together with the mantra of the bliss of union, blessed by the buddhas.

original: gsang bar bsrung ba rab tu byas nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas byang chub sems ni myang bar bya /
analyzed: gsang bar bsrung ba rab tu byas nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas byang chub sems ni myang bar bya /
translated: Having well protected the secret, one should taste the bodhicitta located in the vajra jewel.

original: 78 / de la gang zhig bu ru gyur pa rgyal ba skyed byed sras po de ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: 78 / de la gang zhig bu ru gyur pa rgyal ba skyed byed sras po de ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje nyid //
translated: The son who is born there, the son who produces the Victor, is Ma√±juvajra himself.

original: shes rab lhag pa las ni 'ga' zhig tshe na bu mor 'gyur te nges par sangs rgyas yum du 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab lhag pa las ni 'ga' zhig tshe na bu mor 'gyur te nges par sangs rgyas yum du 'gyur //
translated: From the predominance of wisdom, some become daughters, and they are certainly destined to be the mothers of Buddhas.

original: de nas gzhan ma me tog gsum gyi padma dkar 'dzin dzam bha la dang phyag na rdo rje ste //
analyzed: de nas gzhan ma me tog gsum gyi padma dkar 'dzin dzam bha la dang phyag na rdo rje ste //
translated: Then, the other three flowers are the Padmanartte≈õvara Jambhala and VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: me tog brgyad kyis gzhan brgyad phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas rdzu 'phrul tshad ldan khro bo'i rgyal po rnams /
analyzed: me tog brgyad kyis gzhan brgyad phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas rdzu 'phrul tshad ldan khro bo'i rgyal po rnams /
translated: The other eight flowers are the eight great wrathful kings who reside in the directions and intermediate directions, endowed with magical power.

original: 79 / zla ba de la rdul gang rab tu byung ba de ni slar yang 'jam dbyangs rab tu skyed pa ste //
analyzed: 79 / zla ba de la rdul gang rab tu byung ba de ni slar yang 'jam dbyangs rab tu skyed pa ste //
translated: The dust that arises from that moon is again the generation of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: lo ni nyi shu dag gi bar du so so'i rdul la byang chub sems dpa' snying stobs chen po ste //
analyzed: lo ni nyi shu dag gi bar du so so'i rdul la byang chub sems dpa' snying stobs chen po ste //
translated: For twenty years, in each dust particle, there is a bodhisattva of great courage.

original: de nas stong pa dang ni rig byed bar du cung zad snying stobs cha shas dman par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas stong pa dang ni rig byed bar du cung zad snying stobs cha shas dman par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: Then, from the emptiness up to the Vedas, the part of sattva becomes slightly diminished.

original: slar yang lo ni nyi shu'i bar du de bas kyang ni snying stobs chung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'o /
analyzed: slar yang lo ni nyi shu'i bar du de bas kyang ni snying stobs chung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'o /
translated: Again, for twenty years, the sattva becomes even less and less courageous.

original: 80 / de nas skye gnas la ni rdul med yul ni rab tu bcom pa'o de nyams pa las dbang ma yin //
analyzed: 80 / de nas skye gnas la ni rdul med yul ni rab tu bcom pa'o de nyams pa las dbang ma yin //
translated: Then, in the place of birth, the seed is without impurity, the place is well destroyed, and from that destruction, there is no power.

original: 'on kyang sa bon nyams pa la ni shes rab dbang bskur rgyal ba'i dbang po'i gsung gis sbyin par bya //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon nyams pa la ni shes rab dbang bskur rgyal ba'i dbang po'i gsung gis sbyin par bya //
translated: However, the seed is destroyed, and the wisdom initiation is given by the speech of the king of victors.

original: de dag rnams kyi sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i yon tan rgyal ba'i yan lag dag gis btsal bar bya //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i yon tan rgyal ba'i yan lag dag gis btsal bar bya //
translated: Their earth, water, fire, wind, and space qualities are sought with the branches of the victor.

original: byang chub sems kyi bsnyen pa 'di ni sems can don gyi byed pa mo ste 'bras bu mang por 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsnyen pa 'di ni sems can don gyi byed pa mo ste 'bras bu mang por 'gyur /
translated: This service of bodhicitta is the agent for the benefit of sentient beings, which becomes the many results.

original: 81 / gang zhig khrag ni 'thung byed rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi sbrang bu de ni bdud rtsi gcig pu ste //
analyzed: 81 / gang zhig khrag ni 'thung byed rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi sbrang bu de ni bdud rtsi gcig pu ste //
translated: The blood that is drunk is the supreme nectar of gods and humans, the bee.

original: skyugs pa snying ga gsang ba'i kha nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas chu skyes nang du rab zhugs min //
analyzed: skyugs pa snying ga gsang ba'i kha nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas chu skyes nang du rab zhugs min //
translated: The vomit is not in the center of the lotus located in the vajra jewel through the mouth of the throat and heart.

original: bshang ba gci ba khrag dang sha ni mchog tu ro mnyam skyugs pa'i dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: bshang ba gci ba khrag dang sha ni mchog tu ro mnyam skyugs pa'i dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ste //
translated: The vomit is in the center of the supreme equal taste of feces, urine, blood, and flesh.

original: 'di dag rnams ni ye shes bdud rtsi srid pa gsum gyi bla ma yis kyang rgyud rnams kun tu bstan /
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni ye shes bdud rtsi srid pa gsum gyi bla ma yis kyang rgyud rnams kun tu bstan /
translated: These are taught in all the tantras by the guru of the three worlds, the nectar of wisdom.

original: 82 / shes rab chos 'byung la ni gang zhig lhung ba'i bde ba dag kyang rab tu 'bad pas bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: 82 / shes rab chos 'byung la ni gang zhig lhung ba'i bde ba dag kyang rab tu 'bad pas bsrung bar bya //
translated: The bliss that falls into the lotus of wisdom should be protected with effort.

original: de yis sems can gang dag su zhig byung ba de ni rgyal ba'i rigs la byang chub sems dpa' nyid //
analyzed: de yis sems can gang dag su zhig byung ba de ni rgyal ba'i rigs la byang chub sems dpa' nyid //
translated: Whoever is born as a sentient being in that way is a bodhisattva in the family of the victors.

original: de phyir de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su bdud kyi pho nya srin po rnams kyis za ru 'jug / shes rab me tog dang ldan zos pa zhi ba @89a * //
analyzed: de phyir de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su bdud kyi pho nya srin po rnams kyis za ru 'jug / shes rab me tog dang ldan zos pa zhi ba @89a * //
translated: Therefore, the messengers of MƒÅra, the rƒÅk·π£asas, are sent to eat [the bodhisattva] every day.

original: bde ba'i 'bras bu ster bar ston du 'jug par byed /
analyzed: bde ba'i 'bras bu ster bar ston du 'jug par byed /
translated: The flower of wisdom is shown to give the fruit of peace and bliss.

original: 83 / mchog gi bde ba la gnas rdo rje ma 'khums nyid kyi bar du chu skyes las ni dbyung mi bya //
analyzed: 83 / mchog gi bde ba la gnas rdo rje ma 'khums nyid kyi bar du chu skyes las ni dbyung mi bya //
translated: The vajra woman should not be drawn out of the lotus until she is in the state of supreme bliss.

original: gang tshe 'dod pa grub pa de yi tshe  na 'di ni sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dod pa grub pa de yi tshe  na 'di ni sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: When the desire is fulfilled, she becomes the consecration of the buddhas.

original: rdo rje chu skyes dag nas gzhug bya rang gi rdo rje'i snying gar ye shes 'khor lo rab bcug ste //
analyzed: rdo rje chu skyes dag nas gzhug bya rang gi rdo rje'i snying gar ye shes 'khor lo rab bcug ste //
translated: Having been introduced by the vajra lotus, one should enter one‚Äôs own vajra heart, having introduced the wheel of wisdom.

original: 'di yis 'od zer rnams kyis gnyi ga'i lus ni gang bar byas nas rnam pa thams cad pa nyid byed /
analyzed: 'di yis 'od zer rnams kyis gnyi ga'i lus ni gang bar byas nas rnam pa thams cad pa nyid byed /
translated: By this, the bodies of both are filled with light rays, and one should make them of all forms.

original: 84 / gal te 'di ni grub par ma gyur rdo rje nor bu la ni yang dag gnas pa bza' bar bya //
analyzed: 84 / gal te 'di ni grub par ma gyur rdo rje nor bu la ni yang dag gnas pa bza' bar bya //
translated: If this is not accomplished, one should eat, abiding in the vajra jewel.

original: shes rab kyi ni chos 'byung gnas la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs ni bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni chos 'byung gnas la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs ni bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
translated: In the abode of the lotus of wisdom, one should place the entire family of the Victor for the sake of protection.

original: shes rab ldan pa la'o de nas gcig pu la ste slar yang gsung ni rab gsungs sangs rgyas sku //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa la'o de nas gcig pu la ste slar yang gsung ni rab gsungs sangs rgyas sku //
translated: Then, to the one endowed with wisdom, alone, the Buddha‚Äôs speech is again proclaimed.

original: gang su 'di ni nyams la mngon par dga' byed g-yon can de ni rdo rje can gyis gsod par byed /
analyzed: gang su 'di ni nyams la mngon par dga' byed g-yon can de ni rdo rje can gyis gsod par byed /
translated: Whoever delights in this transgression, that deceiver is killed by the vajra holder.

original: 85 / srid pa gsum gyi bdag pos drag po'i las kyi rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang //
analyzed: 85 / srid pa gsum gyi bdag pos drag po'i las kyi rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang //
translated: Whatever fierce actions of the lord of the three worlds, the various mantras, are proclaimed,

original: de dag thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed srog chags rnams la nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed srog chags rnams la nam yang ma yin no //
translated: They are never the cause of fear for living beings, who are on the side of the demons.

original: gang zhig dran pa rnams kyi byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dran pa rnams kyi byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa //
translated: Those who are the authors of the Vedas, who delight in the objects of the senses, who are fond of battle, who are killers, and who are non-Buddhists,

original: de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de dag sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de dag sbyar bar bya /
translated: for them the supreme sons of the Victor have composed the protection of living beings.

original: 86 / mkha' 'gro rdo rje sngon rnams phyugs kyi skye bo gsod la sangs rgyas pa yis gsol ba gdab mi bya //
analyzed: 86 / mkha' 'gro rdo rje sngon rnams phyugs kyi skye bo gsod la sangs rgyas pa yis gsol ba gdab mi bya //
translated: The sky-wanderers, the vajra-holders, the killers of the animal-born, the Buddhists, should not pray to them.

original: sems can rnams ni bsrung ba'i don du srid pa gsum gyi bla mas 'jig rten khams su spros pa ste //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni bsrung ba'i don du srid pa gsum gyi bla mas 'jig rten khams su spros pa ste //
translated: For the sake of protecting living beings, the lords of the three worlds have emanated in the world.

original: de phyir de rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su srung bar byed cing sgrub pa po la sdang bar byed //
analyzed: de phyir de rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su srung bar byed cing sgrub pa po la sdang bar byed //
translated: Therefore, they protect on each day and time, and are hostile to the practitioner.

original: bsgrub bya dag ni las kyi mthu yis shi bar gyur na 'di ni sgrub pa po yi bdud yin no /
analyzed: bsgrub bya dag ni las kyi mthu yis shi bar gyur na 'di ni sgrub pa po yi bdud yin no /
translated: If the one to be accomplished dies by the power of karma, this is a demon for the practitioner.

original: 87 / skyes bu rnams kyi sems ni kun nas mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis phran tshegs rig pa la rjes chags //
analyzed: 87 / skyes bu rnams kyi sems ni kun nas mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis phran tshegs rig pa la rjes chags //
translated: The minds of men, by the power of the results of their evil actions, are attached to the knowledge of trifles.

original: rig pa 'di yis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag skad cig gis ni bdag gi dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'di yis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag skad cig gis ni bdag gi dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: By this knowledge, the three worlds, in a moment, come under their control.üîΩWith this thought, avaricious, they abandon the knowledge of the mind, and enter into hell.

original: zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags sems kyi ye shes sbyin pa rnam par spangs nas dmyal bar rab tu 'jug / rgyab tu rdzas dang rang gi khyim thab gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur kye  ma ngan pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug 88 /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags sems kyi ye shes sbyin pa rnam par spangs nas dmyal bar rab tu 'jug / rgyab tu rdzas dang rang gi khyim thab gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur kye  ma ngan pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug 88 /
translated: They are attached to the bad dharma, which is the cause of the loss of their wealth, their wives, and their homes.

original: @89b shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste chos kyi skur gyur pa //
analyzed: @89b shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste chos kyi skur gyur pa //
translated: This is the innate body, the dharmakaya, which is neither wisdom nor method.

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes dang ni rnam shes dbye ba las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes dang ni rnam shes dbye ba las //
translated: It is the sambhogakaya, which is the division of wisdom and consciousness, the nature of wisdom and method, and is certainly free from darkness.

original: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po //
analyzed: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po //
translated: It is the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya, which is the doer of the benefit of many sentient beings, like an echo.

original: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du slar yang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du slar yang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur /
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings, he becomes the Emanation Body of the Buddhas.

original: 89 / rdo rje sems dpa' gcig pu 'di ni dus mtha'i sprin dang mtshungs pa he ru kar  ni byung bar gyur //
analyzed: 89 / rdo rje sems dpa' gcig pu 'di ni dus mtha'i sprin dang mtshungs pa he ru kar  ni byung bar gyur //
translated: This sole Vajrasattva, like the cloud of the end of the aeon, arises as Heruka.

original: gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don te de yang dam tshig rgyal ba rmongs pa rnams ni bde ba'i don //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don te de yang dam tshig rgyal ba rmongs pa rnams ni bde ba'i don //
translated: For the sake of ripening the wicked, and also for the sake of the bliss of the confused who are the victors of commitment,

original: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa rnams kyi de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa rnams kyi de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad //
translated: Ratnasa·πÉbhava, for the sake of those who are suffering, and also for the sake of the passion of those who hold the lotus and are passionate,

original: bgegs rnams dag ni gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri don yod grub par byung bar gyur /
analyzed: bgegs rnams dag ni gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri don yod grub par byung bar gyur /
translated: the lotus hand of Amoghasiddhi arises as a sword for the sake of destroying obstacles.

original: 90 / zhe sdang las ni sna tshogs yum gang dus mtha'i rtse mo can mtshungs de ni mkha' 'go mar byung gyur //
analyzed: 90 / zhe sdang las ni sna tshogs yum gang dus mtha'i rtse mo can mtshungs de ni mkha' 'go mar byung gyur //
translated: From hatred arises VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, like the peak of the end of the aeon, who arises as NairƒÅtmyƒÅ.

original: gti mug dag las spyan ma zhes bya mchog gi snying rje m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal rgyu las so //
analyzed: gti mug dag las spyan ma zhes bya mchog gi snying rje m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal rgyu las so //
translated: From delusion arises LocanƒÅ, the supreme compassion, MƒÅmakƒ´, from pride,

original: chags las de ni gos dkar zhes bya mtha' dag yon tan gter te sgrol ma yang ni phrag dog las //
analyzed: chags las de ni gos dkar zhes bya mtha' dag yon tan gter te sgrol ma yang ni phrag dog las //
translated: From attachment, he is PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, a treasure of all good qualities, and also TƒÅrƒÅ from jealousy.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can gnyis po 'di dag g-yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad du yang byung bar gyur /
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can gnyis po 'di dag g-yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad du yang byung bar gyur /
translated: These two, having various forms, have arisen in all the battles and places of all others.

original: 91 / phung po lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs pa brtse ba yis //
analyzed: 91 / phung po lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs pa brtse ba yis //
translated: Out of love, he resides in the bhagas of the Vajra Queen, who is of the nature of the five aggregates,

original: nges pa rnam par ma bsgrubs bsod nams min pa bsags pa'i sems can rnams ni smin pa'i don du ste //
analyzed: nges pa rnam par ma bsgrubs bsod nams min pa bsags pa'i sems can rnams ni smin pa'i don du ste //
translated: for the sake of ripening sentient beings who have accumulated demerits without establishing certainty,

original: gtsang ma'i gnas la sogs par bcom ldan gang zhig rnam par bzhugs pa nyan thos rnams kyi slad du'o //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas la sogs par bcom ldan gang zhig rnam par bzhugs pa nyan thos rnams kyi slad du'o //
translated: and for the sake of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the BhagavƒÅn who resides in the pure abodes, and so on.

original: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog gi nges pa can rnams mchog la dgod pa'i don du'o /
analyzed: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog gi nges pa can rnams mchog la dgod pa'i don du'o /
translated: For the sake of establishing those who are certain in the supreme, abiding in the syllable eva·πÉ, in the supreme,

original: 92 / sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dus kun tu //
analyzed: 92 / sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dus kun tu //
translated: and for the sake of ripening sentient beings, always with the divisions of body, speech, and mind,

original: nges par rdo rje can gyi bzhugs pa rnam gsum phyi dang nang dang gzhan du yang ni rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par rdo rje can gyi bzhugs pa rnam gsum phyi dang nang dang gzhan du yang ni rab tu 'gyur //
translated: are certainly external, internal, and other.

original: phyi rol sna tshogs phyogs su 'gyur te mchog gi lus la srog gi rlung ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol sna tshogs phyogs su 'gyur te mchog gi lus la srog gi rlung ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: The external is the various directions, and the supreme body is the movement of the life-force wind.

original: khyab bdag gi ni sa sogs dkyil 'khor dag la rab gyur gang de rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la /üîΩ93 / sgra la sogs la @90a * //
analyzed: khyab bdag gi ni sa sogs dkyil 'khor dag la rab gyur gang de rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la / 93 / sgra la sogs la @90a * //
translated: The pervasion of the all-pervading lord is in the ma·πá·∏çalas of earth and so on, which is the bhaga of the Vajra Queen.

original: gang zhig rang sems 'gro ste yul med pa yang zhan ni de bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rang sems 'gro ste yul med pa yang zhan ni de bzhin kho na'o //
translated: The one who goes to sound and so on with one's own mind, even without an object, is just so.

original: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog tu bde ba'i gnas la sku gsung thugs ni zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog tu bde ba'i gnas la sku gsung thugs ni zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who abides in the syllable evam, in the abode of supreme bliss, is engaged in body, speech, and mind.

original: gcig pu rdo rje can ni dbye ba gsum ste yul dang yul can khams rnams kyis kyang bskor ba'o //
analyzed: gcig pu rdo rje can ni dbye ba gsum ste yul dang yul can khams rnams kyis kyang bskor ba'o //
translated: The sole Vajrin is threefold, surrounded by the objects, subjects, and elements.

original: dus gsum gnas gsum du bzhugs srid pa gsum du'ang gnas pa sems can du ma'i don gyi slad du'o /
analyzed: dus gsum gnas gsum du bzhugs srid pa gsum du'ang gnas pa sems can du ma'i don gyi slad du'o /
translated: Abiding in the three times, three places, and three existences, for the sake of the welfare of many sentient beings.

original: 94 / rgyud rnams dag las 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes gsungs pa gang de 'di ltar bdag gis shes pa ste //
analyzed: 94 / rgyud rnams dag las 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes gsungs pa gang de 'di ltar bdag gis shes pa ste //
translated: 1. In the Tantras it is said, ‚ÄúThus have I heard,‚Äù and this is understood by me in the following way:

original: rdo rje can ni zla ba zhu las rdo rje gang zhig spyi mgrin snying ga'i chu skyes lte gsang dang // bud med rnams kyi bha gar de ni thig le grol ba gsum gyis mchog gi padma la gnas pa //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni zla ba zhu las rdo rje gang zhig spyi mgrin snying ga'i chu skyes lte gsang dang // bud med rnams kyi bha gar de ni thig le grol ba gsum gyis mchog gi padma la gnas pa //
translated: The vajra-holder, having melted into the moon, is the vajra, which is on the lotuses of the forehead, throat, heart, navel, and sexual organ, and in the bhaga of women, and is the bindu, liberated by the three joys, and is on the supreme lotus.

original: de 'dir sangs rgyas zhing du rab tu zhugs pa bcom ldan 'das su rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya /
analyzed: de 'dir sangs rgyas zhing du rab tu zhugs pa bcom ldan 'das su rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya /
translated: This is the Buddha-field here, and the yogis know the Lord who has entered it.

original: 95 / skye ba snga mar rang gi snying gis bskyed pa'i zhi dang chags pa la sogs dngos po rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: 95 / skye ba snga mar rang gi snying gis bskyed pa'i zhi dang chags pa la sogs dngos po rnams kyi ni //
translated: 2. The things, such as peace and passion, created by the heart in a previous life,

original: bag chags stobs kyis 'khor lor gnas pa gcig ni du mar mthong ste smon lam yon tan dbang gis so //
analyzed: bag chags stobs kyis 'khor lor gnas pa gcig ni du mar mthong ste smon lam yon tan dbang gis so //
translated: are seen as many by the power of the habit-energy, which is on the wheel, by the power of the prayer and the qualities.

original: don gcig du ma'i skad ni rang rang dngos po rnams kyi  sa srog chags rnams kyi snying la rab tu 'jug / gnas can rnams kyi bsod nams slad du 'khor lo la gnas bsod snyoms la ni rnam par rgyu ru gshegs /üîΩ96 / dud 'gro yi dags lha min rnams dang lto 'phye lha dang mi ni 'phags pa bod la sogs rnams la //
analyzed: don gcig du ma'i skad ni rang rang dngos po rnams kyi  sa srog chags rnams kyi snying la rab tu 'jug / gnas can rnams kyi bsod nams slad du 'khor lo la gnas bsod snyoms la ni rnam par rgyu ru gshegs / 96 / dud 'gro yi dags lha min rnams dang lto 'phye lha dang mi ni 'phags pa bod la sogs rnams la //
translated: For the sake of the merit of those who are ready, he goes out on his alms round, remaining in the world.

original: byung dang 'byung 'gyur da ltar byung ba rnam pa gsum dang rtag tu bden pa'i chos ni gsung byed cing //
analyzed: byung dang 'byung 'gyur da ltar byung ba rnam pa gsum dang rtag tu bden pa'i chos ni gsung byed cing //
