analyzed: mchod sbyin la ni phyugs rnams 'tshe dang g-yul du shi bar gyur na mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu @100b 'jug //
translated: Those who fall into the water while trying to save their bodies, those who die in a sacrifice, those who are killed in battle,üîΩthose who die for the sake of their sons in the fire, and those who die for the sake of their relatives through merit‚ÄîüîΩthey go to heaven.üîΩThose who fall into the water while trying to save their bodies, those who die in a sacrifice, those who are killed in battle,

original: 'jug ngogs lus po lhung las mchog gi go 'phang 'gro ba de rnams thar pa ster ba'i chos ma yin /
analyzed: 'jug ngogs lus po lhung las mchog gi go 'phang 'gro ba de rnams thar pa ster ba'i chos ma yin /
translated: those who die for the sake of their sons in the fire, and those who die for the sake of their relatives through merit‚ÄîüîΩthey go to heaven.

original: 195 / de nyid lam ni rnam par spangs nas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog pa khyod kyi ma gang pa ni gang //
analyzed: 195 / de nyid lam ni rnam par spangs nas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog pa khyod kyi ma gang pa ni gang //
translated: Those who fall into the water while trying to save their bodies, those who die in a sacrifice, those who are killed in battle,üîΩthose who die for the sake of their sons in the fire, and those who die for the sake of their relatives through merit‚ÄîüîΩthey go to heaven.üîΩThose who fall into the water while trying to save their bodies, those who die in a sacrifice, those who are killed in battle,

original: mchog gi bu dang bu mo spun zla chung ma sring mo rnams dang rje bo gnyen gyi sde ni gang //
analyzed: mchog gi bu dang bu mo spun zla chung ma sring mo rnams dang rje bo gnyen gyi sde ni gang //
translated: those who die for the sake of their sons in the fire, and those who die for the sake of their relatives through merit‚ÄîüîΩthey go to heaven.üîΩThose who fall into the water while trying to save their bodies, those who die in a sacrifice, those who are killed in battle,

original: bdag gis byin gyis brlab pa'i drang srong 'di rnams 'khor lo'i dbus 'dir gang gis thar par 'gro 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bdag gis byin gyis brlab pa'i drang srong 'di rnams 'khor lo'i dbus 'dir gang gis thar par 'gro 'gyur ba //
translated: those who die for the sake of

original: de yis nyi ma khyod kyis thub pa rnams ni bdag gi tshig las rigs gcig dag la 'jug par mdzod /
analyzed: de yis nyi ma khyod kyis thub pa rnams ni bdag gi tshig las rigs gcig dag la 'jug par mdzod /
translated: The Buddha said, ‚ÄúThe wise should apply my words to the class of those who are like me.‚Äù

original: 196 / gal te lus la dbyug pa bsnun pas sdug bsngal 'gyur na de la dbyug pa dag ni nyes pa can //
analyzed: 196 / gal te lus la dbyug pa bsnun pas sdug bsngal 'gyur na de la dbyug pa dag ni nyes pa can //
translated: If pain arises from striking the body with a stick, then the stick is at fault.

original: dbyug pa 'di ni ma yin lag pas rab tu bskul te 'dir ni nyes pa mtha' dag lag pa yi //
analyzed: dbyug pa 'di ni ma yin lag pas rab tu bskul te 'dir ni nyes pa mtha' dag lag pa yi //
translated: The stick is not at fault; it is the hand that is at fault, for it is the one that wields the stick.üîΩThe hand is not at fault; it is the mind that is at fault, for it is the one that instigates the hand.

original: 'di ni ma yin sems kyis bskul te sems kyang 'dir ni gdug pa chen po khro ba'i me yis so //
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin sems kyis bskul te sems kyang 'dir ni gdug pa chen po khro ba'i me yis so //
translated: The mind is not at fault; it is the great demon of anger that is at fault, for it is the one that instigates the mind.

original: de phyir khro bo'i me 'di 'gro ba'i dgra bo bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gsod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de phyir khro bo'i me 'di 'gro ba'i dgra bo bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gsod par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the fire of anger is to be killed by the bodhisattvas, just as one would kill an enemy of the world.

original: 197 / chags las sdang sogs skyon te rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi rang 'dod chung ma gzhan dang 'grogs las so //
analyzed: 197 / chags las sdang sogs skyon te rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi rang 'dod chung ma gzhan dang 'grogs las so //
translated: Hatred and so forth arise from attachment. The fault is the desire of gods and humans to consort with other people‚Äôs wives and so forth.

original: de ni rtsa nas dbyung slad mtha' dag rgyal sras rnams kyis de ni 'dod pa'i sbyin la rab tu byin //
analyzed: de ni rtsa nas dbyung slad mtha' dag rgyal sras rnams kyis de ni 'dod pa'i sbyin la rab tu byin //
translated: In order to uproot that, the bodhisattvas give away their wives as gifts to those who desire them.

original: de phyir sbyin la rjes su chags pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster pa bsod nams dag gi tshogs 'di ni //
analyzed: de phyir sbyin la rjes su chags pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster pa bsod nams dag gi tshogs 'di ni //
translated: Therefore, the accumulation of merit, which is the cause of the result of the bliss of the equality of giving,

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gnyen du gyur cing thams cad dus su skye bo rnams kyi dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog 198 /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gnyen du gyur cing thams cad dus su skye bo rnams kyi dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog 198 /
translated: is the friend of the three worlds, and at all times it takes away the fear of hell from beings.

original: chags pa gang gis sems can rnams ni nyams par gyur pa de yis skyob pa rnams ni grol ba ste //
analyzed: chags pa gang gis sems can rnams ni nyams par gyur pa de yis skyob pa rnams ni grol ba ste //
translated: Those who are liberated from the attachment by which beings are destroyed are the protectors.

original: sems can rnams kyis nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig srung byed de ni skyob rnams ster bar byed //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig srung byed de ni skyob rnams ster bar byed //
translated: Day by day, at the proper time, those who protect beings are the bestowers of protection.

original: sems can rnams kyis rang snying la gnas bde ba gang zhig gtong byed de ni rgyal rnams srung bar mdzad //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis rang snying la gnas bde ba gang zhig gtong byed de ni rgyal rnams srung bar mdzad //
translated: The bliss that beings give to their own hearts is the protection that the victors give.

original: des na rgyal ba mchog gi spyod pa 'di ni lha klu lha min rnams kyis bya ba dka' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rgyal ba mchog gi spyod pa 'di ni lha klu lha min rnams kyis bya ba dka' bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, this conduct of the supreme victors is difficult for gods, nagas, and demigods to perform.

original: 199 / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' yon tan yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin srog dang ni //
analyzed: 199 / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' yon tan yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin srog dang ni //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, space, qualities, mind, intellect, the apprehension of the ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and life

original: gzugs la sogs dang mig @101a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs dang mig @101a * //
translated: Form and so on and the eye,üîΩ

original: la sogs pa yul dang yul can rnams dang las kyi dbang po lnga rnams te //
analyzed: la sogs pa yul dang yul can rnams dang las kyi dbang po lnga rnams te //
translated: The elements are earth, water, fire, air, and space. The sense objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and touch. The sense faculties are the eye, etc., and the five faculties of action.

original: phyugs dang bcas pa mi yi lus la khyab byed 'di rnams dag las rigs ni thu bo gzhon nu gang //
analyzed: phyugs dang bcas pa mi yi lus la khyab byed 'di rnams dag las rigs ni thu bo gzhon nu gang //
translated: These are the pervading principles in the human body, along with the cattle. Which of these is the most important family, O young man?

original: mi bdag dang bcas mi yi bla ma rigs dregs nga rgyal can khyod gang gis rigs ni thu bo yin /
analyzed: mi bdag dang bcas mi yi bla ma rigs dregs nga rgyal can khyod gang gis rigs ni thu bo yin /
translated: By what is your family the most important, O you who are proud of your family, O you who are arrogant, O you who are the guru of men, O you who are the lord of men?

original: 200 / bsreg bya sa dang dri ma med pa chu ru rab tu 'gyur te tu ttha ka ni me nyid do //
analyzed: 200 / bsreg bya sa dang dri ma med pa chu ru rab tu 'gyur te tu ttha ka ni me nyid do //
translated: The fuel is earth, and the pure substance is water. The tathagata is fire.

original: rlung dang nam mkha' 'dres pa'i khams ni g-yo ba dang bcas ri bong can dang mtshal ni bdun pa yang //
analyzed: rlung dang nam mkha' 'dres pa'i khams ni g-yo ba dang bcas ri bong can dang mtshal ni bdun pa yang //
translated: The element that is a mixture of air and space is the moving one. The rabbit-holder is the moon, and the lac is the seventh.

original: k'a kshi k'a shi sa dang mu zi mnyam dang mkha' rlung me dang chu ni ldong ros pa bla ste //
analyzed: k'a kshi k'a shi sa dang mu zi mnyam dang mkha' rlung me dang chu ni ldong ros pa bla ste //
translated: The kashisa and the mupashi are equal to the earth and the sulfur. The space, air, fire, and water are the manahsila.

original: btsag ni sa'o lan tshva gang zhig ze tsha rgya mtsho skyes dang rgyam tsha nag po thab kyi tsha /
analyzed: btsag ni sa'o lan tshva gang zhig ze tsha rgya mtsho skyes dang rgyam tsha nag po thab kyi tsha /
translated: The vitriol is the sauvarchal salt. The which is the rock salt, and the ocean-born is the black salt. The tab is the salt of the stove.

original: 201 /'di rnams sa sogs khams te slar yang 'dir ni n'a ba s'a ra ya ba ksha ra  sangdza dang // tshal k'a tsa las skyes de rnams mkha' dang rlung me chu dang sa rnams dag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 201 /'di rnams sa sogs khams te slar yang 'dir ni n'a ba s'a ra ya ba ksha ra  sangdza dang // tshal k'a tsa las skyes de rnams mkha' dang rlung me chu dang sa rnams dag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: These are the elements, earth, etc. Again, here, the water of stone is of the nature of earth; the water of the moon is of the nature of water; the water of fire is of the nature of fire;

original: rdo yi chu ni sa ru 'gyur te ri bong can gyi chu ni chu dang me yi chu ni me //
analyzed: rdo yi chu ni sa ru 'gyur te ri bong can gyi chu ni chu dang me yi chu ni me //
translated: the water of wind is of the nature of wind and space.

original: rlung dang stong pa'i rang bzhin dag gi dug gi chu dang gzhan pa gri gug gsum gyi rang bzhin no /
analyzed: rlung dang stong pa'i rang bzhin dag gi dug gi chu dang gzhan pa gri gug gsum gyi rang bzhin no /
translated: The water of poison is of the nature of the three, wind and space.

original: 202 / gla sgang ser po sa yi khams te sha ktu ka dang rva can nag po chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: 202 / gla sgang ser po sa yi khams te sha ktu ka dang rva can nag po chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: The yellow aconite is of the nature of earth; the black aconite is of the nature of water, fire, and wind.

original: nag po brtsegs pa stong pa zhes bya gzhan pa nye ba'i dug ni rnam pa lnga po rig par bya //
analyzed: nag po brtsegs pa stong pa zhes bya gzhan pa nye ba'i dug ni rnam pa lnga po rig par bya //
translated: The black kurchi is of the nature of space. The other, the fivefold ‚Äúnear poison,‚Äù should be known.

original: rdo dang srog gi ngo bo rnam pa sna tshogs 'bras bu dang mtshungs mgo dang dung la sogs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: rdo dang srog gi ngo bo rnam pa sna tshogs 'bras bu dang mtshungs mgo dang dung la sogs pa'i gzugs //
translated: The various kinds of poison, of the nature of stone and life, are like the fruit, having the form of a head, a conch, etc.

original: de dag rnams kyi lcags ni rnam drug lhang tsher skyes dang de bzhin lha dang khab len rnam pa bzhi /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi lcags ni rnam drug lhang tsher skyes dang de bzhin lha dang khab len rnam pa bzhi /
translated: The iron of these is of six kinds: the born, the divine, the magnetic, and the fourfold.

original: 203 / ro ni grub dang grub pa ma yin rnam pa gnyis su 'dir 'gyur 'bugs byed dang ni 'bugs byed min //
analyzed: 203 / ro ni grub dang grub pa ma yin rnam pa gnyis su 'dir 'gyur 'bugs byed dang ni 'bugs byed min //
translated: The mercury is of two kinds: the perfected and the unperfected.

original: grub pa lcags ni 'bugs par byed de slar yang de ni zos pas lus kyang 'bugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa lcags ni 'bugs par byed de slar yang de ni zos pas lus kyang 'bugs par byed pa'o //
translated: The perfected iron is pierced, and it pierces the body when eaten.

original: gang zhig 'bugs byed min pa'i dngul chu ro de bskol pa dang ni bsgyur bar gyur pa dag gis kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig 'bugs byed min pa'i dngul chu ro de bskol pa dang ni bsgyur bar gyur pa dag gis kyang //
translated: The unperfected mercury, when heated and transformed,

original: lcags ni 'bugs shing rjes su 'bugs te mtha' dag nad 'phrog rus pa'i lcags ni rnam par spangs nas so /
analyzed: lcags ni 'bugs shing rjes su 'bugs te mtha' dag nad 'phrog rus pa'i lcags ni rnam par spangs nas so /
translated: pierces the iron and pierces through it, taking away all disease, leaving only the bones.

original: 204 / dang por du ba'i rang bzhin dag gis 'gro ste me la gnas shing bskol ba de ni rim pa yis //
analyzed: 204 / dang por du ba'i rang bzhin dag gis 'gro ste me la gnas shing bskol ba de ni rim pa yis //
translated: First it moves with a smoky nature, abiding in the fire and heated, it gradually

original: sgra dang rab tu 'phar ba yis @101b te da yang 'dar ba dang ni 'dar med nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sgra dang rab tu 'phar ba yis @101b te da yang 'dar ba dang ni 'dar med nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
translated: makes sound, rises, trembles, and becomes without trembling.

original: sgra ldan 'phar ldan 'bugs par byed pa ma yin de yang 'dab ma 'bugs byed 'dar dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: sgra ldan 'phar ldan 'bugs par byed pa ma yin de yang 'dab ma 'bugs byed 'dar dang bcas pa ste //
translated: The sound, the leap, and the piercing are not the same. The trembling of the wings is the piercing.

original: 'dar ba med pa mdung gis 'bugs byed rnam gsum 'dir yang sgyur byed rnams kyis bsgyur bar gyur pa'o /
analyzed: 'dar ba med pa mdung gis 'bugs byed rnam gsum 'dir yang sgyur byed rnams kyis bsgyur bar gyur pa'o /
translated: The spear pierces without trembling. These three are translated by the translators.

original: 205 / mchog gi sman gyi stobs kyis stobs dang ldan par rab tu 'gyur te lcags rnams thams cad bzhu ba'o //
analyzed: 205 / mchog gi sman gyi stobs kyis stobs dang ldan par rab tu 'gyur te lcags rnams thams cad bzhu ba'o //
translated: By the power of the best medicine, one becomes powerful, and all the metals are melted.

original: su zhig de rnams med na sa yi steng gi gnas su 'di yi bcing ba dag ni gang zhig byed //
analyzed: su zhig de rnams med na sa yi steng gi gnas su 'di yi bcing ba dag ni gang zhig byed //
translated: If one does not have them, what is the use of this binding on the surface of the earth?

original: bcings nas mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur zhing de bzhin zos na 'chi ba dag kyang nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: bcings nas mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur zhing de bzhin zos na 'chi ba dag kyang nyams par 'gyur //
translated: Having bound it, one becomes a sky-goer. Likewise, having eaten it, one overcomes death.

original: ye shes med na sa bdag rnams kyis ro yi dbang po 'di ni rab tu 'bad pas bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: ye shes med na sa bdag rnams kyis ro yi dbang po 'di ni rab tu 'bad pas bsgrub par bya /
translated: If one does not have the knowledge, the lords of the earth should strive to obtain this tongue of the corpse.

original: 206 / de dag rnams kyi rdzas ni du ma glu dang rol mo'i mngon par sbyor ba la yang 'god par 'gyur //
analyzed: 206 / de dag rnams kyi rdzas ni du ma glu dang rol mo'i mngon par sbyor ba la yang 'god par 'gyur //
translated: Their substances are many, and they are also placed in the application of song and music.

original: gang zhig chud zos de ni mi bdag ro yi yul la ma bsregs chos kyi bya ba la ma byin //
analyzed: gang zhig chud zos de ni mi bdag ro yi yul la ma bsregs chos kyi bya ba la ma byin //
translated: That which is wasted is not burned in the land of the dead, nor is it given to the performance of religious rites.

original: gang zhig rdzas ni sdig pa'i slad du zad par byed pa de yis de ni sdig pa dag gis bcings //
analyzed: gang zhig rdzas ni sdig pa'i slad du zad par byed pa de yis de ni sdig pa dag gis bcings //
translated: That which is consumed for the sake of sin is bound by sin.

original: de phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems can dag gi don gyi slad du ma lus pa ni zad par mdzad /
analyzed: de phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems can dag gi don gyi slad du ma lus pa ni zad par mdzad /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva, for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings, consumes it completely.

original: 207 / gang zhig byugs pas 'phral la zangs kyi 'dab ma'i dri ma 'phrog par byed pa dag ni sman yin te //
analyzed: 207 / gang zhig byugs pas 'phral la zangs kyi 'dab ma'i dri ma 'phrog par byed pa dag ni sman yin te //
translated: That which, when applied, immediately removes the stains of copper, is medicine.

original: mtha' dag nad 'phrog lcags rigs 'ju bar byed pa de ni skal ldan rnams kyis la mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtha' dag nad 'phrog lcags rigs 'ju bar byed pa de ni skal ldan rnams kyis la mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: The all-removing, iron-dissolving substance is seen by the fortunate ones.

original: gzhan dag rnams kyis 'di yi bcing bar rab tu 'gyur ba gang de nges par lo dus par dang ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnams kyis 'di yi bcing bar rab tu 'gyur ba gang de nges par lo dus par dang ni //
translated: That which is bound by others is certainly old and

original: bdug dang dgod pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis de ni stong phrag gcig 'bugs dag las lhag par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bdug dang dgod pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis de ni stong phrag gcig 'bugs dag las lhag par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: by the application of fumigation and sprinkling, it does not exceed a thousand holes.

original: 208 / sman rnams thams cad shin tu tsha ba'i ro rnams dag dang 'gyur byed sde dang skyur ba'i sde rnams dang // bslang bar gyur pa'i rtsab mo dag gis rtag tu mnye dang bdug par yang ni rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: 208 / sman rnams thams cad shin tu tsha ba'i ro rnams dag dang 'gyur byed sde dang skyur ba'i sde rnams dang // bslang bar gyur pa'i rtsab mo dag gis rtag tu mnye dang bdug par yang ni rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
translated: All medicines are to be heated with the very hot tastes, the pungent and sour groups, and always rubbed and fumigated with the sprouts of the b·πõhatƒ´ plant.

original: dngul chu rnams ni dngul du bya ba la yang me tog btab pa rnams kyis sa bon dag pa'o //
analyzed: dngul chu rnams ni dngul du bya ba la yang me tog btab pa rnams kyis sa bon dag pa'o //
translated: The mercury is purified by the flowers in the process of making silver.

original: @102a * // gnyis sbyor tsha  la mching bu byi ba rta sen dug rnams kyis so snum gyis bran pas 'jam pa nyid /
analyzed: @102a * // gnyis sbyor tsha  la mching bu byi ba rta sen dug rnams kyis so snum gyis bran pas 'jam pa nyid /
translated: The union is softened by the oil smeared on the stone, the mouse, the horse hoof, and the poison.

original: 209 / glang po mi yi chu ni lan bdun blugs pa dag gis chu shing tsi tra la sogs thal ba dang // 'gyur byed kun dang tsha ba rnams dang slar yang nye ba'i ro ni  sbyings pa de rnams sbru bar bya //
analyzed: 209 / glang po mi yi chu ni lan bdun blugs pa dag gis chu shing tsi tra la sogs thal ba dang // 'gyur byed kun dang tsha ba rnams dang slar yang nye ba'i ro ni  sbyings pa de rnams sbru bar bya //
translated: The plantain, citraka, and so forth are to be ground with the ashes, the seven times boiled water of elephant and human, all the pungent substances, the hot substances, and again the near-neutral substances.

original: yang nas yang du me yi tsha ba dag gis slar yang lan brgyar sbru bar bya zhing bskam par bya //
analyzed: yang nas yang du me yi tsha ba dag gis slar yang lan brgyar sbru bar bya zhing bskam par bya //
translated: Again and again it is to be heated with the heat of fire and again ground and dried a hundred times.

original: de bzhin dung gi phye ma brgya phrag sbyar bar gyur pa 'di ni mu zi dag gis bsres pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin dung gi phye ma brgya phrag sbyar bar gyur pa 'di ni mu zi dag gis bsres pa yang /
translated: Likewise, a hundred parts of mercury mixed with a part of realgar

original: 210 / lcags rnams zhu bar byed pa'i don du bi da 'di ni dngul chu dag gi brgyad kyi cha shas 'gyur //
analyzed: 210 / lcags rnams zhu bar byed pa'i don du bi da 'di ni dngul chu dag gi brgyad kyi cha shas 'gyur //
translated: and a part of sulphur, when heated, will melt the iron.üîΩThe mercury, when heated for eight nights in a covered vessel,

original: khyogs kyi bdug pa mtshan mo brgyad de ro yi snying gar gnas pa zhu bar gyur pa ji srid nyid //
analyzed: khyogs kyi bdug pa mtshan mo brgyad de ro yi snying gar gnas pa zhu bar gyur pa ji srid nyid //
translated: will melt the iron placed in its heart.

original: drag por bskol bas dri ma med pa 'di ni mnyes shing bzhus pas stobs dang ldan par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: drag por bskol bas dri ma med pa 'di ni mnyes shing bzhus pas stobs dang ldan par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: When it is heated strongly, it becomes clear and, when melted, it becomes powerful.

original: lcags gcig zhu bar gyur na nyi ma ri bong can gyi lus kyis lcags rnams thams cad kha sgyur byed /
analyzed: lcags gcig zhu bar gyur na nyi ma ri bong can gyi lus kyis lcags rnams thams cad kha sgyur byed /
translated: When one iron is melted, the body of the sun and moon will change all the iron.

original: 211 / khyab byed sgyur ba de yang chen po dang bcas zha nye gsha' tshe spra tshil bcas pas 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: 211 / khyab byed sgyur ba de yang chen po dang bcas zha nye gsha' tshe spra tshil bcas pas 'jug pa ste //
translated: That change, which is all-pervading, is effected by the great mercury together with tin, lead, and beeswax.

original: de ltar gang zhig dngul chu'i las ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dag gis nyin zhag so sor byed pa na //
analyzed: de ltar gang zhig dngul chu'i las ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dag gis nyin zhag so sor byed pa na //
translated: Thus, whoever performs the mercury operations, which will be described, day by day,

original: dus gzhan dag gis 'ching ste gsal bar lci zhing sra ba nyid dang skyon rnams kun las rab tu grol //
analyzed: dus gzhan dag gis 'ching ste gsal bar lci zhing sra ba nyid dang skyon rnams kun las rab tu grol //
translated: He is free from all faults, and is bound by the other times, clear, heavy, and firm.

original: de yi mchog gi lus la nad dang 'chi ba dang ni dbul ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad 'phrogs par byed /üîΩ212 / khru phyed gser gyi padma nor gyi 'dab ldan dag la lte bar snying po'i dbus su rdo rje ste //
analyzed: de yi mchog gi lus la nad dang 'chi ba dang ni dbul ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad 'phrogs par byed / 212 / khru phyed gser gyi padma nor gyi 'dab ldan dag la lte bar snying po'i dbus su rdo rje ste //
translated: He has taken away all the sufferings of sickness, death, and poverty from his supreme body.üîΩIn the half-cubit golden lotus of wealth, in the center of the petals, is a vajra.

original: lha dang gshin rje nor sbyin dag tu dag pa'i aindra n'i la padma r'a ga chu shel lo //
analyzed: lha dang gshin rje nor sbyin dag tu dag pa'i aindra n'i la padma r'a ga chu shel lo //
translated: In the east, in the center of the lotus of pure sapphire, ruby, and crystal, are Indra, Yama, and Kubera.

original: nub tu rin chen ka rke ta ste mi  dang lha min 'phrog byed du ni rnon po zangs dang dngul //
analyzed: nub tu rin chen ka rke ta ste mi  dang lha min 'phrog byed du ni rnon po zangs dang dngul //
translated: In the south, in the center of the lotus of gold and silver, are the sharp weapons that take away humans and demigods.

original: rlung gi 'dab ma dag la gser dang gser gyi lhang tsher dag las skyes pa'i gdan ni lte ba la /
analyzed: rlung gi 'dab ma dag la gser dang gser gyi lhang tsher dag las skyes pa'i gdan ni lte ba la /
translated: On the petals of the wind, in the center of the seat arisen from gold and golden jasmine,

original: 213 / snying por de steng gser las skyes pa'i ji bha la ni phyag gnyis ne'u le dang bcas mchog sbyin pa //
analyzed: 213 / snying por de steng gser las skyes pa'i ji bha la ni phyag gnyis ne'u le dang bcas mchog sbyin pa //
translated: in the center of the essence, is a golden jƒ´va·πÉjƒ´va with two hands, holding a mongoose and giving the boon-granting gesture.

original: 'dab ma rnams la gser las skyes pa'am dngul las skyes pa'i lha mo brgyad de chu skyes mchog sbyin phyag / cod pan sangs @102b rgyas rin chen dbang po nor bu mchog sbyin phyag ste gnod sbyin mo rnams de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'dab ma rnams la gser las skyes pa'am dngul las skyes pa'i lha mo brgyad de chu skyes mchog sbyin phyag / cod pan sangs @102b rgyas rin chen dbang po nor bu mchog sbyin phyag ste gnod sbyin mo rnams de bzhin nyid //
translated: On the petals are the eight goddesses born from gold or silver: Padmini, Varada, C≈´dƒÅma·πái, and Buddharatne≈õvara, who holds a jewel and makes the boon-granting gesture.

original: ha sogs thung ngu ring po phyogs dang phyogs bral 'dab ma rnams la yi ge brgyad rnams rim pas so /
analyzed: ha sogs thung ngu ring po phyogs dang phyogs bral 'dab ma rnams la yi ge brgyad rnams rim pas so /
translated: The eight syllables are on the petals in the directions and intermediate directions, beginning with the east.

original: 214 / dri dang me tog rnams kyis nyin zhag so so'i dus su thun gsum zla ba'i snod du mchod byas nas //
analyzed: 214 / dri dang me tog rnams kyis nyin zhag so so'i dus su thun gsum zla ba'i snod du mchod byas nas //
translated: With incense and flowers, one should worship the moon in the three periods of the day, every day.

original: aom dzam sv'a h'a'i mthar ste dbus su bha la dang bcas dza le ndr'a ya zhes pa sngags 'di yis //
analyzed: aom dzam sv'a h'a'i mthar ste dbus su bha la dang bcas dza le ndr'a ya zhes pa sngags 'di yis //
translated: At the end of Om Jambu Svaha, in the middle, with the syllable Bham, one should recite the mantra Jale Nirdhaya.

original: rgyal po rab dga'i yid kyis gser 'gyur mkhan rnams dag gis srung ba'i don du chu ni rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: rgyal po rab dga'i yid kyis gser 'gyur mkhan rnams dag gis srung ba'i don du chu ni rab sbyin bya //
translated: With a joyful mind, the king should give water for the protection of the alchemists.

original: de ltar bsrung ba'i mthu yis 'byung po'i mgon dang klu yi mgon pos ro ni 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ltar bsrung ba'i mthu yis 'byung po'i mgon dang klu yi mgon pos ro ni 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: By the power of this protection, the lords of the bh≈´tas and the lords of the nƒÅgas will not carry off the corpse.

original: 215 / so phag 'gyur byed skyur ba'i sde rnams dag gis nyi ma bcu ru ro ni mnye zhing bdug par bya //
analyzed: 215 / so phag 'gyur byed skyur ba'i sde rnams dag gis nyi ma bcu ru ro ni mnye zhing bdug par bya //
translated: The corpse should be flayed for ten days with the bricks of the acid group, and it should be fumigated.

original: de nas slar yang snyigs ma dag la gnas pa phye nas bsre bar bya ste thams cad dus su'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang snyigs ma dag la gnas pa phye nas bsre bar bya ste thams cad dus su'o //
translated: Then, again, the impurities should be separated and the corpse should be burned, all at the proper time.

original: slar yang gal te snyigs las de ni ma phyed ro ni 'chi ste de yang de la bzhu bar bya //
analyzed: slar yang gal te snyigs las de ni ma phyed ro ni 'chi ste de yang de la bzhu bar bya //
translated: If the impurities are not separated, the corpse will die, and it will be dissolved in that.

original: dngul chu rang gi skye gnas za na de ni slar yang gzhan gyi skye gnas thams cad rab tu za /
analyzed: dngul chu rang gi skye gnas za na de ni slar yang gzhan gyi skye gnas thams cad rab tu za /
translated: If mercury eats its own birthplace, then it will also eat all other birthplaces.

original: 216 / zha nye rnon por gan zangs dang lhad tsher skyes sam gzhan pa zhing las skyes pa rnam dag pa ;
analyzed: 216 / zha nye rnon por gan zangs dang lhad tsher skyes sam gzhan pa zhing las skyes pa rnam dag pa ;
translated: The sharp lead is born from copper and iron, or from another field.

original: / mnyam pa gcig tu bsres pa'o dngul gyi bya ba la ni lhang tsher dkar po las skyes gsha' tshe mnyam //
analyzed: / mnyam pa gcig tu bsres pa'o dngul gyi bya ba la ni lhang tsher dkar po las skyes gsha' tshe mnyam //
translated: The pure one is mixed in one place with the silver. For the silver work, the lead born from white iron is equal to the lead.

original: dang por drug cu'i cha shas zas ni 'ju bar 'gyur zhing de nas cha shas zas ni 'ju bar 'gyur zhing de nas cha re bskyed pas 'phel bar bya //
analyzed: dang por drug cu'i cha shas zas ni 'ju bar 'gyur zhing de nas cha shas zas ni 'ju bar 'gyur zhing de nas cha re bskyed pas 'phel bar bya //
translated: First, one-sixtieth of the food is digested, then one-sixtieth of the food is digested, and then one-sixtieth is produced, thus increasing.

original: rkang pa'i cha shas ji srid nyid du rab tu 'gyur te de las lhag par rab tu sbyin mi bya /
analyzed: rkang pa'i cha shas ji srid nyid du rab tu 'gyur te de las lhag par rab tu sbyin mi bya /
translated: As much as the part of the foot is, so much is the increase; more than that is not given.

original: 217 / phyogs gcig gis ni nyis 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang 'di ni de bzhin sa bon rnam par dag / de ltar gnyis gsum brgyad 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang zhu ba 'di ni bi da mchog rnams kyis //
analyzed: 217 / phyogs gcig gis ni nyis 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang 'di ni de bzhin sa bon rnam par dag / de ltar gnyis gsum brgyad 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang zhu ba 'di ni bi da mchog rnams kyis //
translated: By one part, the food is doubled, and again this is the seed of purification. Thus, by two, three, and eight times, the food is digested, and again this digestion is the supreme elixir of the yogis.

original: ma zhu na ni ro la ji srid mtshan mo brgyad kyi bar du 'khor lo'i dugs su rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: ma zhu na ni ro la ji srid mtshan mo brgyad kyi bar du 'khor lo'i dugs su rab tu 'gyur //
translated: If there is indigestion, for as long as eight nights, the wheel-like digestion is supreme.

original: reg pa mchog gi sman rnams dag gis me la gnas pa lhang tsher lcags ni kha med 'ju bar 'gyur /
analyzed: reg pa mchog gi sman rnams dag gis me la gnas pa lhang tsher lcags ni kha med 'ju bar 'gyur /
translated: By the supreme medicine of touch, the iron of the fire-dwelling ant is digested without a mouth.

original: 218 / lhang tsher dag las lcags ni brgyad 'gyur stobs su 'gyur te de ni zhu ba na @103a * //
analyzed: 218 / lhang tsher dag las lcags ni brgyad 'gyur stobs su 'gyur te de ni zhu ba na @103a * //
translated: From the ant, the iron becomes eight times stronger, and when digested,

original: yang brgyad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang brgyad 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, it is multiplied by eight.

original: de yis sa bon la yang brgyad 'gyur yin te slar yang de las rdo rje rin chen brgyad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yis sa bon la yang brgyad 'gyur yin te slar yang de las rdo rje rin chen brgyad 'gyur ro //
translated: It is multiplied by eight in the seed, and again, from that, the vajra gem is multiplied by eight.

original: de ltar lcags dang rin chen rnams dang nye ba'i ro dang ro rnams ji srid khol bar gyur gyi bar //
analyzed: de ltar lcags dang rin chen rnams dang nye ba'i ro dang ro rnams ji srid khol bar gyur gyi bar //
translated: Thus, the iron and the gems, the near nectar and the nectars, are boiled in the fire until they boil over.

original: me yi nang du bskol bar bya ste de nas de ni 'bum phrag du ma 'bugs par rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: me yi nang du bskol bar bya ste de nas de ni 'bum phrag du ma 'bugs par rab tu 'gyur /
translated: Then, it is pierced in many hundreds of thousands.

original: 219 / reg rdo sman dag med na mchog gi bi da mnye ba dag dang dug rnams kyis kyang 'ju bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 219 / reg rdo sman dag med na mchog gi bi da mnye ba dag dang dug rnams kyis kyang 'ju bar 'gyur //
translated: If the touch stone and the medicine are not available, it is digested by the supreme vidya and the poisons.

original: 'dar ba med pa ji srid nyid de de nas sgyur byed gser ni mnyam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dar ba med pa ji srid nyid de de nas sgyur byed gser ni mnyam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur //
translated: As long as it is not trembling, then the transforming gold becomes equal.

original: slar yang gzhan ni gnyis dang sum 'gyur gser bzhu'i khu ba 'bru mar dngul chu dag la blugs pas so //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan ni gnyis dang sum 'gyur gser bzhu'i khu ba 'bru mar dngul chu dag la blugs pas so //
translated: Again, another is multiplied by two and three, poured into the juice of gold, oil, and mercury.

original: rdzas kyi don du zha nye brgyad cha gser zhun khu ba dag la rab tu 'bad nas blugs par bya /
analyzed: rdzas kyi don du zha nye brgyad cha gser zhun khu ba dag la rab tu 'bad nas blugs par bya /
translated: For the sake of substance, eight parts of mercury are poured into the juice of gold, with great effort.

original: 220 / gser dngul bya ba dag la gser rnon  sprul zangs zha nye mtshal dang ldong ros mu zi dag gis dang // gsha' tshe zla ba de bzhin lhang tsher skyes kyang ba bla dang ni bsreg bya dag gis bsad byas nas //
analyzed: 220 / gser dngul bya ba dag la gser rnon  sprul zangs zha nye mtshal dang ldong ros mu zi dag gis dang // gsha' tshe zla ba de bzhin lhang tsher skyes kyang ba bla dang ni bsreg bya dag gis bsad byas nas //
translated: Gold and silver are killed by the action of gold-rust, copper by zinc, lac by arsenic, and orpiment by sulphur.üîΩIron is killed by lead, and mercury by lead-wort, and the like.

original: mnyam pa'i 'gyur byed dug dang lan tshva nye ba'i ro rnams dag dang lcags dang mnyam pa'i dngul chu ni //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i 'gyur byed dug dang lan tshva nye ba'i ro rnams dag dang lcags dang mnyam pa'i dngul chu ni //
translated: Mercury, equal in weight to the poison, salt, or other substance to be destroyed, and equal in weight to the iron, is to be dissolved in an acid, and then in a solution of alum.

original: mkhris pa skyur po dag gis nyin zhag bcu ru mnyes nas de ni rngo ba'i dbus su blugs byas te /
analyzed: mkhris pa skyur po dag gis nyin zhag bcu ru mnyes nas de ni rngo ba'i dbus su blugs byas te /
translated: This is to be put into the womb of a furnace, and heated for ten days with a gentle fire.

original: 221 / sa yi nang du zla ba drug tu steng du me dang bcas pas thams cad dus su bdugs gyur pa //
analyzed: 221 / sa yi nang du zla ba drug tu steng du me dang bcas pas thams cad dus su bdugs gyur pa //
translated: Then it is to be put into the middle of a closed vessel, and heated for six months with a fire below and above.

original: dngul chu de ni bcu drug cha yis dbyangs kyis drangs pa 'bugs par byed par rab tu 'gyur te slar //
analyzed: dngul chu de ni bcu drug cha yis dbyangs kyis drangs pa 'bugs par byed par rab tu 'gyur te slar //
translated: This mercury, when it has been drawn sixteen times in a bellows, will pierce through anything, and will again be fit for use.

original: zangs dang zla ba gser mnyam dge ba'i gser 'di gser 'gyur mkhan rnams dag gi sdug bsngal 'joms pa ste //
analyzed: zangs dang zla ba gser mnyam dge ba'i gser 'di gser 'gyur mkhan rnams dag gi sdug bsngal 'joms pa ste //
translated: This gold, which is equal to silver and to gold, is the destroyer of the pain of the alchemists.

original: dngul ni brgyad kyi cha shas byin na dag pa'i zangs ni phug pa dngul du yang ni 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: dngul ni brgyad kyi cha shas byin na dag pa'i zangs ni phug pa dngul du yang ni 'gyur ba yin /
translated: When silver is given an eighth part of copper, it becomes pure and is called ‚Äúsilver of the copper type.‚Äù

original: 222 /'dzin ma la ni rdo ba gang dag 'bras bu'i lus dang mtshungs shing dung dang mgo la sogs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: 222 /'dzin ma la ni rdo ba gang dag 'bras bu'i lus dang mtshungs shing dung dang mgo la sogs pa'i gzugs //
translated: When iron is given a part of the fruit-like body of a conch, head, etc.,

original: de yi skye gnas de rnams la byin mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas drag po'i rlung gis bzhu bar bya //
analyzed: de yi skye gnas de rnams la byin mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas drag po'i rlung gis bzhu bar bya //
translated: it is melted by the wind of fierce fire together with ghee and honey in the womb of that iron.

original: de nas slar yang btags pa dang @103b ni tsha la 'gyur byed sde tshan rnams kyis dag par byas nas ni //
analyzed: de nas slar yang btags pa dang @103b ni tsha la 'gyur byed sde tshan rnams kyis dag par byas nas ni //
translated: Then, again, it is purified by the group of the purifying ingredients, the tagara, etc.

original: lcags kyi skye gnas de ni shes nas nyis 'gyur dag kyang ro la gser 'gyur mkhan gyis bzhu bar bya /
analyzed: lcags kyi skye gnas de ni shes nas nyis 'gyur dag kyang ro la gser 'gyur mkhan gyis bzhu bar bya /
translated: Knowing that womb of iron, the alchemist melts it twice in the ashes of the three fruits.

original: 223 / nyin zhag bdun du snod ni dag par 'gyur te 'bras bu gsum po ro mnyam bskol ba'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: 223 / nyin zhag bdun du snod ni dag par 'gyur te 'bras bu gsum po ro mnyam bskol ba'i chu dang ni //
translated: For seven days the vessel becomes pure, and with the water boiled with the three fruits equalized in taste,

original: sman gyis bsad pa'i lcags kyi phye ma mar dang sbrang rtsi dag dang bcas pa dngul chu dang bcas dang // ba yi 'o ma gsar pa rnying pa s'a li zan ni lo ma skyur pos dman zhing lan tshva dang // rnam bral nya dang 'bru mar sogs las grol ba zos pa dag gis phyogs kyi nang du mi rnams kyi'o /
analyzed: sman gyis bsad pa'i lcags kyi phye ma mar dang sbrang rtsi dag dang bcas pa dngul chu dang bcas dang // ba yi 'o ma gsar pa rnying pa s'a li zan ni lo ma skyur pos dman zhing lan tshva dang // rnam bral nya dang 'bru mar sogs las grol ba zos pa dag gis phyogs kyi nang du mi rnams kyi'o /
translated: and freed from fish, oil, etc., eaten by people in the regions.

original: 224 / stong phrag 'bugs pa brgya yis bsgyur ba'i brgya dang bye ba 'bugs pa ji srid par yang shes byas nas //
analyzed: 224 / stong phrag 'bugs pa brgya yis bsgyur ba'i brgya dang bye ba 'bugs pa ji srid par yang shes byas nas //
translated: Having understood as many hundreds as there are thousands, multiplied by a hundred, and as many hundreds of thousands as there are hundreds of thousands,

original: nyin zhag so so'i dus su bza' bar bya ste yungs kar cha las mtha' ma skye tshe cha shas so //
analyzed: nyin zhag so so'i dus su bza' bar bya ste yungs kar cha las mtha' ma skye tshe cha shas so //
translated: one should eat at each daily time, from the part of a mustard seed, up to the part of a sesame seed.

original: khang  bzangs dang ni sa yi khang pa grang ba rlung dang tshad pa dag dang bral bar rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: khang  bzangs dang ni sa yi khang pa grang ba rlung dang tshad pa dag dang bral bar rab tu 'gyur //
translated: A palace and an underground chamber become cool, free from wind and heat.

original: 'bring po 'di ni zla ba drug gis lha yi lus po skra dkar gnyer ma dag dang bral bar byed /
analyzed: 'bring po 'di ni zla ba drug gis lha yi lus po skra dkar gnyer ma dag dang bral bar byed /
translated: This medium one, in six months, makes the divine body, free from gray hair and wrinkles.

original: 225 / ka rko t'i dang de ba d'a l'i tsha gsum bri ha t'i dang nim pa ki r'a ta tig ta //
analyzed: 225 / ka rko t'i dang de ba d'a l'i tsha gsum bri ha t'i dang nim pa ki r'a ta tig ta //
translated: The three, namely, Kara√±ja, DevadƒÅru, and Triv·πõt, and Bh·πõ·πÖgarƒÅja, Nimbaka, and Tika·π≠ƒÅ,

original: bskol ba 'thungs te slar yang ma zhu ba la nyin zhag gsum du bsnyung bar gnas pa rab tu bya //
analyzed: bskol ba 'thungs te slar yang ma zhu ba la nyin zhag gsum du bsnyung bar gnas pa rab tu bya //
translated: are to be boiled and drunk, and then one should fast for three days and nights.

original: de bzhin zla ba'i chu la sogs pa me dang dug gi chu dang rdo dang bha ll'a ta yi chu //
analyzed: de bzhin zla ba'i chu la sogs pa me dang dug gi chu dang rdo dang bha ll'a ta yi chu //
translated: Likewise, one should not drink the water of the moon, etc., nor the water of fire, poison, stone, or BhƒÅlla·π≠a,

original: ngan pa'i dri dang sa dang rdo ba dug gi sha dang brtags pa gzhan rnams la yang sngags pas so /
analyzed: ngan pa'i dri dang sa dang rdo ba dug gi sha dang brtags pa gzhan rnams la yang sngags pas so /
translated: nor the water of bad smell, earth, stone, poisonous flesh, or other substances.

original: 226 / gang zhig zos na drag tu rgyal ba ster byed dug dang mtshungs pa de rnams mtha' dag sman yin te //
analyzed: 226 / gang zhig zos na drag tu rgyal ba ster byed dug dang mtshungs pa de rnams mtha' dag sman yin te //
translated: Whatever one eats that gives rise to strong poison, all of that is medicine.

original: phye mar byas nas de ni cung zad mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas bza' bar bya ste de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: phye mar byas nas de ni cung zad mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas bza' bar bya ste de bzhin nyid //
translated: Having made it into a powder, one should eat it with a little ghee, honey, and sugar.

original: gsal bar mi phyugs sems can rnams kyis gang zhig za bar byed pa de ni grub ster sman ma yin //
analyzed: gsal bar mi phyugs sems can rnams kyis gang zhig za bar byed pa de ni grub ster sman ma yin //
translated: That which is eaten by animals and cattle is not the medicine that bestows accomplishment.

original: de dag rnams la 'chi ster mchog tu 'jigs byed gang yin de ni rnal 'byor rnams la bdud rtsir 'gyur /üîΩ227 / da ndo tpa la s'a li pa rn'i chu skyes s'a ri dag gi rang lus @104a * //
analyzed: de dag rnams la 'chi ster mchog tu 'jigs byed gang yin de ni rnal 'byor rnams la bdud rtsir 'gyur / 227 / da ndo tpa la s'a li pa rn'i chu skyes s'a ri dag gi rang lus @104a * //
translated: That which is the most terrifying of all killers for them becomes nectar for the yogis.

original: 'dab ma'i khu ba yis //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i khu ba yis //
translated: The juice of the leaves of the body of the lotus of the Dhataki and the Sali tree,

original: ro dang mu zi mnyam pa khab len snod du lcags kyis nyin zhag gsum dag tu yang mnyes byas nas //
analyzed: ro dang mu zi mnyam pa khab len snod du lcags kyis nyin zhag gsum dag tu yang mnyes byas nas //
translated: equal parts of poison and antimony, stirred with iron in a magnetic vessel for three days,

original: gang zhig zla ba drug tu nyin zhag so so'i dus su tam ka'i rkang pa'i tshad ni za byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig zla ba drug tu nyin zhag so so'i dus su tam ka'i rkang pa'i tshad ni za byed pa //
translated: he who eats the measure of a Tamka foot each day for six months,

original: de ni mdze la sogs pa'i nad las grol zhing skra dkar gnyer ma dang bral brgyad gnyis lo lon dbyibs /
analyzed: de ni mdze la sogs pa'i nad las grol zhing skra dkar gnyer ma dang bral brgyad gnyis lo lon dbyibs /
translated: is freed from leprosy and other diseases, free from gray hair and wrinkles, with the body of an eight or sixteen year old,

original: 228 / po kk'a na dang bar snang sha ktu k'i ra'i mchu yis rab g-yo dngul chu dag kyang gsad par bya //
analyzed: 228 / po kk'a na dang bar snang sha ktu k'i ra'i mchu yis rab g-yo dngul chu dag kyang gsad par bya //
translated: and kills quicksilver with the beak of the Kakani and the Shakatika bird.

original: sman gzhan dag gis gsad pa la ni dmar ring lhang tsher skyes dang gser dang khab len mnyam pa dag / gcig tu byas nas srog bcas dri ma rnam bral dngul chu dag la srang drug gis ni gong bu ste //
analyzed: sman gzhan dag gis gsad pa la ni dmar ring lhang tsher skyes dang gser dang khab len mnyam pa dag / gcig tu byas nas srog bcas dri ma rnam bral dngul chu dag la srang drug gis ni gong bu ste //
translated: The other medicines are: red arsenic, realgar, gold, and magnetite, all of them in equal parts.üîΩHaving made a compound of these, one should add to it mercury free of impurities and six times as much lead.üîΩThe compound should be heated in the vessel of magnetite described above, in a solution of water. It will remove wrinkles and gray hair.

original: sngar brjod khab len snod du chur khu dag gis bskol bar gyur pa gnyer ma dang ni skra dkar 'phrog 229 / zla ba drug dang gnyis gcig zla ba mi bdag dang bcas nyin zhag bcu dang zhag bdun zhag gsum dang // zhag dang skad cig gcig gis 'di yi mthu dag las ni lus la dngos grub tu yang rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sngar brjod khab len snod du chur khu dag gis bskol bar gyur pa gnyer ma dang ni skra dkar 'phrog 229 / zla ba drug dang gnyis gcig zla ba mi bdag dang bcas nyin zhag bcu dang zhag bdun zhag gsum dang // zhag dang skad cig gcig gis 'di yi mthu dag las ni lus la dngos grub tu yang rab tu 'gyur //
translated: In six, two, or one month, or in a day, a week, seven days, or three days, or in a single moment, this power will bring about the attainment of the body.

original: thun mong ba dang 'bring po 'jigs pa dag dang rnam par bral ba mchog ni ye shes grub pa ste //
analyzed: thun mong ba dang 'bring po 'jigs pa dag dang rnam par bral ba mchog ni ye shes grub pa ste //
translated: The common and middling are free from fear, and the supreme is the attainment of wisdom.

original: mchog dman skyes bu'i rang gis byas pa'i dge dbang las te skye ba gcig gi rjes 'bugs dag las min /
analyzed: mchog dman skyes bu'i rang gis byas pa'i dge dbang las te skye ba gcig gi rjes 'bugs dag las min /
translated: The supreme and inferior are the result of one‚Äôs own virtuous karma, not from one life but from many.

original: 230 / gang la 'khri shing ljon pa gzhan gyi dngos dang nyin zhag so so'i dus su dud 'gro rnam par rtsod //
analyzed: 230 / gang la 'khri shing ljon pa gzhan gyi dngos dang nyin zhag so so'i dus su dud 'gro rnam par rtsod //
translated: Where the creepers and trees of others are the materials, and the animals fight at the time of each day.

original: ral gri dag la padma'i skud pa'i sdong bu mi yi snum gyi mar mes gter ni gsal bar byed //
analyzed: ral gri dag la padma'i skud pa'i sdong bu mi yi snum gyi mar mes gter ni gsal bar byed //
translated: Where the lamps of human fat illuminate the treasure, with swords for stalks and lotus fibers,

original: der ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su 'byung po'i bdag po dag gi sngags kyi bzlas pa rab tu bya //
analyzed: der ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su 'byung po'i bdag po dag gi sngags kyi bzlas pa rab tu bya //
translated: and where the recitation of the mantras of the lords of spirits is performed at the time of each day.

original: ji srid brko ba'i mtshan mar gyur gyi bar te de nas sngags pa rnams la rdzas kyi dngos grub bo /
analyzed: ji srid brko ba'i mtshan mar gyur gyi bar te de nas sngags pa rnams la rdzas kyi dngos grub bo /
translated: Until the signs of digging appear, then the powers of substances for the mantrins.

original: 231 / dang por rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa skye gnas drug gi sngags rnams bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: 231 / dang por rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa skye gnas drug gi sngags rnams bsgrub par bya //
translated: First, the mantras of the six birthplaces blessed by the vajra of the lord of victors are accomplished.

original: gnod sbyin mo rnams bsgrubs nas slar yang sa gzhi la ni zhing du smra ba rnams kyang bsgrub par bya ;
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo rnams bsgrubs nas slar yang sa gzhi la ni zhing du smra ba rnams kyang bsgrub par bya ;
translated: Having accomplished the yak·π£i·πáƒ´s, again on the ground, the speech of the fields is also accomplished.

original: / klu mo rnams ni bsgrub pa byas nas bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu'i ro dang sman de rnams ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: / klu mo rnams ni bsgrub pa byas nas bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu'i ro dang sman de rnams ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: Having accomplished the nƒÅgƒ´s, the ambrosia fruit tastes and those herbs are accomplished.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams bsgrub pa byas nas mchog tu 'jigs par byed pa'i lha min rnams kyang bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams bsgrub pa byas nas mchog tu 'jigs par byed pa'i lha min rnams kyang bsgrub par bya /
translated: Having accomplished the dakinis, the yogin should accomplish the asuras, who are most terrifying.

original: 232 / klu la sogs rnams bsgrub pa byas nas rab mchog lha dang mi rnams rnal 'byor @104b pa yis bsgrub par bya //üîΩdu ba la sogs bsgrub pa byas nas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i dbu ma dag ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: 232 / klu la sogs rnams bsgrub pa byas nas rab mchog lha dang mi rnams rnal 'byor @104b pa yis bsgrub par bya // du ba la sogs bsgrub pa byas nas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i dbu ma dag ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: Having accomplished the nagas, etc., the yogin should accomplish the supreme gods and men.üîΩHaving accomplished the smoke, etc., he should accomplish the madhyama, which is the fear of death.

original: srog la sogs rnams bsgrub pa byas nas ri bong 'dzin pa zhu ba'i thig le rnams ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: srog la sogs rnams bsgrub pa byas nas ri bong 'dzin pa zhu ba'i thig le rnams ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: Having accomplished the life, etc., he should accomplish the drop, which is the melting of the rabbit-holder.

original: dam pa'i bde ba bsgrubs nas lhan cig skyes pa rgyal ba'i sku ni kun du 'gro ba bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: dam pa'i bde ba bsgrubs nas lhan cig skyes pa rgyal ba'i sku ni kun du 'gro ba bsgrub par bya /
translated: Having accomplished the supreme bliss, he should accomplish the universal pervasion of the body of the Victor, which is innate.

original: 233 / sems can rnams la 'chi ster gang de grub pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa mtha' dag bdud rtsi ste //
analyzed: 233 / sems can rnams la 'chi ster gang de grub pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa mtha' dag bdud rtsi ste //
translated: That which kills sentient beings is all consecrated by the mantra of accomplishment as nectar.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub gang zhig bgrod bya min pa de yang srid gsum gnas su bsam gtan bgrod bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub gang zhig bgrod bya min pa de yang srid gsum gnas su bsam gtan bgrod bya'o //
translated: That which is not to be traversed for the desired accomplishment should be traversed in the meditation of the three worlds.

original: ye shes gang zhig rnyed dka' dag kyang rdo rje padmar bde bas byin brlabs rnyed pa sla ba nyid //
analyzed: ye shes gang zhig rnyed dka' dag kyang rdo rje padmar bde bas byin brlabs rnyed pa sla ba nyid //
translated: And the knowledge which is difficult to attain is easily attained by the bliss of the consecration in the vajra and lotus.üîΩThus may the Vajra, the giver of the bliss of the union of the male and female deities, always bestow the bliss of the union of the male and female deities upon all living beings.

original: de lta de ltar rdo rje can te srog chags rnams la thams cad dus su bde mnyam ster gyur cig 234 / sgra gcan me dang zla ba nyi ma bzhi por brjod de sa chu bsreg za rlung dang stong pa gang //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rdo rje can te srog chags rnams la thams cad dus su bde mnyam ster gyur cig 234 / sgra gcan me dang zla ba nyi ma bzhi por brjod de sa chu bsreg za rlung dang stong pa gang //
translated: Rahu, Mars, the Moon, and the Sun are the four, and the four elements are earth, water, fire, and air.

original: lnga po dag go gza' yi tshogs pa cig shos dag ni drug po lhun po 'di yi phyogs rnams su //
analyzed: lnga po dag go gza' yi tshogs pa cig shos dag ni drug po lhun po 'di yi phyogs rnams su //
translated: The five are the five planets, and the other six are the six directions of this world.

original: gling rnams dag ni bzhi por rab tu 'gyur te yul rnams dag ni lnga por phyi rol dag tu gsungs //
analyzed: gling rnams dag ni bzhi por rab tu 'gyur te yul rnams dag ni lnga por phyi rol dag tu gsungs //
translated: The four continents are the four continents, and the five countries are the five external countries.

original: snying stobs la sogs yon tan rnams ni gsum po gzhan pa 'di'o lus kyi dbus su de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs yon tan rnams ni gsum po gzhan pa 'di'o lus kyi dbus su de bzhin nyid /
translated: The three qualities of sattva, etc., are the three, and the body is the middle of the body.

original: 235 / padmar rnam shes dga' ba khrag dang bdud rtsi zhes pa dang por bzhi po dag go de las ni //
analyzed: 235 / padmar rnam shes dga' ba khrag dang bdud rtsi zhes pa dang por bzhi po dag go de las ni //
translated: The consciousness in the lotus is the joy, and the blood and nectar are the first four.

original: gang zhig rus pa la sogs mtha' dag rnams kyang lnga po de nas mig la sogs pa drug po ste //
analyzed: gang zhig rus pa la sogs mtha' dag rnams kyang lnga po de nas mig la sogs pa drug po ste //
translated: The six, the eyes and so forth, are from the five, the bones and so forth.

original: lag pa rkang pa dag ni bzhi po lag pa rkang pa la gnas sor mo rnams ni lnga po'o //
analyzed: lag pa rkang pa dag ni bzhi po lag pa rkang pa la gnas sor mo rnams ni lnga po'o //
translated: The four, the hands and feet, are in the hands and feet. The five are the fingers.

original: de rnams tshigs ni gsum po gang zhig 'dir ni rim pa mtha' dag rigs 'di la ni rig par bya /
analyzed: de rnams tshigs ni gsum po gang zhig 'dir ni rim pa mtha' dag rigs 'di la ni rig par bya /
translated: The three joints are here. All of this should be known in this system.

original: 236 / sa 'dzin de nyid rab dbye rnams dang ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro dang nyi ma nyi shu zhes pa dang // dbye ba drug cu mi rnams dag gi mtha' dag lus la gnas pa bug pa drug dang zla ba'i grangs //
analyzed: 236 / sa 'dzin de nyid rab dbye rnams dang ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro dang nyi ma nyi shu zhes pa dang // dbye ba drug cu mi rnams dag gi mtha' dag lus la gnas pa bug pa drug dang zla ba'i grangs //
translated: The earth-holders, their divisions, the tastes, the tastes transformed by the sun, the twenty suns, the sixty divisions, and the six openings in the entire body of humans, the number of the moon,

original: de dag thams cad bsdus pa sum 'gyur dgu ru 'gyur te lnga bcu rtsa bzhi srog gi rgyu ba dang // gza' rnams dag gi rgyu ba gang de slar yang cig shos rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma yi rgyu bar brjod /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdus pa sum 'gyur dgu ru 'gyur te lnga bcu rtsa bzhi srog gi rgyu ba dang // gza' rnams dag gi rgyu ba gang de slar yang cig shos rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma yi rgyu bar brjod /
translated: all of that, gathered together, is tripled to make nine, the fifty-four movements of the life-force, and the movements of the planets, which are again called the movements of the yoginƒ´s by others.

original: 237 / ye shes nam mkha' gnyis dang slar yang gzhan pa 'di ni theg pa dag dang dkon mchog gsum po yang //
analyzed: 237 / ye shes nam mkha' gnyis dang slar yang gzhan pa 'di ni theg pa dag dang dkon mchog gsum po yang //
translated: Are the vehicles, the Three Jewels,

original: nyon mongs bdud dang gnas rnams dang ni @105a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs bdud dang gnas rnams dang ni @105a * //
translated: The defilements, the demons, the abodes,üîΩAnd also the bases of supernatural power, the outflows,

original: slar yang nges par rdzu 'phrul rkang pa zag pa rnams dag dang // mi 'jigs pa dang bden pa rnams dang slar yang de bzhin dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yang dag par //
analyzed: slar yang nges par rdzu 'phrul rkang pa zag pa rnams dag dang // mi 'jigs pa dang bden pa rnams dang slar yang de bzhin dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yang dag par //
translated: The fearlessnesses, the truths, and also the applications of mindfulness,üîΩThe four means of gathering, the ends, the vajras of the Victorious Lords.

original: bsdu ba bzhi yi mtha' rnams rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: bsdu ba bzhi yi mtha' rnams rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /
translated: The yogin should meditate on them.üîΩThe five kinds of preternatural knowledge, the powers, the views, the five eyes of the Victorious Lords, the supreme,

original: 238 / mngon shes lnga dang stobs dang lta ba rnams dang rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po dag gi spyan lnga dang // de bzhin phung po dbang po dran pa zhes pa drug dang byang chub yan lag bdun dang mchod pa ni //
analyzed: 238 / mngon shes lnga dang stobs dang lta ba rnams dang rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po dag gi spyan lnga dang // de bzhin phung po dbang po dran pa zhes pa drug dang byang chub yan lag bdun dang mchod pa ni //
translated: And likewise the six aggregates, the faculties, and the recollections, the seven limbs of enlightenment, and the offerings,

original: bdun te lam gyi yan lag brgyad rnams so sor legs 'jug gzugs can rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang // bug pa zhes bya yan lag dgu ni gsung rab mchog ste sa rnams dag ni phyogs kyi tshad yin no /üîΩ239 / sangs rgyas rnams kyi phyogs kyi stobs dang gsal bar dbang bcu dang ni yan lag bcu gnyis rten 'brel dag / skye ba ni 'gog pa dag go de bzhin nyis 'gyur dgu ni ma 'dres pa yi sangs rgyas chos //
analyzed: bdun te lam gyi yan lag brgyad rnams so sor legs 'jug gzugs can rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang // bug pa zhes bya yan lag dgu ni gsung rab mchog ste sa rnams dag ni phyogs kyi tshad yin no / 239 / sangs rgyas rnams kyi phyogs kyi stobs dang gsal bar dbang bcu dang ni yan lag bcu gnyis rten 'brel dag / skye ba ni 'gog pa dag go de bzhin nyis 'gyur dgu ni ma 'dres pa yi sangs rgyas chos //
translated: The eight liberations, the nine openings, the ten powers, the twelve members, the twenty-one thousand, the thirty-two, and the eighty minor marks of the Supreme Victor, the Lord,

original: rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po'i mtshan ni sum cu rtsa gnyis dag dang dpe byad rnams kyang brgyad cu ste //
analyzed: rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag po'i mtshan ni sum cu rtsa gnyis dag dang dpe byad rnams kyang brgyad cu ste //
translated: are the stages of the path, the ten grounds, the ten powers, the ten masteries, the twelve members of dependent origination, the twenty-one thousand families of the Tathagata, the thirty-two major marks, and the eighty minor marks of the Supreme Victor, the Lord.

original: khyab bdag mchog gi go 'phang 'di dag mtha' dag sngags pa yis ni lus la bsgom par bya ba yin /
analyzed: khyab bdag mchog gi go 'phang 'di dag mtha' dag sngags pa yis ni lus la bsgom par bya ba yin /
translated: The mantra practitioner should meditate on all these supreme, exalted states within his body.

original: 240 / zla ba'i rang bzhin gcig ste zung dang lag pa mig dang 'khrig pa phyogs dang bgrod pa dag ni gnyis //
analyzed: 240 / zla ba'i rang bzhin gcig ste zung dang lag pa mig dang 'khrig pa phyogs dang bgrod pa dag ni gnyis //
translated: One is of the nature of the moon, two are the pair, two are the hands, two are the eyes, two are the eyebrows, two are the directions, and two are the feet.

original: 'jig rten dus dang yon tan me ni gsum mo chu gter dus dang rig byed dag ni bzhi ru brjod //
analyzed: 'jig rten dus dang yon tan me ni gsum mo chu gter dus dang rig byed dag ni bzhi ru brjod //
translated: The world, time, and the qualities are three; the ocean, time, and the Vedas are said to be four.üîΩThe arrow, the elements, and the senses are definitely five; the tastes and the seasons are six.

original: mda' dang 'byung ba dbang po rnams ni nges par lnga ru rab tu 'gyur te ro dang dus ni drug / gza' dang ri bo thub pa zhes pa bdun gyi grangs te de bzhin klu dang nor ni brgyad yin no /
analyzed: mda' dang 'byung ba dbang po rnams ni nges par lnga ru rab tu 'gyur te ro dang dus ni drug / gza' dang ri bo thub pa zhes pa bdun gyi grangs te de bzhin klu dang nor ni brgyad yin no /
translated: The planets, the mountains, and the sages are the number seven; the nƒÅgas and the treasures are eight.

original: 241 / rtsa dang bug pa gza' dang gter yang dgu ste phyogs ni bcu dang dbang phyug dag ni bcu gcig go //
analyzed: 241 / rtsa dang bug pa gza' dang gter yang dgu ste phyogs ni bcu dang dbang phyug dag ni bcu gcig go //
translated: The channels, the orifices, the planets, and the treasures are nine; the directions are ten; and the lords are eleven.

original: nyi ma lus med ma nu srid pa gang dang tshes dang mi bdag bcu gnyis nas ni re re 'phel //
analyzed: nyi ma lus med ma nu srid pa gang dang tshes dang mi bdag bcu gnyis nas ni re re 'phel //
translated: The sun, the body, the manes, existence, the lunar days, and the kings are twelve; each increases by one.

original: nyes pa 'di dag bco brgyad yin te rgyal ba mchog ni ma lus de rnams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di dag bco brgyad yin te rgyal ba mchog ni ma lus de rnams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the eighteen faults; the supreme victor is all of them, twenty-four.

original: de nyid ces grags nyi shu rtsa lnga yin te gnyis skyes zhes pa sum cu rtsa gnyis nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid ces grags nyi shu rtsa lnga yin te gnyis skyes zhes pa sum cu rtsa gnyis nyid du 'gyur /
translated: That which is renowned as reality is twenty-five; that which is called the dvayotpatti is thirty-two.

original: 242 / rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad dag tu nges par rdo rje'i tshigs ni rdo rje can gyis sbas pa ste //
analyzed: 242 / rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad dag tu nges par rdo rje'i tshigs ni rdo rje can gyis sbas pa ste //
translated: In all the kings of tantras, the vajra verses are certainly hidden by the Vajra Holder.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i slad du ma lus pa yang mngon @105b sum gsungs //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i slad du ma lus pa yang mngon @105b sum gsungs //
translated: In the Adibuddha, they are all declared in the presence of living beings for the sake of their liberation.

original: de phyir 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa dag las mtha' dag  mtshang med pa'i rgyu ni bla ma ste //
analyzed: de phyir 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa dag las mtha' dag  mtshang med pa'i rgyu ni bla ma ste //
translated: Therefore, the guru is the cause of all mundane and supramundane attainments.

original: dpal ldan rgyud ni dang po'i sangs rgyas mtha' dag rgyal ba'i bdag po'i mngon par brjod pa zla ba bzang /
analyzed: dpal ldan rgyud ni dang po'i sangs rgyas mtha' dag rgyal ba'i bdag po'i mngon par brjod pa zla ba bzang /
translated: The glorious tantra, the Adibuddha, is the excellent moon of the expression of all the lords of the victors.üîΩIt has no beginning, end, or middle, no place, death, existence, sound, smell, taste,

original: 243 / gang la thog mtha' dbus med gnas dang 'chi dang srid pa dang ni sgra dang dri dang ro dag dang // reg bya gzugs dang sems med rang bzhin dang ni skyes bu med cing 'ching grol dang byed po med //
analyzed: 243 / gang la thog mtha' dbus med gnas dang 'chi dang srid pa dang ni sgra dang dri dang ro dag dang // reg bya gzugs dang sems med rang bzhin dang ni skyes bu med cing 'ching grol dang byed po med //
translated: touch, form, or mind. It has no nature, no person, no bondage, liberation, or creator.

original: sa bon dang ni gsal ba'i dus med mtha' dag srid par sdug bsngal bde ba nyid kyi rang bzhin med //
analyzed: sa bon dang ni gsal ba'i dus med mtha' dag srid par sdug bsngal bde ba nyid kyi rang bzhin med //
translated: It has no seed or manifest time. It has no nature of suffering or happiness in all existences.

original: mya ngan 'das pa mtshan ma med cing byed pa rnam gral yon tan med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mtshan ma med cing byed pa rnam gral yon tan med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: Homage to the one who is beyond sorrow, who is without characteristics, who is free from action, and who is without qualities.

original: 244 / dus dang sna tshogs la sogs rdo rje skyes bu dpe zla med cing thams cad du 'gro spros pa med //
analyzed: 244 / dus dang sna tshogs la sogs rdo rje skyes bu dpe zla med cing thams cad du 'gro spros pa med //
translated: The vajra being, who is beyond time and variety, is without compare, is omnipresent, and is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: brtsegs pa la gnas rna ba sna dang kha dang mig dang mgo ste thams cad nas ni phyag dang zhabs //
analyzed: brtsegs pa la gnas rna ba sna dang kha dang mig dang mgo ste thams cad nas ni phyag dang zhabs //
translated: He is the one who is based in the peak, who is the ear, the nose, the mouth, the eyes, and the head, and who is the one with hands and feet everywhere.

original: 'byung ba'i mtha' ste 'byung po'i mgon po srid pa gsum po mchog 'dzin rgyu rnams dag gi rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtha' ste 'byung po'i mgon po srid pa gsum po mchog 'dzin rgyu rnams dag gi rgyur gyur pa //
translated: He is the end of the elements, the lord of beings, the one who holds the three worlds in supremacy, and the cause of all causes.

original: rig pa la sogs rnal 'byor dag gi bgrod bya mchog bde'i go 'phang dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal /
analyzed: rig pa la sogs rnal 'byor dag gi bgrod bya mchog bde'i go 'phang dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal /
translated: I pay homage to KƒÅlacakra, the supreme state of bliss, the one who is to be traversed by the yogis of awareness and so forth.

original: 245 / spro byed nus pa'i ngo bo glog gi me dang mtshungs shing nyi ma bcu gnyis dag gi gzi brjid can //
analyzed: 245 / spro byed nus pa'i ngo bo glog gi me dang mtshungs shing nyi ma bcu gnyis dag gi gzi brjid can //
translated: He is the one who has the nature of the ability to emanate, who is like the fire of lightning, and who has the splendor of twelve suns.

original: ye shes rdo rje'i snang ba mchog gi go 'phang bgrod byed rnam par bcad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje'i snang ba mchog gi go 'phang bgrod byed rnam par bcad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is the state of the supreme appearance of the vajra of wisdom, the one who is to be traversed by the one who is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: dkar po 'jig rten gsum gyi mgon bo ri bong 'dzin pa las 'jig 'jig rten spyi bor yang dag gnas //
analyzed: dkar po 'jig rten gsum gyi mgon bo ri bong 'dzin pa las 'jig 'jig rten spyi bor yang dag gnas //
translated: I bow to the white one, the protector of the three worlds, who is situated on the crown of the head of the world, who is the moon,

original: bdud rtsi 'chi ba sel zhing sred pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms par byed pa thig le'i gzugs la phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'chi ba sel zhing sred pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms par byed pa thig le'i gzugs la phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: who is the bindu form, the nectar that removes death and conquers the fear of craving.

original: 246 / sems tsam sngags kyi ngo bo lha yis yongs su bskor ba sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: 246 / sems tsam sngags kyi ngo bo lha yis yongs su bskor ba sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i rang bzhin te //
translated: I bow to the essence of mind only, mantra, and deity, which is surrounded by the nature of suffering and happiness,

original: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs ni rang gis byas pa'i nyams myong mi zad rnams la mi bzad pa //
analyzed: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs ni rang gis byas pa'i nyams myong mi zad rnams la mi bzad pa //
translated: which is the peaceful form for the sublime ones, and the unbearable form for those who experience the exhaustion of one's own actions.

original: gang gis las gang rab byas rang gi sems la cho ga bzhin du de yi 'bras bu de skyed pa //
analyzed: gang gis las gang rab byas rang gi sems la cho ga bzhin du de yi 'bras bu de skyed pa //
translated: Whatever action is performed, the result of that is generated in one's mind according to the rite.

original: 'jig rten dbang po sna tshogs gzugs can srid gsum skyed mdzad rdo rje sems dpa' la yang phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po sna tshogs gzugs can srid gsum skyed mdzad rdo rje sems dpa' la yang phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: I also bow to Vajrasattva, the lord of the world, who has various forms, and who creates the three existences.

original: 247 / gcig dang du ma dag kyang gcig cing mnyam dang mi mnyam mnyam pa g-yas dang g-yon dang mdun dang rgyab //
analyzed: 247 / gcig dang du ma dag kyang gcig cing mnyam dang mi mnyam mnyam pa g-yas dang g-yon dang mdun dang rgyab //
translated: One and many are one, equal and unequal are equal, right and left, front and back,

original: steng 'og kun nas dkar ljang sna tshogs kha dog chen po gcig gi gzugs te thung ngu @106a * //
analyzed: steng 'og kun nas dkar ljang sna tshogs kha dog chen po gcig gi gzugs te thung ngu @106a * //
translated: Above and below, all around, in the form of a great multicolored light, short,

original: ring po dang // shin tu ring po yon tan med ces yon tan dang bcas bud med skyes pa'ang skyes pa bud med min //
analyzed: ring po dang // shin tu ring po yon tan med ces yon tan dang bcas bud med skyes pa'ang skyes pa bud med min //
translated: long, and very long, without qualities, and with qualities, neither female nor male,

original: gang zhig kun gyi rten gcig bha ga bzang mo mchog gi bha ga khyod la 'dud de khyod la 'dud /
analyzed: gang zhig kun gyi rten gcig bha ga bzang mo mchog gi bha ga khyod la 'dud de khyod la 'dud /
translated: I bow to you, Bhaga, the one support of all, the supreme, excellent Bhaga.

original: 248 / gang zhig mi yi 'jig rten dag na dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje 'dzin pa sdig bral de bdag ste //
analyzed: 248 / gang zhig mi yi 'jig rten dag na dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje 'dzin pa sdig bral de bdag ste //
translated: I am the one who is free from sin in the world of humans, the glorious guru, the vajra-holder.

original: de la gnod pa byas pas srog chags rnams ni nges par dmyal bar 'gyur te 'di la ngo mtshar med //
analyzed: de la gnod pa byas pas srog chags rnams ni nges par dmyal bar 'gyur te 'di la ngo mtshar med //
translated: Those who harm him will certainly go to hell, there is no doubt about this.

original: de mnyes pa yis bdag ni mgu ste de la khro ba'i me yis khros pa zhes pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de mnyes pa yis bdag ni mgu ste de la khro ba'i me yis khros pa zhes pa chen po'o //
translated: I am pleased by his satisfaction, and angry by the fire of anger towards him.

original: de nyid sems can rnams la thar pa bde mnyam 'bras ster bu rnams dag gi phyag 'os mchod 'os so /
analyzed: de nyid sems can rnams la thar pa bde mnyam 'bras ster bu rnams dag gi phyag 'os mchod 'os so /
translated: He alone is worthy of the homage and worship of beings, the giver of the fruit of liberation and bliss to his children.

original: 249 / sdig can gang yin gang zhig dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs pad bzang po dag la dus gsum phyag mi byed //
analyzed: 249 / sdig can gang yin gang zhig dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs pad bzang po dag la dus gsum phyag mi byed //
translated: The sinful one is he who does not pay homage to the lotus feet of the glorious guru three times a day.

original: mi shes gang yin gang zhig rnam mang me tog rnams kyis dus gsum du ni mandala mi byed pa //
analyzed: mi shes gang yin gang zhig rnam mang me tog rnams kyis dus gsum du ni mandala mi byed pa //
translated: The ignorant one is he who does not make a mandala offering three times a day with many flowers.

original: myur du mnar med 'gro ba gang yin gang zhig bde mnyam ster byed bla ma skyo ba skyed pa po //
analyzed: myur du mnar med 'gro ba gang yin gang zhig bde mnyam ster byed bla ma skyo ba skyed pa po //
translated: The one who quickly goes to Avici is he who causes the guru, who bestows the bliss of equality, to become weary.

original: shes rab ye shes thob pa gang yin ma nyams gang zhig mchog gi bla ma'i zhabs ni mi spong ba /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes thob pa gang yin ma nyams gang zhig mchog gi bla ma'i zhabs ni mi spong ba /
translated: The one who obtains the wisdom of wisdom is he who does not abandon the feet of the supreme guru.

original: 250 / nyams pa gang yin gang zhig rtsa gsum dag la gnas pa'i rlung ni mtha' yas dus su bsad pa'o //
analyzed: 250 / nyams pa gang yin gang zhig rtsa gsum dag la gnas pa'i rlung ni mtha' yas dus su bsad pa'o //
translated: The one who is ruined is he who kills the infinite winds that abide in the three nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s.

original: dpa' bo gang yin gang zhig mnyam dang mi mnyam lam la srog dang thung sel rlung ni gsod byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo gang yin gang zhig mnyam dang mi mnyam lam la srog dang thung sel rlung ni gsod byed pa'o //
translated: The hero is he who kills the life-sustaining wind on the path of sameness and non-sameness.

original: sbyin bdag gang yin gang zhig dpal ldan bla mar rang lus bu dang chung ma la sogs thams cad ster //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gang yin gang zhig dpal ldan bla mar rang lus bu dang chung ma la sogs thams cad ster //
translated: The benefactor is he who offers his body, children, wife, and all to the glorious guru.

original: ma rabs gang yin gang zhig slu byed rang gi snying gi sdig pas drangs pa'i sems dang g-yo sgyu can /
analyzed: ma rabs gang yin gang zhig slu byed rang gi snying gi sdig pas drangs pa'i sems dang g-yo sgyu can /
translated: The wicked, who are deceived by the sin of their own hearts, are deceitful and fraudulent.

original: 251 / dpal ldan dpal gyi chos kyi 'khor lo lha yi mchog gis btud pa'i gdan ni kha dog sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: 251 / dpal ldan dpal gyi chos kyi 'khor lo lha yi mchog gis btud pa'i gdan ni kha dog sna tshogs pa //
translated: The seat of the glorious Dharmacakra, bowed to by the best of gods, is multicolored.

original: de la sangs rgyas lha dang mi yi bla ma nye bar bzhugs pas zla ba'i zhu ba rtogs pa na //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas lha dang mi yi bla ma nye bar bzhugs pas zla ba'i zhu ba rtogs pa na //
translated: When the request of the moon is understood, The Buddha, the teacher of gods and men, is seated there,

original: sems can don gyi slad du mi yi bdag po rgyud kyi rgyal po dang po'i sangs rgyas gsungs pa gang //
analyzed: sems can don gyi slad du mi yi bdag po rgyud kyi rgyal po dang po'i sangs rgyas gsungs pa gang //
translated: the king of tantras, the first Buddha, the lord of men, has spoken for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de yang da lta bdag gis de rnams a'a li k'a li nyung ngu'i rgyud du bkod do nyi ma kye /
analyzed: de yang da lta bdag gis de rnams a'a li k'a li nyung ngu'i rgyud du bkod do nyi ma kye /
translated: And now I have set them forth in the short Tantra of the Ali Kali, O Sun!

original: 252 / sangs rgyas kyis ni gsungs pa dag las dus kyi 'khor lo bdag gis phreng 'dzin sdeb sbyor bcings pas brjod //
analyzed: 252 / sangs rgyas kyis ni gsungs pa dag las dus kyi 'khor lo bdag gis phreng 'dzin sdeb sbyor bcings pas brjod //
translated: From the teachings of the Buddha, I, the Kalacakra, have composed this garland of verses.

original: padma dkar po rdo rje 'dzin pa khyod kyis 'di ni sngags pa rnams la bstan pa nyid du mdzod //
analyzed: padma dkar po rdo rje 'dzin pa khyod kyis 'di ni sngags pa rnams la bstan pa nyid du mdzod //
translated: O Vajradhara, you, the white lotus, should teach this to the mantrins.

original: ji ltar nyi ma dang bcas thub pa'i rigs ni shes rab ye shes @106b thob pa 'di las byung gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma dang bcas thub pa'i rigs ni shes rab ye shes @106b thob pa 'di las byung gyur pa //
translated: Just as the family of the sun-like sages has arisen from this attainment of the wisdom of insight,üîΩmay beings dwelling in the three worlds become like that through the kindness of the Wheel of Time.

original: rnam gsum srid pa la gnas sems can rnams ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i drin las de bzhin 'gyur bar shog 253 / nyi ma khyod dam mi dbang phyi mar gyur pa'i srid par dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor gcig las ni //
analyzed: rnam gsum srid pa la gnas sems can rnams ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i drin las de bzhin 'gyur bar shog 253 / nyi ma khyod dam mi dbang phyi mar gyur pa'i srid par dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor gcig las ni //
translated: Whether you become the sun or a future lord of men, through the yoga of the Wheel of Time,

original: tshangs pa'i rigs 'di las skyes mi yi bdag po grags pa bdag ni 'jam dbyangs bdag gi dga' ma ni //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i rigs 'di las skyes mi yi bdag po grags pa bdag ni 'jam dbyangs bdag gi dga' ma ni //
translated: born from this family of Brahma, O lord of men, I, Yashodhara, am Manjushri's beloved.

original: dpal ldan sgrol ma pad dkar can ni yon tan kun ster 'jig rten mgon po chu skyes mtshan ma can //üîΩautpala sdong bu yis ni rang gzhan la gnas srid pa thams cad don ni ji lta bzhin du ltos /
analyzed: dpal ldan sgrol ma pad dkar can ni yon tan kun ster 'jig rten mgon po chu skyes mtshan ma can // autpala sdong bu yis ni rang gzhan la gnas srid pa thams cad don ni ji lta bzhin du ltos /
translated: The glorious Tara, the lotus-born one, bestows all qualities, the world protector, the one with the lotus mark,üîΩsees all existences, whether in oneself or others, just as they are, with the stem of the lotus.

original: 254 / autpala sdong bu yis ni rang gzhan la gnas srid pa thams cad don ni ji lta bzhin mthong nas //
analyzed: 254 / autpala sdong bu yis ni rang gzhan la gnas srid pa thams cad don ni ji lta bzhin mthong nas //
translated: Having seen all existences, whether in oneself or others, just as they are, with the stem of the lotus,

original: thub pa'i dbang po rnams dang lhan cig nyi mas cod pan bcas pa'i mgo dang lag pa dag gis ni //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po rnams dang lhan cig nyi mas cod pan bcas pa'i mgo dang lag pa dag gis ni //
translated: together with the Lords of the Sages, with heads and hands crowned by the sun,

original: rigs ldan zhabs kyi padmar phyag dag 'tshal nas smras pa ston pa gcig pu mchog gi thugs rje yis //
analyzed: rigs ldan zhabs kyi padmar phyag dag 'tshal nas smras pa ston pa gcig pu mchog gi thugs rje yis //
translated: having bowed to the lotus feet of the Sage, they said: ‚ÄúBy the compassion of the Sole Supreme Teacher,

original: thub pa'i rigs ni 'jigs rung 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dag las phyung nas ye shes lam la gzhag par mdzod /
analyzed: thub pa'i rigs ni 'jigs rung 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dag las phyung nas ye shes lam la gzhag par mdzod /
translated: may the Sage‚Äôs family be drawn out of the terrifying suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra and placed on the path of wisdom.

original: 255 / khyod ni rgan yang gzhon nu mtha' dag rgyal ba'i sras po yin yang thog mar dang po'i sangs rgyas khyod //
analyzed: 255 / khyod ni rgan yang gzhon nu mtha' dag rgyal ba'i sras po yin yang thog mar dang po'i sangs rgyas khyod //
translated: You are old, yet you are the first Buddha, all young victors‚Äô sons, yet you are the first Buddha.

original: bud med sbyor zhing tshangs par spyod ldan mchog gi thugs rje dag gis 'jig rten gnyen te gshin rje'i dgra //
analyzed: bud med sbyor zhing tshangs par spyod ldan mchog gi thugs rje dag gis 'jig rten gnyen te gshin rje'i dgra //
translated: You are a friend of the world, a foe of Yama, with supreme compassion, engaged in union with women, yet celibate.
